name: Northern Shore
description: The lake gives way to a slightly sandy and rocky shore. It is dotted with small shrubs and a few trees, but mostly it is a fairly open expanse. It is covered in places by a green short grass. The lake level falls away swiftly from the beach going from a few feet to well over ten feet in a short span.
background: The northern shore is a common place for locals to come cool off on warm days. It also serves as a place where women will wash their clothes and any other dirty linens they may have. This is somewhat of a sacred place for a few, mainly those who worship the water gods, as they have erected a small alter to them just off the water.

travel_descriptions.south: You leave the rocky shore, descending into the refreshing, clear lake. Cool water splashes around your ankles, growing deeper as you venture further. The sun glistens off the crystal clear water, creating a beautiful reflective surface. Fishes dart beneath the surface, their scales catching the sunlight as they move.

name: Lake
description: The beautiful lake glistens in the sun as water can be seen in all directions. you can see several feet beneath the water because it is so clear.
background: The lake is not only beautiful, but gives life to the surrounding area. With fish and shell fish this lake provides a whole eco system unique to its own.

travel_descriptions.north: To reach the Northern Shore, one must cross the lake, relishing the serene ambience as the water gently laps against the boat.
travel_descriptions.south: Journey to the Drinking Water Lake is through a path lined with rich and vibrant flora that seem to dance in the gentle breeze.
travel_descriptions.east: Navigating towards the Dock requires maneuvering the boat skillfully amidst the sprawling lake, under the watchful eyes of the local fishermen.

name: Drinking Water Lake
description: Surrounded by skittering chipmunks and chirping crickets, the drinking lake teems with life. Flora and fauna both thrive near the pristine waters. Tall thick plant life surrounds the lake, with strong roots and stems protruding from the nutrient rich soil. The lake water shimmers in the sun, so clear and clean that one can see the rock lake floor many feet below.
background: Rumored by local peasantry to be blessed by the gods, the drinking water lake is a source of clean drinking water for local townspeople. While slightly farther for most villagers than the local river, the water is highly prized for its cleanliness and perceived mystical qualities. Some believe that the entire forest surrounding the lake owes its growth to the divine properties in the water.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey north to the Lake is a progress through dense woodland, the air growing fresher with each step as the scent of the lake greets you.
travel_descriptions.west: To traverse west to Brim Canal, you have to tread across uneven terrain, filled with sounds of active wildlife, before the serene flow of the canal comes into sight.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east to The Swimming Hole involves strolling along a tranquil forest trail, the chatter of birds and cicadas leading the way to the sounds of playful splashing.

name: Dock
description: The wood used to make the dock is of highest quality, commissioned from trees that stand towering in the local forests. Despite time having passed it has been taken care of to the point where even a hint of warping from the water beneath will have a plank torn and replaced within a night.
background: The dock was first built to help with trade from a village across its expanse, making it easier to go through rather then around. However it also made a convenient launching points for fishermen who could bring in a number of odd fish from the lake's center most expanse.

travel_descriptions.west: Traversing the wooden dock, you approach the vast, tranquil lake. Your journey is filled with the eerie calm of the water's surface, and the shimmering reflection of the sun is an enchanting sight to behold.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south from the dock, you encounter the slow, meandering Brim Canal. The sight of different fish species swimming lazily and the beautifully lined rocks at its edges makes the walk an invigorating experience.

name: Brim Canal
description: Slow flowing branching from the large lake, is the brim canal where dozens and dozens of brim fish call it home. The edges are lined with irregular rocks and lush green vegetation. Tall pine trees overlook the canal and lake making it a peaceful place to just go sick and watch the brim swim by.
background: The canal has been the preferred spot for the few local folk to come and gather water, wash some clothes, catch fish, and go swimming. In the canal there is no current like there is out in the main lake and there is shade by the trees on either side of the canal. The canal was formed thousands of years ago when a major earthquake made a rocky edge of the lake crack, allowing water to flow in and eventually separate the two sides even wider.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north from Brim Canal, you pass by rich forests as you head towards the Dock. The smell of fresh pine and lake water is invigorating.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east from Brim Canal to Drinking Water Lake, the change in environment is noticeable. The sounds of skittering wildlife increase, and the air becomes clearer and more refreshing.

name: The Swimming Hole
description: The swimming hole is calm and clear.  The sun sparkles off the ripples that form on the surface of the water.  Fish occasionally jump from the water and splash back in.
background: The swimming hole is a favorite place of the young lads.  It is a cool, refreshing place to relax.  On a normal day, you can hear the screams and laughter of the children and young men as they swim and frollick.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west towards Drinking Water Lake, the path leads through a dense forest filled with the sounds of wildlife. There's a refreshing smell of the lake in the distance which intensifies as you get closer.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving south towards the Island, you paddle across a calm lake. The wind whispers through the trees on the shores while water splashes gently against your boat.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east to Lakeside House, you follow a well-trodden path. The wilderness gives way to meticulously kept grounds and the peaceful quiet of the lake area is softly replaced by faint sounds of serenades from the house.

name: Island
description: This island is located in the center of a lake. It is smaller than a ship and covered in moss.
background: This island is an emergency refuge for those on the run or whose boats have capsized.

travel_descriptions.north: You wade through the cold and refreshing water, the gentle waves lapping at your thighs as you head towards the Swimming Hole. The joyful splash and laughter from children echo in the distance.
travel_descriptions.west: You mount on the abandoned raft, gently paddling towards the Lakeside House. The scenic beauty of lush greenery surrounding the vibrant white house soothes your senses as you approach it.

name: Lakeside House
description: Its white and vibrant, certainly a location for some lord, It has 3 floors, and fine gardening surround the house. Its open and breezy this place is calm and peaceful.
background: The vacation home of a humble knight. He returns here after long journeys to recoup and introspect. he sometimes throws extravagant parties for his trusted friends.

travel_descriptions.west: To reach the Swimming Hole from the Lakeside House, you must take a leisurely walk along the tree-lined path that's filled with the sweet scent of spring flowers. The journey is peaceful with the soft sway of oak and willow branches echoing the tranquillity.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the Lakeside House, you will tread the cobblestone track that stretches up to the Launching Point. You can feel the excitement growing in the air as you approach the bustling site of seafarers and freshly built vessels ready to embark on their voyage.

name: Launching Point
description: The Launching point features a number of large wooden planks sitting at a downward slope going straight into the water.  On each side of the launching point there sits a large, ornate bronze figure of a light house that is used to tether the ships to the dock and keep them from casting away while the sailors prepare to board the ship. The launching point is very narrow, with large stone braces on either side of the dock.
background: The Launching point is where newly constructed ships are cast out to see. The wooden slide is used to help catapult the ships into water, and it's narrow design keeps them from tipping when the force of the ship hits the water.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey north to the Lakeside House is scenic, with a trail that meanders through fields of vivid wildflowers and the occasional grove of towering evergreens. The air becomes fresher and cooler as you approach the house.
travel_descriptions.west: Travelling west to the Clean Water Lake, the path winds through a lush forest. The sounds of chirping birds and rustling leaves accompany you as the path slopes gently downwards towards the tranquil waters of the lake.

name: Clean Water Lake
description: The lake is crystal clear, lined with trees, to the far back of the lake there's a small formation of rocks almost like a small waterfall allowing water to flow into the lake. It's quite beautiful, the sun bathing the surrounding area in a warmth so comforting you could easily fall asleep on the shore. There's an old wooden bath, for its age it seems to look like almost new, and rarely used. There are no animals nearby except for birds softly chirping in the trees.
background: The area was first found by an old couple that used to live by, on a now abandoned homestead. They set up a bath tub so that they could boil water and take a nice bath together overlooking the surrounding area. They offered it to travelers as a way to relax if they so happened to travel by their home.

travel_descriptions.east: Traversing to the east through lush trees and over a small hill, one finds themselves at the famed Launching Point, an exciting spectacle of human ingenuity.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south takes you through a half mile of dense, dark woods before you see a slight glimmer of water in the distance - you have reached the enigmatic Lagoon.

name: The Lagoon
description: The Lagoon is a dark and mysterious place during the night hours.  A lot of moss and lily pads surround the shore.  The water is very murky.
background: The Lagoon has been a place of a lot of mystery, a lot of rumors surround it.  Many say it is the scene of a lot of mystical miracles and also at the same time where a lot of townsfolk go missing.

travel_descriptions.north: It's a calming journey as you traverse through the greenery encasing the route towards the Clean Water Lake. The squelch of the damp land beneath your feet is a pleasant contrast to the eerie Lagoon.
travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west, the path narrows into a winding trail. The sounds of water slapping on wooden hulls and distant chatter become gradually louder, signifying your approach to the Fishing Shack.

name: Fishing Shack
description: The fishing shack is a small wooden structure that is crudely built and is surrounded by boats. The wood flooring around the shack is well weathered and often used.
background: The fishing shack is a popular place for the village people to gather. Early in the morning, one can find many people standing by with their fishing poles  trying to catch the day's food.

travel_descriptions.east: Moving east from the shack, you feel the ground become softer and squishier as the earth gives way to the silty shores of The Lagoon. As you approach, a chilling mist rises from its surface, creating an air of mystique and danger.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you follow a well-worn trail created by the footsteps of seasoned fishermen. The soft, rhythmic lapping of water grows stronger as you approach the deceptive calmness of the Fishing Dock.

name: Fishing Dock
description: Folks call the area a Lake, but it's more like a pond.  Small and unimportant looking, yet peaceful.  The dock is no prize winner either.  Narrow in width, boards broken with several down right missing all together!  No tree nearby, no canopy, nothing to shade oneself on a hot day while fishing.  The watering hole may look small in size, but it deceives the eyes.  The water is as deep as the heavens.  No man knows what lurks beyond the light in this Lake.
background: Once used as a swimming hole by a nearby village, the lake has been scrubbed from history.  Many tales of children and entire families going missing from the lake.  Some travelers even insist they saw creatures coming out of the lake from within the depths.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking from the dock up to the fishing shack, you tread across old wooden planks, weathered from winds and waves. Hear the rhythm of lapping water become gradually replaced by the chatter of villagers, their silhouettes appearing ahead in the shack.

name: Beside Tower Entrance
description: A bland and not very imposing door is the only means by which one exits the tower. There is nothing special about the entrance - it is a simple stone arch. A broom and mop bucket are next to the door that leads to the outdoors.
background: The inside of the tower is very bare. The tower itself is just a means for the king's archers to get up high and rain hell down upon his enemies. No one really goes in there often. It is plain and serves its purpose well.

travel_descriptions.north: Journeying north towards the Wizard's Tower, you navigate through narrow, winding paths lined with ancient, ageless trees that sway gently in the breeze. A faint scent of old parchment, ink, and an unidentifiable blend of herbs fills the air as you approach.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east to the Tower is a steady uphill climb along a dusty road. The path is punctuated by the occasional obstacle—a makeshift barricade here, a cluster of guards idling there. The presence of the Tower looms ever larger as you pass under its formidable shadow.

name: Sewer Entrance
description: There is no treasure to be found here. All you see is filth. Dirty murky water and fumes rising from it burns your eyes. You see animals roaming around. Are they small dogs? No they are rodents, big rats. They glisten with the filth they are covered with. It is dark and difficult to see much else.
background: Something tells me you don't want to know much of why it smells so bad down here.

travel_descriptions.up: Navigating away from this revolting location means moving through the bland door of the tower. You are relieved of the filthy stench as you make your way upwards.
travel_descriptions.inside: Moving deeper into the sludge filled maze of the tower sewers, you detest the repugnant odours while fighting your disdain towards the scavenging rats and the sight of ill-fated treasure seekers.

name: Princess' Chamber
description: This chamber is the bedroom of a princess who lives in the castle. The bedroom is very luxurious and ornate, with a soft bed piled in quilts and a nice warm fire place adorned with trinkets. On the floor there is a big rug with a beautiful design. On the wall, there is a tapestry depicting a romantic looking garden scene. There are some fresh flowers on a table near the bed. There is one big window framed with heavy drapes near the bed.
background: The bedroom was originally simple quarters for various nobility, but the princess thought that living in one of the towers seemed very fun and so the king arranged for her chamber to be set up in the tower. He paid for all of the finest items to furnish the room with. The princess had been living there for almost ten years now.

travel_descriptions.east: The journey to the King's Quarters from the Princess's Chamber gives a sense of heading into the heart of royal luxury itself, passing the grand tapestries and descending the marble staircase, providing a regal ambiance.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving south towards the Gold Room, one would tread lightly on the polished stone floor, under arching stone doorways and down a narrow, winding staircase, giving an intriguing air of secrecy and splendor.

name: Gold Room
description: A hidden room, the Gold Room is adorned with gold candle fixtures on either side, and a gold plated wooden table in the center. Riches lay all around the room and on top of the table. Here can be found the crowns of past kings and the royalty of conquered nations.
background: The Gold Room is where the current Monarchs store their prizes from conquest and their most prized possessions. The location is forbidden by the general public, and hidden to all but the Monarchy's most trusted servants.

travel_descriptions.south: Descend a short staircase into the Dining Hall. Rich aromas of food mingle with the subtle scent of burning candles. The murmur of a gathered crowd fills your ears.

name: Arsenal
description: Arsenal is a vast room of military equipment, it is made of stone, and there are shelves and table and organized things. Crossbows hang on the wall, and there is a sort of umbrella stand, but it's full of swords, and there is Armour in large bins accordion to size, and at one end is a row of trebuchets and even catapults, and torches and spears are in a big pile
background: This is a room created out of necessity. It's to store the armaments and battling rams and things so they don't get all rusted and they can keep it organized, not much to see here, it's a storage facility

travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, the room gradually opens up to The Armory. You can hear the distant clanking of metal, and the air grows denser with the smell of stone and cold iron.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you encounter a long corridor that leads to the Artillery Room. The smell of gunpowder starts to permeate the air as the sound of soldiers on alert grows louder.

name: Bathroom
description: Small and cozy, but dripping with luxurious linens and speckled with ornate fixtures this bathroom is a paradise. The small room is non-traditional in the sense that there is no toilet or sink, only a relatively enormous claw foot tub. The feet are gilded and the tub itself is pristine and white. The wallpaper is floral and warm, the rugs lush, and the mirror flattering.
background: The bathroom oasis is the best kept secret in the tower. There are regular restrooms, but this special tub-room is only for those who stumble upon it. Down a rarely used hallway many must assume its storage closet or something as equally mundane.

travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping into the centerpiece tub feels like dipping into a pool of tranquility. As the warm water envelops you, the outside world and its troubles seem to melt away.

name: Tub
description: This tub has powerful jets which gently massage your back and shoulders as you lay back in them. It's deep enough to cover your entire body with water, but no too deep that you feel like you are swimming. There is also a handy shelf upon which to place a book or drink.
background: The tub is a magical place that instantly whisks away any negaitve thoughts you had before climbing into it. The king uses it to feel refreshed and energized after difficult days dealing with the problems of his subjects and staff. It is a hidden secret reserved only for the King.

travel_descriptions.out: Stepping out of the comforting warm water, you wrap yourself in a plush towel. As you step over the edge of the tub, the outside world feels suddenly colder. Walking towards the door, the polished marble floors make a smooth, cooling contrast compared to the warm water you just left.

name: Jail Room
description: Stark and dank, the jail cell is tiny and scary. It has no windows and just had solid stone walls on all sides. There is no bed, and only a small metal bucket to take care of needs.
background: The jail cell has been home to many criminals of many different types. Serious offenders may stay years while someone who inhibits too much may stay a night. It is said to be haunted by those who inhabited it before and villagers scare their children into behaving by telling them about it.

travel_descriptions.north: Climbing the narrow spiral staircase that leads to the Prison Room from the Jail Room makes one feel like they're ascending into a cloudy oblivion, the stone steps eroded by the heavy footsteps of countless unfortunate souls.
travel_descriptions.outside: Making your way out to the Jail Entrance from the Jail Room feels like emerging from the depth of darkness, only to be met by a daunting sight of towering walls and watchful guards, a hostile reminder that freedom is still beyond reach.

name: Inside The King'S Castle
description: A highly fortified tower, one of the tallest in the land, about 50 square feet wide and 300 meters in height. It is constructed with the finest Ethery Stone, which is grey with hints of black tar. Some cracks appear on the west side of the Tower after years of wear and tear.
background: Located right in the center of Kings Castle, this Tower was constructed after the first Barbarian Assault, for which the Kings Guard had not seen due to a surprise attack at night. The purpose of making this Tower was so that future attackers could be seen with greater ease.

travel_descriptions.west: From the tower, you journey west towards the Great Hall. The long corridor lined with medieval tapestry brings you to the grand oaken doors of the Hall.
travel_descriptions.east: To head towards the Keep, you traverse the two winding serpentine corridors, moving east. As you journey, the steel-gray walls and the old iron smell of the Keep begin to take over.
travel_descriptions.up: To ascend to the top of the tower, you travel up the winding spiral staircase. The grooves in the hard granite steps are worn from centuries of foot traffic. The air gets subsequently chillier as you ascend further.

name: Entryway To The Wizards Tower
description: The Wizard tower is cluttered with book shelves and wooden tables. Every shelf is filled to the brim with books, stacked vertically and horizontally in every which way, and books lay scattered across the tables falling onto the cold stone floors below. There sit's a shelf with a variety of strange potions and powders, as well as various wands.
background: The Wizard's tower is where the town mystics go to study their craft and  cast incantations at the behest of the townsfolk. It also serves as a library for curious towns members.

travel_descriptions.inside: The walls and are made of marble and trimmed in gold. So too are the winding stairs that lead up to the observation deck. Ivy lines the outside of the walls and sprawls all the way up the side to just near the top of the tower. The tower itself is intimidating for those who dare to approach.
travel_descriptions.up: A large spire at the tower top. It overlooks the city, maybe the tallest structure. You can see it all from up here, all directions, all four of them. This is the peak of the tower. It was built last as the tower was started from the bottom, and only finished when the top was all the way on it. A pointy spike atop a tower. A bird makes a nest by it. It's a crow, but not a magic one.
travel_descriptions.down: A rank, pitiful room filled with detestable creatures. Among the creatures are traitors of the King and criminals of the kingdom. All around the dungeon these ingrates line the walls, shackled and unable to move. The Tower Dungeon is a notorious place to be, according to the kingdom's history. The king throws only the most dangerous of men in there, to punish their souls.

name: Inside Tower
description: The walls and are made of marble and trimmed in gold.  So too are the winding stairs that lead up to the observation deck.  Ivy lines the outside of the walls and sprawls all the way up the side to just near the top of the tower.  The tower itself is intimidating for those who dare to approach.  The tower stands tall so as to see out way across the beautiful land it watches over.
background: The Tower stands off in the corner of the Castle.  One of many ornate vessels of the castle, the Tower serves to protect the kingdom's valuables and its people. Its towers over the beautiful farmland in the countryside and is a marker for those who travel off in the distance.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking toward the kitchen, you hear the sizzling of food and clanging of pans growing louder. The smell of delicious, mouth-watering roasts wafts through the air and tickles your senses. The warmth of the kitchen grows intense as you approach; a stark contrast to the often chilly marble atmosphere of the tower.

name: Slave Quarters
description: The slave quarters are a dark and foul smelling stone room where men are chained shoulder to shoulder against one another until work needs to be done.   There's a large bucket of slop that comes through and the slaves are allowed to feed themselves briefly.
background: Slaves are forced to reside here while they work off their debt.  It is an extremely depressing place that few ever seem to leave.

travel_descriptions.outside: Traveling from the Slave Quarters to 'Within the Walls of the City' involves a harrowing journey upward through the narrow, crowded staircase of The Tower. It's a stifling environment filled with the overlapping sounds of hopeful whispers and the relentless clanking of chains.

connections.outside: Within The Walls Of The City

name: The Great Hall
description: Large room with vast ceilings for meetings and dining. There is a large ornate table at the head of the room for the king and his guest overlooking smaller tables for the servants.
background: The Great Hall is the room in the castle where all can meet and dine. The king sits at a higher dining table than the rest overlooking servants at lower tables. The king meets with all leaders and visitors here.

travel_descriptions.east: Leaving the grandeur of the Great Hall, you travel eastwards towards the Dining Hall. The air shifts as you approach, from the clamour of courtly discussions to the mouthwatering aroma of delicacies. The hallway is adorned with tapestries depicting ancient royal dinners, setting a fitting mood for the rich culinary experience to follow.

name: Tower Dungeon
description: A rank, pitiful room filled with detestable creatures. Among the creatures are traitors of the King and criminals of the kingdom. All around the dungeon these ingrates line the walls, shackled and unable to move.
background: The Tower Dungeon is a notorious place to be, according to the kingdom's history. The king throws only the most dangerous of men in there, to punish their souls. No one usually leaves and the prisoners die a slow and painful death.

travel_descriptions.up: Ascending from the dungeon, the clammy air starts to feel lighter as you move towards the heart of the King's castle, an architectural marvel built with Ethery Stone.
travel_descriptions.south: Descending deeper into the castle's bowels brings you to the debtor's prison. The air grows cooler and damper, the light dimmer, and an unmistakable sense of despair hangs in the air.

name: Dining Hall
description: A somewhat ornate room with stone walls, hanging tapestries, and a detailed look dinner table in the center with many chairs.  There's candles on the dinner tables along with place mats for those who come to eat.
background: This room is used primarily by visitors and guests to the tower.  It's also used to celebrate various occasions and family reunions.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking north from the dining hall, you enter the Great Hall. The echo of your footsteps amplifies as you enter this large room, filled with the scent of wood polish and sounds of distant chatter.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south of the dining room, you start feeling the warmth of the kitchen, hear the clang of pots and pans, the sizzle of frying, along with the enticing aroma of roasting meats and freshly baked bread.

name: Within The Walls Of The City
description: The Tower stands tall, built of the best stone with a number of odd runes that only the local mages truly know how to read. Despite age the stones do not crumble, and stand ever vigilante as a watch station for the city.
background: Built as a ever watchful reminder so that the people would know the guard had eyes on approaching danger the Inside Tower was commissioned by the first ruling family of the area. The grand wizard of the area carved runes blessed by the fair folk so ensure that no matter what was thrown against it the tower would stand strong.

travel_descriptions.east: Travelling from the Inside Tower to the Southernmost Tower Entryway, one walks along a worn stone pathway. The hush of the city fades, replaced by the quiet soughing of wind and the distant hoot of an owl. The air becomes colder, the scent of moss and old stone is heavy as you approach the abandoned Southernmost Tower.

name: Artillery Room
description: The artillery room is dark and spacious. Weapons and gunpowder hang from the walls. A darkly set of walls line the room and tower.
background: The artillery room houses the weapons and gunpowder for the tower. The tower is always on high alert for foreign invaders. The members of the tower are eager and always willing to stand their ground in defense.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling from the Artillery Room to the Arsenal involves a short walk through stony, torchlit corridors. The chilly air replaced by warmer, metal-scented breeze hints at the approach towards the Arsenal. The distant clanging of metals intensifies gradually while the hustle and bustle of Arsenal grow clearer. It's a journey through the heart of defense mechanics of the tower.

name: Tower Spire
description: A large spire at the tower top. It overlooks the city, maybe the tallest structure. You cans see it all from up here, all directions, all four of them.
background: This is the peak of the tower. It was build last as the tower was started at the bottom, and only finished when the top was all the way on it. A pointy spike atop a tower. A bird makes a nest by it. It's a crow, but not a magic one.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the spire, the wind decreases as you move through the solid, narrow stairway enclosed by the thick tower walls. Each step echoes through the stone corridor, leading you deeper into the heart of the King's Castle.

name: King'S Dorm
description: The walls are adorned with artwork of previous Kings and Queens, battles and events of note. The walls are smooth hewn marble, the floor a mosaic of colored stones quarried far away.
background: This tower was once the home to the Great King who unified the warring regions and enforced peace with an iron rule. He was clever, powerful but known as fair. Examples of his deeds can be seen in the artwork, the relics, the adornments. It is a testament to both his legacy and his ego; no one who comes there later will be able to forget who created it.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending from the King's Dorm, you pass through a narrow, spiraling stairwell cut directly into the stone walls of the tower. As you travel downwards, it becomes noticeably colder, and echoes of clattering armor and muffled conversation grow louder as you approach the Guards Quarters.
travel_descriptions.east: Emerging from the King's Dorm, you cross a grand, vaulted hallway lined with statues of past kings. Each step on the carpeted floor muffles the sound around you, giving the impression of isolation within the bustling castle. As you near the Throne Room, the gleam of gold and jewels is nearly blinding in the torchlight.

name: Staircase
description: The staircase is spiral and made of stone. The stone is smooth and cold from years of friction. The staircase reaches multiple levels of the tower and is the only way up or down.
background: The staircase goes from the entrance to the castle to the top floor of the tower where the Debtor's prison is located. It is the only way into the debtor's prison as there are no windows in the entire tower. It also passes the 2nd floor where the slave's quarters are located.

travel_descriptions.up: Ascending the stone staircase, you make your way towards the Princess' Chamber. The winding spiral starts to narrow as you get higher, the atmosphere changing from cold draconian stone to a more gentle and charming ambiance.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending the staircase, you go deeper within the confines of the castle. The temperature gets colder, the torchlight dims and the echo of your footsteps resonates off the sturdy walls of the castle's great tower.

name: Rat Den
description: The rat den is a disgusting, musty room deep inside the tower sewers. This is the area that the rats pull the bones of the treasure seekers, so they are able to get full access to all of the decomposing meat on the bones. Around the room are empty crates, that are broken and falling to pieces. Scattered glass litters the floor, broken ale bottles where some of the poor have tried to stay in the den, before the rat's had over taken it. There are torches on the wall, but dim now, as no soul wants to see the what the light would show. There are rat's nests in the corner, bits of straw, cloth and other odds and ends the rats have dug up.
background: The rat den used to be a storage room, before the mad King became the ruler. It stored crates of lovely dishes, ornaments and treasures. It was kept clean, with servants coming and going to get items, as well as store them. It was actually quite a clean and nice room, where even food was stored when there was an abundance. Torches kept the room bright, the walls were in good order, clean of cobwebs.

travel_descriptions.out: Clearly, the exit from the rat den leads back to the gloomy sewer entrance. As you trudge towards it, the putrid smell of the sewers seems almost welcoming in comparison to the stench of decaying food and rat droppings. The faint echoes of dripping water and distant squeaks of rodents serve as a chilling reminder of the belly of the tower you're leaving behind.

name: Guards Quarters
description: The Guards quarters feature rows of bunk beds with large wooden chests at the base of the bed for the guardsmen to rest in and store their possessions. Above the door way there is a large iron crest representing the town's leaders. Two stone cut outs act as windows on opposite sides of the room.
background: The guard quarters are where the guards sleep and store their material possessions when not in service. It is a shared residency, but exclusive to only the guards and cant be accessed by others.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey north from the Guard's Quarters to the King's Dorm is marked by numerous historical artworks. The beautifully carved marble walls that guide the way are a testament to the legacy of the Great King. As you move through, you are filled with a sense of grandeur and the strong presence of the past.

name: A Spiral Staircase
description: Made of strong granite and oak timbre, it ascends to the highest room in the tower. The granite glitters in the light from the torches that line the walls. The oak is sleek and coated in a glistening protectant.
background: This staircase was built by the great grandfather of the current king. At the top of the staircase, in the highest tower, lies an vital scroll that holds the secret to protecting the castle.

travel_descriptions.down: Traveling down the spiral staircase leads you through a labyrinth of towering stone walls and ancient torches, the descent marked by the rhythm of your footsteps echoing off the granite steps.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending towards the King's Quarters, the air becomes thick with the scent of polished wood and sandalwood oil. The gleam of gold and diamond punctuates the dusky twilight of the room above, promising an experience of luxury and comfort.

name: Prison Room
description: it has old gray brick and it is hard to breathe because it is so high up in the sky, there are old skeletons there from previous prisoners.
background: the room in the high tower is used for the king's private prison room for traitors.

travel_descriptions.south: A narrow stone stairway descends from the prison room to the south. The air grows colder and damper with each step down, carrying with it the heavy, lingering scent of despair and fear. The faint echoes of shackles clanking against stone can be heard, a grim reminder of the destination awaits.

name: Throne Room
description: Ornate and luxurious, the throne room gleams with gold and precious jewels. Priceless paintings of past kings line the sides. Underneath a vaulted ceiling, a regal red carpet connects the throne room's entrance to the golden throne itself.
background: The throne room is the pride and joy of the castle. The king commissioned hundreds of craftsman to construct it's expensive interior. The king often brings important ambassadors to this room to impress them with his power.

travel_descriptions.west: Journeying west from the throne room, you pass through a grand archway and into a corridor. The walls are richly decorated with tapestries and exquisite paintings that recount the history of the kingdom. The path leads to the comfort and opulence of King'S Dorm.

name: Murder Hole
description: A grey, stone section of the tower.  There's a small rectangular cut out in the wall to allow archers to shoot through the hole at invaders.  It's a generally hot and stifling place.
background: This is a section of the tower where archers can shoot out from without generally being hit by anything.  This is especially useful during sieges and assaults they must defend against.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the murder hole, the scent of stone and aged wood fades, replaced by the cold, clean air of the Keep. The narrow stairs are steep and slick with age, lined with centuries-old torch sconces.

name: Keep
description: The keep is the most fortified part of the castle. Swords, bows and arrows, lances, and armor are housed here. From the stone windows you can see past the castle walls into the surrounding fields. This is the castle's last defense.
background: The keep has stood for centuries, never having been taken in battle. The keep holds weapons and armor, to be sure, but it also holds many of the king's most valued treasures. If the keep goes, so goes the kingdom.

travel_descriptions.west: Moving from the sturdy stone keep filled with treasured weapons and items, the journey westward leads one to the heart of the King's Castle. The transition takes on a clear shift from the militaristic environment to royal opulence.

name: Southernmost Tower Entryway
description: The rather drab tower was made of gray stones approximately all the same size. Artwork hung on the walls depicting battle scenes from long ago but even the color from these had faded with time. The cold, outside air seeped in through every small crack and crevice leaving a damp quality to the air. Sealed off rooms lined the perimeter and obviously had not been seen by human eyes for centuries.
background: This tower was the first built to accompany the castle and was majestic in its heyday. It stood four stories tall, gleaming white with parapets on the top. The Southernmost Tower served as the guest quarters for visitors to the castle and was talked about throughout the land. After the Heinous Wars the castle was left to rot when its inhabitants fled for their lives. The castle and its accompanying tower stand as a footnote in history now.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving towards the North, you head into the heart of the tower. The walls grow closer as you progress, giving a sense of being enclosed within a great structure of power and might.
travel_descriptions.inside: As you step inside, you leave the exterior surroundings behind and find yourself in a new environment. The air becomes colder, the lighting dimmer and the echoes of your footsteps resound within the stone walls.

name: Weapon Closet
description: The closet is a small dark room. There are different types of swords, axes, bows and arrows, and other types of weapons organized inside of the closet. It is just a barren, dark room with simple white walls and wooden floor.
background: The closet was just a part of the tower that was built in case people needed supplies during violent times.

travel_descriptions.inside: Moving from the weapon closet to the arsenal, you traverse a short, stone corridor, lined with torches. The air grows progressively cooler as you approach the arsenal. The faint sounds of echoing metallic clangs grow louder as you get closer.

name: Dining Hall
description: The dining hall has a long, elegant wooden table with ornate chairs at both ends and along the sides. There are place settings at each seat with a rustic silverware set and gold plates. The wall is decorated with paintings of knights and past royalty.
background: This dining hall was once the center of a huge conflict between two families. The argument was between two sons at dinner shortly after their dad had passed away. They fought over who would take over the throne, which led to the first bloodbath inside the kingdom. The younger son was victorious and the older son was slain to death.

travel_descriptions.north: You find yourself walking along a cold stone corridor, the flickering torchlight casting long shadows on the walls. The closer you get to The Great Hall, the louder you hear the general hubbub and clink of silverware against plates. A sense of majesty and grandeur start to set in.
travel_descriptions.south: As you walk towards the kitchens, the delicious aroma of roasting meats, fresh herbs, and baking bread reach your nostrils. The clatter of pots and pans become louder as you approach, along with the occasional sizzle and crackle. Despite the unpleasant sight of live animals ready to be butchered, you can't help but anticipate a delightful gastronomical experience.

name: Jail Entrance
description: The jail entrance is massive with a huge fence. There are guards on all sides. There are barbs and dangerous things surrounding.
background: The jail holds the worst criminals in the city. There are some bad people that need to be kept in jail. They guard it heavily to ensure this.

travel_descriptions.inside: The short walk from the imposing entrance to the interior of the jail is chilling. The aura is intense with an undercurrent of foreboding, and the silence only adds to the tension.

name: Curved Hallway
description: The curved hallway is made of large, blocky stones that provide a secure defense. The walls are streaked with dark water stains. Light from thin arrow slits streaks down at angles as the hallway curves gently to the left. An old, wooden door is tucked into the eastern side of the wall.
background: The tower was built with several levels of floors, each with a small hallway surrounding an inner room.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking through the curved hallway to the north, eerie darkness engulfs the surroundings and silence permeates the air. It's cold, just like the weathered stone walls. Upon reaching the end, appears the Murder Hole.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south through the hallway, the scent of old stone and metal becomes pungent; a testament to the tower's age. The hallway’s torchlight flickers across countless artifacts, and finally, the Armory materializes before the eyes.

name: The Armory
description: The near top of the tower 6 feet before the very top. Where the watchers keep their eye out for trouble. It's made of stone and has doors to several places including the outside. there are weapons from all over the world held within the armory.
background: The great tower in the kingdom has held visage over the royal city for many years. Every guard would give their live to keep the tower standing. If the tower to ever fall the Royal city will surely fall with the tower.

travel_descriptions.north: Leaving the armory, you step into the dimly lit Curved Hallway. The stone underfoot is smooth and solid, a testament to its age. Your footsteps echo in the silence as you navigate through the bend of the hallway, guided by faint streams of light filtering through the small arrow slits in the wall.

name: Alchemists Lab
description: The alchemists lab is a hidden, mysterious chamber at the top of the tower. There are all sorts of beakers and potions laid out on wooden tables. Smoke and light emanate from the experiments. A large shelf holds jars of strange ingredients, and in the center of the room there is some sort of huge vat of brewing liquid, bubbling and steaming.
background: The alchemist masquerades as a simple noble man, living in the tower with his family and court. Secretly, he is an evil alchemist who is plotting strange things in this hidden tower chamber.

travel_descriptions.east: You leave the chaotic and mysterious atmosphere of the Alchemists Lab behind, entering a simple hallway before stepping into the Alchemist’s intimate, secret sanctum: his bedroom. The anticipation and curiosity hangs heavy on your shoulders as you make the transition.

name: Tower Sewers
description: A rank maze of sewers that lie below the tower. They course with filthy ooze from the experiments of the mad king. Rats patrol its smelly walkways. Bones of treasure seekers lie riddled across the walkways, nibbled clean by the fat rats.
background: The tower sewers were built to give the mad king a means to drain the waste produced by his experiments that he conducts daily. Villagers from the area believe that treasure lie at the end of the sewer maze, but this can be no further from the truth. The mad king cackles with glee as he hears the cries of those poor fools getting eaten alive by the fat rats.

travel_descriptions.out: There is no treasure to be found here. All you see is filth. Dirty murky water and fumes rising from it burns your eyes. You see animals roaming around. Are they small dogs? No they are rodents, big rats. They glisten with the filth they are covered with. It is dark and difficult to see much else. Something tells me you don't want to know much of why it smells so bad down here.

name: Tower Kitchen
description: A large Stone oven is placed in the center by the wall at the end of the room, next to it are placed many baskets containing specific kinds of food, like eggs, bread, potatoes. On the left wall beside the oven is a big table with pans and pots hanging from the ceiling above it. Many rolling pins, knives and cutting boards are scattered around the table. On the right wall beside of the oven are standing sacks of flour above which are settled small jars of powers and liquids of all kinds, and closer to the door, right next to them are hanging aprons and protective caps of the cooks who work in that kitchen. The place is very clean, shiny almost.
background: The kitchen prepares meals for everyone in the tower and cooks have to make sure the quality of meals is excellent, therefore any uncleanliness is not tolerated, especially by high officials residing in the tower, ensuring the standard is the highest. The cooks are asked to wear aprons and caps at all times and the cleanliness is being checked twice a day. All this is due to an accident that happened one day when one of the highest officials in the tower fell sick with the stomach upset, and eventually died.

travel_descriptions.east: Exiting the kitchen, you enter a magnificent tower. The marble walls, trimmed in gold, ascend around a winding staircase leading to the observation deck. The ivy-lined exterior sprawls up the tower, stopping just below the top. The tower, an ornate part of the castle, stands in the corner, towering over the beautiful farmland in the countryside. It serves as a protective marker and storeroom for the kingdom's valuables.

name: Kitchens
description: The kitchens of the tower are a giant kabob of tables and cans of herbs and various condiments. Some VERY fresh meats are found here as well. So fresh they are... well, alive. You see holding cells for various fowl and beast in a pen in the room. The smell is not very pleasant, but the food generally tastes a lot better.
background: This kitchen was built when the tower was finished. It was a clear need to have food to distribute throughout the tower. The food here is also shared with paying customers who stop in. The king himself likes to come here every so often. but the kitchens aren't completely to his desires in culinary expertise.

travel_descriptions.north: Exiting the busy, bustling kitchens, you journey northwards towards the Dining Hall. The aroma of delicious food being prepared follows you, gradually blending with the rich smell of polished wood and old tapestries as you approach the grand dining area.

name: Tower
description: The inside tower is made from a combination of wood and brick. It also has some metal to hold all the doors in place. There are three doors and a staircase that leads up to the guards quarters.
background: This inside tower is used as a guards hangout. It allows the guards to have a place to call their own. They sleep here between shifts and sometimes eat here.

travel_descriptions.west: Exiting the tower requires you to pass through a disappointingly ordinary door of stone. As you step out with broom and mop bucket nearby, you sense the humble functionality of the tower that prioritizes practicality over grandeur.
travel_descriptions.inside: As you venture further into the tower, you're welcomed by the grandeur of marble walls adorned with gold and draped with ivy. The path twists upwards, daunting yet beguiling, presenting a rich panorama of the farmland beyond as it stands tall, a marker of strength and protection.

name: Throne Room
description: The throne room is a lavishly adorned stone fortification, with large purple and gold tapestries hanging on the walls. Between each tapestry there is a painting of the previous ruling families' patriarchs. At the center of the back wall sit's a large throne adorned with gold and silver, with a red silk cushion on it's seat.
background: The throne room is where the king of the castle meets with other diplomats and rules over his kingdom. Only those close to and trusted by the King are allowed into this room, and it is heavily defended by the knights of the castle.

travel_descriptions.west: Journeying west from the opulent Throne Room towards the King's Dorm, you traverse the wide marbled corridor lined with rich velvety tapestries and high-arching windows offering panoramic views of the sprawling kingdom.

name: The King'S Quarters
description: Decadent, sensual, and tranquil, the King's Quarters sparkles with the various diamonds and gold-laced furniture comprising the entire room.  Self-portraits of the king himself, his queen, and various demigods line the walls leading up to the bed.  Smooth, bear- and tiger-skin rugs cover the entire floor to protect the bare feet of scantily clad virgins who serve to the beckon and call of the king and his queen.  There is a faint smell of sandalwood wafting to and from each section of the room at all times.
background: The king's quarters served as the king's royal bedroom for centuries.  It used to be the astrologist's laboratory but has since been blessed by various fertility shamans and is physically and spiritually cleansed daily by a powerful wizard.  Daily offerings are made to the paintings of the deities--various fruits, nuts, and sometimes bloodletting into a golden dish is not uncommon.

travel_descriptions.down: Made of strong granite and oak timbre, it ascends to the highest room in the tower. The granite glitters in the light from the torches that line the walls. The oak is sleek and coated in a glistening protectant. This staircase was built by the great grandfather of the current king. At the top of the staircase, in the highest tower, lies an vital scroll that holds the secret to protecting the castle.

name: Prison Room
description: Up at the top of the tower, among the gray clouds, is the prison room. The room is round, with a circumference of about 15 feet. The walls are barren and made of stone; only one barred window gives a view out onto the vast landscape. A small bed and a dirty wooden bucket are the only decorations. The desolate princess spends day and night laying on that small bed, wondering where things went wrong
background: Daughter of the strapping king and his oriental wife, the young princess was the most beautiful girl in all the land. She was sweet and kind, and everyone loved her. When she reached adolescence, however, what the clergy called the 'devil's spell' took hold of her. No force in the world could keep her away from young men. Embarrassed, the king had this tower built specifically to hold his daughter.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending from the round prison room, you traverse a cold, winding stone staircase that seems to spiral endlessly into the gloom. The air grows increasingly stuffy and dank, heavy with the smell of moss and mildew. As you reach the bottom, you're greeted by the ominous sight of the formidable jail room.

name: Alchemists Bedroom
description: This room holds a small bed, a table and several work benches. More flasks, beakers, candles, alembics, decanters, herbs, kettles, and the like may be found. Several books of forbidden lore sit upon the table. A circle, nine feet across and adorned with words of power is etched into the floor.
background: It is here that the Alchemist performs his most dangerous and forbidden experiments. If forced to accept a visitor, the interloper will only be shown what is in the laboratory above and never allowed to see what goes on at the end of the hidden stairway. Inside a flask, slowly growing is a tiny purple stone, which the Alchemist hopes will enable the creation of a powder that will allow him to disguise himself as anyone he wishes.

travel_descriptions.west: Ascending the hidden stairway leads you to the Alchemist's Lab, a mysterious chamber rife with the peculiar and the arcane. As you traverse the path, the potent aroma of strange brews and burning herbs becomes incredibly potent, and the faint sputtering of the lab's fireplaces echo eerily in the confines of the stairwell.

name: Debtor'S Prison
description: A dank and dark prison located in the tower of the castle. There is a single bench made of stone and a bucket for eliminating waste. There are no windows and the prisoners never see the light of day.
background: The debtor's prison is where the King locks people away for not paying their debts. They stay in the tower until someone can repay them. If no one does, then they stay there till they die.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving north from the Debtor's Prison leads you to a more dreadful place - the Tower Dungeon. The journey is chilling, as you ascend the cold, stone spiral staircase, echoing with the wails and sobs of incarcerated debtors. A guard leads the way, his torch flickering on the damp walls. With each step, the air becomes increasingly dank, and the thin slivers of light from the torch reveal more and more dreadful scenes. The ruthless atmosphere swallows any hope the tower's inhabitants might have clung onto.

name: Underwater Aquapolis
description: The underwater aquapolis is a massive and ornate city at the bottom of the ocean. The walls of the buildings are made or coral, pearl, and seashells. Schools of fish swim in and out of the circular holes in the walls that act as windows. The aquapolis is illuminated by florescent rocks and shells that line every building.
background: An ancient underwater people created the city, collecting beautiful and priceless items from all over the ocean to add to the budding city. Creatures from all over the seas made their way to the aquapolis, both to help and to admire the incredible creation.

travel_descriptions.north: You swim through archways of starfish-studded coral and ascend the spiraling staircase of seashells, leading to the majestic Neptune's Throne Room.
travel_descriptions.south: Drifting in the playful current, you find yourself surrounded by garlands of kelp that guide you to the vibrant Underwater Marketplace buzzing with activity.
travel_descriptions.east: You glide through marble portals lined with bioluminescent algae. Through underwater flora, you arrive at the mysterious Dry Dock Room at the city's edge.
travel_descriptions.west: Against the gentle pull of the current, you journey through the coralline tunnels lit by radiant marine flora, bringing you to the buzzing hub of discovery, the Research Lab.

name: The Dungeon
description: Dark only lit by the flickering flame licking the walls. smell of rot and gangrene. death and decay the walls moist and moldy. the sounds of screams fill the air along with dispear and fate. in the center a iron maiden recently used and open. the spikes a reddish brown from dried blood.
background: this is the dungeon in a kingdom ran by a merciless king who rules with a iron fist. he believes fear is what keeps them loyal. his favorite torture? the iron maiden

travel_descriptions.up: Toad Hollow is a filthy room within the Underwater Aquapolis. When you enter, you are greeted by the reek of scummy pond water. You enter Toad Hollow through a drainage pipe that you have to crawl through. Once inside Toad Hollow, you can stand up, but you still don't feel comfortable with your surroundings. As far as the eye can see there is muddy water in a circular basin with lily pads floating in it. On the pads, giant toads jump back and forth making gurgling, croaking sounds. As you wade deeper into Toad Hollow, the water comes up to your waist and you see the flash of a fin. There is legend that a creature lives in the center of Toad Hollow that is half human, half monster. Not even the strongest knight has been brave enough to examine it. The fin disappears back underwater but there is a red glint suggesting eyes are watching you. When you reach the other side of the basin, you crawl into another drainage pipe and feel relieved that you're out of this place. Toad Hollow is a legend among knights young and old. Mostly, it's discovered by children playing down in the sewers who take a combination of turns through the drainage pipes and wind up there by accident. Some braze knights have purposefully tried to find Toad Hollow and been successful but most have not glimpsed the creature. Toad Hollow remains shrouded in mystery to this day and many question if it's even real. Some say that you should be careful not to get caught on the armor of the drowned when you're wading through and that hands have reached up from the bottom of the water and grabbed their ankles.
travel_descriptions.east: Deep inside the volcanic cave that is the foundation of the aquapolis lies the treasury. Some believe its existence is a myth, but others claim they have been there. Those that claim they have seen it say you must dive out of the aquapolis' basement while holding your breath, through the cold deep water that is filled with deadly volcanic gas. The treasury room itself is a dry cave filled with riches from the very infancy of the empire Rumors say that the original ruler of the aquapolis filled the treasury with riches that he aquired while on a quest he undertook on land before the founding of the aquapolis.
travel_descriptions.down: The underwater aquapolis is a massive and ornate city at the bottom of the ocean. The walls of the buildings are made or coral, pearl, and seashells. Schools of fish swim in and out of the circular holes in the walls that act as windows. The aquapolis is illuminated by florescent rocks and shells that line every building. An ancient underwater people created the city, collecting beautiful and priceless items from all over the ocean to add to the budding city. Creatures from all over the seas made their way to the aquapolis, both to help and to admire the incredible creation.

You enter Toad Hollow through a drainage pipe that you have to crawl through. Once inside Toad Hollow, you can stand up, but you still don't feel comfortable with your surroundings. As far as the eye can see there is muddy water in a circular basin with lily pads floating in it. On the pads, giant toads jump back and forth making gurgling, croaking sounds. As you wade deeper into Toad Hollow, the water comes up to your waist and you see the flash of a fin. There is legend that a creature lives in the center of Toad Hollow that is half human, half monster. Not even the strongest knight has been brave enough to examine it. The fin disappears back underwater but there is a red glint suggesting eyes are watching you. When you reach the other side of the basin, you crawl into another drainage pipe and feel relieved that you're out of this place.
background: Toad Hollow is a legend among knights young and old. Mostly, it's discovered by children playing down in the sewers who take a combination of turns through the drainage pipes and wind up there by accident. Some braze knights have purposefully tried to find Toad Hollow and been successful but most have not glimpsed the creature. Toad Hollow remains shrouded in mystery to this day and many question if it's even real. Some say that you should be careful not to get caught on the armor of the drowned when you're wading through and that hands have reached up from the bottom of the water and grabbed their ankles.

travel_descriptions.south: The journey to the south is underground, through dark and murky passageways which leads to a medieval site, commonly accompanied by the smell of dread that fills the air as one approaches The Dungeon.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, one travels through underbrush and small patches of farmland, the smell of salt in the air growing stronger as they approach the humble Farmhouse settled in the outskirts of an old seaweed plantation.
travel_descriptions.west: Towards the west, the path winds through rolling grasslands eventually leading to an old Tool Shed packed with rusty implements used in seaweed farming and lingered scent of weathered wood and earth.

name: The Lords Treasury
description: Deep inside the volcanic cave that is the foundation of the aquapolis lies the treasury.  Some believe its existence is a myth, but others claim they have been there.  Those that claim they have seen it say you must dive out of the aquapolis' basement while holding your breath, through the cold deep water that is filled with deadly volcanic gas.  The treasury room itself is a dry cave filled with riches from the very infancy of the empire
background: Rumors say that the original ruler of the aquapolis filled the treasury with riches that he aquired while on a quest he undertook on land before the founding of the aquapolis.

travel_descriptions.west: Moving towards the west, the air gets colder and you can smell the faint scent of decay. The ground underfoot turns uneven and clammy, your senses filled with an unsettling echo of screams and despair. This is the path to the Dungeon.
travel_descriptions.north: As you travel northward, the sound of trading haggles and high-pitched calls grow louder. The water becomes more vibrant as various colorful clouds fill the water around you, pointing towards exotic booths. Your senses are invigorated by the energy and liveliness, already feeling the charm of the underwater Marketplace.

name: Underwater Marketplace
description: The marketplace is the main hub for the residents of the aquapolis. With high ceilings and bright, colorful flags at each market stand, the place seems to stretch on forever. Near the entrance, there is a young boy attempting to sell the latest news of the kingdom.
background: This market started as a small trading place, but has evolved over generations to become a major resource for the community. The building itself started small as well, and as the market's popularity grew the building was expanded. Today, the market stands as the largest source of tourism for the kingdom.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving north brings you towards the heart of the aquapolis. Surrounded by sea flora and fauna, the deeper you go the more of the cities stunning coral and pearl architecture can be seen, glistening in the soft sea light.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, you find yourself venturing towards the research lab at the heart of the city. The surroundings pulse with scientific activity. The glow from the lab is brighter here, signalling the intense scientific research happening within.

name: Neptune'S Throne Room
description: A small room in the castle, Neptune's throne room is adorned with painted walls as blue as the sea itself. Tables constructed of beautiful coral lean against all four walls with decorative shells serving as a border for them. The ceiling is painted to resemble waves.
background: The queen loved the sea. When she was married off to a royal family in the country far from her beloved ocean palace, her husband requested that a room embodying everything beautiful about the ocean was constructed to please his queen.

travel_descriptions.south: Leaving Neptune's Throne Room, you glide through the water, moving effortlessly as you marvel at the brilliant colors and luminescent glow of the surrounding coral architecture. Schools of tropical fish flit about as larger majestic creatures like sea turtles and manta rays glide gracefully through the tranquil deep. As you continue your journey, you begin to make out a grand cityscape in the distance. The Underwater Aquapolis comes into view, a sprawling metropolis of stunning architectural wonders beautifully illuminated by bio-luminescent plants and animals.

name: Dry Dock Room
description: The room is located on the border wall of the aquapolis. There is one on the far north and far south side.
background: The dry dock is need as a portal in between the dry area of the aquapolis and the outside water. Divers and maintence workers will enter the room and it will fill with water. After which the door will open to the outside.

travel_descriptions.west: Navigating through the Dry Dock Room, the metal doors creak open revealing a world submerged in water. As the water fills the room, shadowy figures dance across the coral structures of the Underwater Aquapolis. The journey is a transformation, from a dry, compressed air environment to the serene and boundless abyss of the underwater city.

name: The Marketplace
description: The marketplace is unlike any surface dwellers' paltry trading area, for beneath the waves there is no need for gravity to limit where and how the wares can be displayed.  Indeed, the market is quite crowded, with merchants as likely setting up stalls upside down on the ceiling as on the floor.  Colorful dyes are used around some of the more exotic booths, the color clouding the water and drawing the eye to it.  High shrills pierce the waters as various merchants call out their wares to the merpeoples passing by.
background: This market was once part of a famed above water city, which has long since sunk into the waves.  At first the merpeoples of the sea there disdained it for its primitive ways, finding its walls and broken structures an amusing testimony to the futile efforts of the surface dwellers. However, just as the tides change, so do the moods of the people that swim within them.  The merpeople clamor for goods and trades from the surface, and so the market became more of a charming testimony to the quaint and unique properties of things created far from the waves and waters of those who dwelt below.

travel_descriptions.south: Deep inside the volcanic cave that is the foundation of the aquapolis lies the treasury. Some believe its existence is a myth, but others claim they have been there. Those that claim they have seen it say you must dive out of the aquapolis' basement while holding your breath, through the cold deep water that is filled with deadly volcanic gas. The treasury room itself is a dry cave filled with riches from the very infancy of the empire Rumors say that the original ruler of the aquapolis filled the treasury with riches that he aquired while on a quest he undertook on land before the founding of the aquapolis.

name: Research Lab
description: The research lab is the main science hub of the aquapolis. Dozens of scientists are working on a myriad of different projects.
background: The research lab is located in the central area of the aquapolis for easy access for all those involved in the research.

travel_descriptions.east: Journeying to the Underwater Aquapolis is an otherworldly experience. As you move from the research lab, the water around you changes from clear to a shimmering transition of aquatic colors. Soon, the majestic buildings come into sight, surrounded by an air bubble and full of life, making you feel like you've entered a unique realm.
travel_descriptions.south: The trip to the Underwater Marketplace feels like stepping into an old storybook. A short swim from the lab reveals the bustling marketplace. Vibrant stalls are filled with varied items collected from all over the ocean, and residents of the aquapolis hasten about their business. An area full of vibrancy and energy that almost makes you forget you're under the sea.

name: Farmhouse
description: a small house on a seaweed plantation, small and rustic, really only the single room with a closet, maybe, a table and some chairs
background: this is a humble farmer's shack where he lives with his wife and six children, it is falling apart and in disrepair and is very old

travel_descriptions.west: Toad Hollow is a filthy room within the Underwater Aquapolis. When you enter, you are greeted by the reek of scummy pond water. You enter Toad Hollow through a drainage pipe that you have to crawl through. Once inside Toad Hollow, you can stand up, but you still don't feel comfortable with your surroundings. As far as the eye can see there is muddy water in a circular basin with lily pads floating in it. On the pads, giant toads jump back and forth making gurgling, croaking sounds. As you wade deeper into Toad Hollow, the water comes up to your waist and you see the flash of a fin. There is legend that a creature lives in the center of Toad Hollow that is half human, half monster. Not even the strongest knight has been brave enough to examine it. The fin disappears back underwater but there is a red glint suggesting eyes are watching you. When you reach the other side of the basin, you crawl into another drainage pipe and feel relieved that you're out of this place. Toad Hollow is a legend among knights young and old. Mostly, it's discovered by children playing down in the sewers who take a combination of turns through the drainage pipes and wind up there by accident. Some brave knights have purposely tried to find Toad Hollow and been successful but most have not glimpsed the creature. Toad Hollow remains shrouded in mystery to this day and many question if it's even real. Some say that you should be careful not to get caught on the armor of the drowned when you're wading through and that hands have reached up from the bottom of the water and grabbed their ankles.
travel_descriptions.south: Deep and warm the geothermal valley boasts a reviving epicenter for all to migrate to. The warm bursts of heat send bubble around the perimeter of the valley reflecting colors of green and blue. The Geothermal Valley is place where one can come and heal with the minerals and heat that permeates through the body and soul. It is the main attraction in the underwater aquapolis.

name: Geothermal Valley
description: Deep and warm the geothermal valley boasts a reviving epicenter for all to migrate to. The warm bursts of heat send bubble around the perimeter of the valley reflecting colors of green and blue.
background: The Geothermal Valley is place where one can come and heal with the minerals and heat that perminates through the body and soul. It is the main attraction in the underwater aquapolis.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey from Geothermal Valley to the north brings a sudden and stark contrast. Leaving behind the warmth and rejuvenating energies of the valley, the path upwards winds between rows of seaweed plantation, where the moist air gives way to a drier, grittier atmosphere. Dotted along the path are rusty plow tools and dilapidated sheds, giving the area a humble, rustic aesthetic. As you move further north, the solitary silhouette of a farmhouse gradually comes into view, showcasing the rugged resilience of bygone farm life.

name: Tool Shed
description: a shed with tools hanging from hooks. there are various hoes and shovels. it's for seaweed harvest
background: a humble shack for storing the implements of agrarian life

travel_descriptions.east: Travel between the Tool Shed and Toad Hollow is a dark damp journey. You crawl into this tunnel feeling the slimy walls as you go along. The smell of stagnant water becomes more potent as you make your way to Toad Hollow.

name: Riverbed
description: With clear air and the sound of gurgling water near it, the river bed is silty and muddy. The river rushes by the land as more and more dirt separates from the land. The land of the riverbed slick with mud and filled with bugs and worms/
background: The riverbed is where the village people come to collect water to drink. The women come early in the morning with their baskets to collect water for the whole family. Later, the men come and catch fish, for the evening meal. The children follow their mothers to the river and play in the river while the mothers chat and collect water.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving from the muddy riverbed to the Flower Garden, you step through an ancient oak's hidden entrance, entering a technicolor world of blooming flowers and ripe, tangy berries.
travel_descriptions.west: Going west from the riverbed, you trek through a thick forest and cross a river, reaching The Clearing, a hiding sport filled with old memories of knights' practices and secret trysts.
travel_descriptions.downstream: Traveling downstream from the riverbed, you find yourself entranced by the rhythm of the flowing water as it slows and quickens, bringing you closer to the heart of the Stream, bustling with wildlife.

name: Flower Garden
description: This clearing is in reveal a wide circle of trees. Proud oaks stand close enough that only the smallest of fauna can squeeze through, protecting the garden within from curious deer and hungry rabbits. Flowers of every hue and shade crowd the soft lawn of grass, soaking up what light they can through the shadows cast by the branches above. Purple, yellow, red, blue - even green blossoms bob in the breeze, their scents mixing to create a heady perfume. Vines and creepers climb up the tree trunks, dripping with grapes and berries.
background: This garden is used to feed the fae that live in the Brush den. The fruit from the climbing vines and the nectar from the flowers make up most of their diet, and the garden provides them with a ready source of nourishment. The entrance to the encircled clearing is within the roots of an ancient oak, and is not easy to see.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking south from the flower garden, you notice a subtle change in air quality as you move away from the enveloping sea of blooming vegetation and approach the lively riverbed, echoing with the lullaby of flowing water.
travel_descriptions.west: As you travel westward from the garden of blossoming hues, the towering oak trees guide your path leading to the Wooded Magical Village, where the mystical sounds of quiet spells and soft laughter greet you.

name: A Wooded Magical Village
description: The village lay hidden in a secret grotto that is set in a sort of valley between trees. The village is populated by child-like peoples who wear clothes made of various plant matter such as large leaves and vines. The homes are made of wood, and seemingly blend into the green dense backdrop.
background: The wooded grotto is home to a master wizard who is cared for by the child-like village people. He pays them by protecting them and their village from the dangerous animals that reside in the dark forest.

travel_descriptions.east: Travelling east, one must pass through a narrow path heavily guarded by towering trees and vibrant flora, leading to the Flower Garden.
travel_descriptions.south: The journey south implies a descent, moving deeper into the wooded darkness before the ground levels out at The Clearing, enveloped by ancient pine trees.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north requires courage, as you tread into the ominously shadowed Forest Entrance, where sunshine is scarce, and the footpath is shrouded in rotting leaves.

name: The Clearing
description: the clearing is surrounded by old pine trees where knights used to practice swinging their swords. There are haystacks where they take wenches and pay them a sickle.
background: the clearing is used as practice and you can get there over the river, and through the forest. It is thick with trees but this spot serves as a secret marriage consummation station.

travel_descriptions.east: As you walk to the east, you can hear the calm sound of streaming water. The ground under your feet gets increasingly damp and spongy as you approach the Riverbed.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north from the clearing, the forest grows increasingly dense. The vegetation speaks of mystery and magic, and soon you see strange wooden structures peeking out – you have arrived at the Wooded Magical Village.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking west, the pine trees thin and give way to a more mixed woodland. The sound of lapping water grows louder, and soon you are walking along the banks of a beautiful river flowing through the Forest.

connections.west: Along The Banks Of A River In The Forest

name: The Stream
description: The stream is always going. The water moves quickly in some places and slowly in other places. There is a dry spot on each side of the water. In some areas you will see animals drinking the water. There are also fish swimming around in the deeper parts of the stream.
background: The stream was created by rainfall. The water in the sky was becoming raindrops in the clouds and then it fell to the earth. The water accumulates as it flows down from higher elevations. The areas where the water is accumulated is called stream or river.

travel_descriptions.upstream: You walk along the bank of the fast flowing stream, the air turning cooler as you approach the riverbed. You can hear the distant laughter of women and children splashing in the river.
travel_descriptions.west: As you head west, the sound of the stream fades away and the trees grow thicker. An eerie silence descends, broken only by the occasional rustle of unseen creatures.

name: Along The Banks Of A River In The Forest
description: The river that runs through this part of the forest is clear and cold and crystal blue.  Small fish dart about, and a few lazy insects flit back and forth above the riverbank.  Lush grass slopes up from the river itself.
