background: The river runs through most of the continent on its way to the sea.  It passes through this forest, cutting it exactly in half as it travels from east to west.  It is the only source of fresh water for the entire forest.

travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east, you'd leave the lush riverbank and follow a narrow path winding through towering trees until you reach the open space of the Clearing, an area surrounded by old pine trees and filled with history and tales from the knights who once practiced there.
travel_descriptions.north: Venturing north takes you deeper into the forest, guided by a well-trodden walkway. The river you leave behind appears and reappears, intertwining itself with the surrounding immense trees until you reach the South Forest, a crucial source of sustenance for the nearby communities.

name: Unsettling Forest Area
description: The forest is actually very creepy even during the day. The trees are so tall that they block the sunlight. There is always fog in the forest which makes it very hard to see. There are a lot of mushrooms near the trees and none of them are edible
background: It is believed that this forest is alive! People say that trees are moving from one place to another when nobody sees. This way hunters and other people have a hard time finding their way back. This forest never looks the same

travel_descriptions.east: Navigating through the fog, you leave the unsettling forest behind, moving towards the sound of flowing water. The journey is eerie, yet filled with the sensory gratification of crisp breeze, musky moss, and sounds of forest life.
travel_descriptions.south: Descending from the unsettling ethers of the forest, you traverse through a thriving undergrowth toward the dense Firewood Forest. The air gets noticeably fresher as you pass through rustling leaves and hear the comforting creak of ancient trees.

name: South Forest
description: The forest is lined with tall trees but has a long walkway for travelers. I the middle of the forest is a long river surrounded by tall grass with clear blue waters and lots of colorful fish.
background: The river in the forest is important to the people who live near the forest. it supplies them with clean drinking water and also food to eat and a place to bathe

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling down south, you follow alongside the babbling river with its clear, cold, blue water. Small fish can be seen darting around, reflecting the sunlight that peers through the surrounding lush greenery.
travel_descriptions.north: Venturing north, you enter the denser parts of the forest filled with gigantic trees. The sunlight dapples through the high foliage, and the forest comes alive with the sounds of wildlife around you.

connections.south: Along The Banks Of A River In The Forest

name: Firewood Forest
description: The forest has many trees. The majority of the trees are green however a few are orange and red. The forest is huge and seems to never end.
background: The forest is where all the wood is gathered to make fire. The forest goes for miles and new trees are planted once a year to make sure it lasts forever.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey to the Unsettling Forest Area holds a change of pace as the bright, welcoming trees give way to the towering eerie giants of the north, with their ominous fog and suspiciously mobile vegetation.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west towards the Picnic Area, the thick forest gradually thins out into a more open space and eventually leads to a charming clearing with fallen logs makings ideal picnic spots, and the soft murmur from the nearby pond adds to the tranquility of the area.

name: North Forest
description: Filled with huge trees, the forest is home to many types of animals. Huge predators such as tigers and bears roam the grounds as do small animals like squirrels. Colorful birds fly among the trees. Wildflowers grow on the ground. Dappled sunlight streams through the huge canopy of trees.
background: Many animals, and humans make their homes in the forest. It is a source of much of the game humans eat. The people also get their wood, fresh fish and meat from the resources of the forest. It is also a place where people enjoy camping and where they travel as they roam.

travel_descriptions.south: The path from North forest to the South Forest is a tranquil journey, serenaded by songs of the birds and accompanied by gentle zephyrs.
travel_descriptions.west: The journey west towards the Mysterious Forest Outskirts is filled with intrigue, as the dense foliage gradually gives way to an eerie, isolated landscape.

name: Picnic Area
description: In this picnic area, there is a wide clearing with some cut down tree stumps made for people to sit and enjoy their lunch.  There's also a small pond nearby where people can feed fish and watch turtles sunbathe.
background: Peasants come here during their lunch break to enjoy the outdoors before having to go back to their manual labor.  It's one of the few areas where they can unwind.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking eastwards, you immediately notice the dense forest greenery. The deeper you go, the smell of fresh pine wafts through the air as you hear the distant sound of axes at work.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, the sounds of laughter and splashing grow louder. You traverse a small trail until you reach the peaceful pond filled with diverse wildlife.

name: Mysterious Forest Outskirts
description: The forest is a dark and mysterious place, where few but the bravest hunters dare wander. The trees loom over you, obscuring any sort of sunlight. Despite this, it is a valuable food and lumber resource for the nearby castle's inhabitants, for the trees are tall and thick and a plentiful amount of deer wander about within.
background: The vast expanse of the forest is one of the greatest mysteries for the local castle. No one knows where it ends, for even the brave hunters dare only travel to its outermost depths. As a result, it is likely that the forest has grown and grown for the past hundred years, and no one is willing to explore deeper, for there are myths of a mythical dragon king's castle in its innermost depths.

travel_descriptions.east: Strolling towards the east, you must navigate through an expanse of towering trees and dense vegetation, where birds of various species perch high above you and the air is filled with the scent of damp earth and rich foliage.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, the journey becomes rather eerie and unnerving as the forest becomes darker and denser. The faint sound of insects and creatures you cannot identify fills your ears, while spider webs brushing against your face sends shivers down your spine.

name: Pond
description: A small area with a body of water in the center along with turtles, frogs, and other wildlife that live here.  Surrounding this pone are a dense set of trees along with some rocks here and there.
background: This area is used by the local wild life to bask in the sun.  Some peasants come here to fish and relax at the end of a long day.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking northward from the pond, you make your way through a grassy field towards the Picnic Area. You can hear the distant chatter of peasants on their lunch break, and the smell of freshly made sandwiches wafts your way.
travel_descriptions.west: To the west, a narrow path leads into the ominous Forbidden Forest. As you approach, the jolly sounds of the pond fade and are replaced by the eerie silence, broken only by the whispering wind and the distant caw of a crow.

name: Forbidden Forest
description: The forbidden forest is a dark and very scary place. The trees are covered in spider web nets and huge spiders. The forest echoes sounds of witches' laughs and creepy crawly animals.  There is a brisk breeze that runs through the trees that will put chills down your spine.
background: The forbidden forest is a place where the outcasts live. The outcasts are better known as the witches. These are the people that everyone is afraid of. They have been shunned from regular society and they are now inhabitants of the forbidden forest. No one other than the witches' themselves are allowed in the forest.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north would lead you to the Mysterious Forest Outskirts. Wandering into the dense foliage, you can taste the crisp wilderness air while listening to the faint rustling of leaves and mysterious creatures of the forest.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, the verdure slightly lightens as you approach the Pond. The bubbly chirps of frogs start tickling your ears, and a mild dewy scent wafts in the air as the scenery slowly morphs from a forbidding forest to a tranquil waterside habitat.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving south is a somber journey towards the Pine Tree Graveyard. The jovial songs of the forest give way to a deathly silence, broken occasionally by the unsettling howl of the wind, causing an uneasy rustling of dry leaves on the ground.

name: Pine Tree Graveyard
description: Once known as a forest of solitude, the entrance to the pine trees is now a bleak and dreary graveyard.  Dead grass and moss fill the ground along with crawling critters that mark fear in the mind among the he who venture here.  Tombstones so old many of the names are no longer eligible.  Dense fog surrounds the area, thick tree tops blotting out the sunlight, and an eerie silence fills the air.  Cold it feels, the air, but the ground is soft and warm.  Sound can not enter, no escape this dwelling.
background: The nearby town tells strangers that this place is peaceful and beautiful, but little do they know it is not.  A terrible price is paid for all visitors who enter this place, no one has ever returned.

travel_descriptions.north: You will adventure through a hair-raising journey teeming with large spiders and eerie noises towards the unpredictable and chilling Forbidden Forest.
travel_descriptions.west: Traveling westwards, you'll witness towering pines swaying gently against the quiet breeze, feel the crunchy pine needles beneath your feet and hear the sound of woodland creatures as you approach the Entrance To The Pine Trees.

name: Entrance To The Pine Trees
description: Very tall and towering pine trees that create a dark canopy of shade. Long skinny trees sway in the sky from the soft breeze. Pine needles scatter the ground like plush carpet.
background: The Pine forest is home to many deer and other animals. It is a sanctuary for people escaping the loud city. It is serene and peaceful and many people have found solace here.

travel_descriptions.east: As you move eastward, the towering pines begin to give way to a darker, quieter area. The playful rustling of the leaves turns to an unsettling silence as the air becomes colder and filled with an unexplainable dread.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, the serene silence of the towering pines is gradually replaced by the giggles of fae folk. The atmosphere lightens, filled with the sweet scent of blossoming flowers and the curious chorus of unknown birds.

name: Fairy Forest
description: The fairy forest is full of brightly colored flowers that grow up to 30 feet tall.  There are also ornate birds that live here.  When you whistle, a fairy will come to you and tweak your nose.  They don't like a lot of nose so it irritates them enough for them to come out of their homes made from watermelon skins.
background: The fairy forest was created when the king was annoyed by all the fairy flying around tweaking people's noses.  He banished them all to the fairy forest and told them if they ever annoyed him again, he would kill one unicorn for each offense.  The fairies think unicorns are their god, so they don't dare tempt the king.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south, you get to stroll through a crowded array of towering pines, their needles whispering secrets in the wind. The journey feels magical yet humbling.
travel_descriptions.west: Making your way west towards the Forest Entrance, the vibrancy of the Fairy Forest slowly fades into a gnarled, dense woodland. It’s a journey full of mysterious charm and caution.

name: Forest Entrance
description: The path quickly narrows and darkens upon entering the forest.  Dense branches overhead block all but a few stray rays of sunshine.  Fallen leaves just beginning to rot blanket the forest floor, and every footstep kicks up a rich, loamy scent as fresh ground is unearthed.
background: None but the bravest adventurers risk entering the western wood.  Fierce creatures are known to reside there, and there are rumors of a malevolent spirit haunting the deepest reaches of the wood.

travel_descriptions.east: Venturing eastwards, you will enter the radiant and lively Fairy Forest. The air is filled with magical dust, giving the forest an ethereal glow.
travel_descriptions.south: A journey south leads to a secluded and whimsical village hidden among the ancient trees. Its tranquil and mysterious ambiance is captivating.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, you are faced with a sudden dramatic shift in the environment to the challenging terrain of the Ant Hill. The ground rumbles under the weight and activity of the colossal ant hill.

name: Ant Hill
description: The ant hill is very large, over 5 feet high, and is wrapped around the base of a pine tree. The ants are huge compared to normal ants, and jut in and out of large holes in the ant hill. Bones of animals and even people can be seen sticking out of the red dirt ant hill.
background: These ants are the scourge of the kingdom. Every time an ant hill is eradicated another pops up. These ants are very aggressive and hungry and have even been known to take large cattle or baby elephants.

travel_descriptions.east: Exiting the Ant Hill, you journey east through an ever-narrowing path.  The air grows thick and heavy with the scent of damp leaves and the forest seems to close in around you like a darkened, towering curtain.
travel_descriptions.south: The journey to the Brush Den from the Ant Hill is slightly unsettling. As you make your way south, you leave the ant hill's ominous aura behind and step into the comforting whisper of the rustling leaves and the soft, inviting scents of the forest.. The undergrowth becomes denser, hinting at the cozy sanctuary that awaits.

name: The Brush Den
description: The entryway to the brush den is made of arched bushes and various plants, as is the ceiling and walls. The inside is furnished with seats made of plant roots that have grown together, and a table made of wood adorned with flowers and wooden cups and plates. A small vine dangles with a glowing floor from the middle of the ceiling that lights the room dimly. Three small beds lay in one corner of the room made of interlaced grass and leaves.
background: The fae inhibit this small cot hidden in the brush of the forest. These small creatures slowly add new brush and decorations to their den as they scavenge the forest for food and supporting their animal friends. The small den lies just a short distance east of the lake with the door facing the lake. One might easily miss it with a quick glance as many bushes and glowing flowers are outside of it.

travel_descriptions.north: Leaving the cozy brushing den, travelers must brace themselves for a terrifying jaunt. The massive looming anthill is not welcoming. The sight of it just near a pine tree spells danger. The agitated movement of enormous ants warns of a hazardous encounter ahead.
travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west of the brush den, one enters an immense forest. It's disorienting, the depths of the woods are enigmatic, visibility gets dodgy while the undergrowth crunches. The eerie silence and the phantom glow up above make the journey feel a bit unsettling.

name: Woods
description: The woods are vast. Everywhere you turn it all looks the same. There are scratches on the trees from lost travelers marking their path. There are sounds coming from everywhere and yet no where. There are faint yellow circles up in the trees and bushes, possibly eyes starting at you.
background: The forest was never all that well known because people swore it disappeared from time to time. No one was ever sure if it was ever a thing that really existed until you were inside of it. And by then you had traveled so far in that only a rare few found their way out. Those who did marked their path hoping to help the next person but for some reason it seemed that for every marking someone put in, three more appeared.

travel_descriptions.east: When walking towards the brush den from the woods, you can feel the soft moss under your feet while passing between the diverse flora. You spot fae-like creatures dancing around the bright botanicals.
travel_descriptions.south: Travelling south towards the dense canopy, the forest foliage becomes even thicker. You feel like they're shifting and moving around you, creating a winding pathway that leads to a hidden city.

connections.south: A Room Hidden In The Dense Canopy

name: A Room Hidden In The Dense Canopy
description: Its a large room with types of beings you have never seen before. There is a counter and a person who greets people suprise when you arrive because you are not one of them. The room has an unfamiliar feel to it. with doors leading to walkways, other buildings, an entire city
background: A group of beings that prefer to stay hidden from the outside world. You some how find your way to the entrance of their city

travel_descriptions.north: As you journey towards the vast woods, mysterious and natural sounds surround you. The dense canopies seem to whisper, leading you deeper and deeper into the ominous yet fascinating green expanse.
travel_descriptions.west: Progressing westward, your path takes you through an open landscape, once a prime hunting ground. The silence of the day is soon taken over by the eerie cries and murmurs of the night, hinting at the woodland's dual nature.

name: Woodlands
description: The lush hunting grounds cover acres of land, tall trees and thickets of bushes sprawling across the land. Fields of open land are under the deep blue sky, showing the depth of the landscape. The grounds forest is thick but full of light, letting the multitude of wildlife be seen by the naked eye. The abundance of greenery makes it a prime location for hogs and oxen as they explore the land.
background: During the day, the woodlands are used by honored knights and archers, practicing their skills on hogs and traversing the dense forest to prepare for battle. But at night, what seems to be a land of prosperity and growth turns into one of despair, the cries of slaughtered pigs piercing the night air with no animal in sight. Many have told tales of night practices ending in mysterious bites and scratches from things not of this world.

travel_descriptions.east: Traveling from Woodlands to A Room Hidden In The Dense Canopy, you will venture deep into the forest, guided by the scant beams of sunshine piercing through the dense foliage above. The ground underfoot becomes more uneven, covered in ancient roots and slippery moss, until you reach a sturdy wooden door embedded in the trunk of a gigantic tree.

connections.east: A Room Hidden In The Dense Canopy

name: Fishing Pier
description: A spindly, long fishing pier that sits right outside the village. Barnacles cover its pilings in vast numbers. Many villagers can be seen fishing atop of it. Birds and pelicans squawk and fly above it.
background: The fishing pier has been a staple of village commerce for centuries - it is a means for peasants to fish, who don't have the advantage of owning a boat. Its structural integrity is something to question, since most of its piers look rotten to the bone. Many speculate that it will collapse here if the mythical Moby Dick is caught whilst standing on the pier.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling West to the Old Docks evokes a sense of unease, the ever-present fog and cautionary tales of sea creatures keep travelers alert.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading East leads you to the Pier Walkway. The salty air, squawking seagulls and tranquil waves provide a peaceful journey.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing South, the lure of the Beach is irresistible. The gleaming white sand and clear crystal water offer a refreshing and serene expedition.

name: Lighthouse
description: The lighthouse is an off-white color, towering fifty feet over the shore. The light from the building extends out for miles past the shoreline.
background: The lighthouse was built a century ago to guide ships safely to shore. Even today the building provides a valuable service.

travel_descriptions.up: Climbing the slender tower, you're greeted by vertigo inducing views of the desolate shore, the lighthouse gears audibly rotating beside you.
travel_descriptions.down: A short walk down leads to a sandy path, rapidly deteriorating into the remnants of a once resplendent beach house, haunted by exiles and ethereal echoes of its past.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south, the territory changes abruptly as sand underfoot surrenders to resilient rock, the landscape dominated by majestic gray cliffs, the silent spectators of countless historical milestones.

name: Beach House
description: the beach house is falling apart due to the storms, it's door is hanging and it's humid inside. There is no floor, just sand, and a hole to serve as the outhouse.
background: the beach house is used for those who live in exile, it is said that the area is haunted with dead people over the years. It is forbidden to help anyone who lives there.

travel_descriptions.north: You travel a winding path through the tall dunes, your eyes set on the towering lighthouse in the distance. The salty breeze is stronger here, carrying the mournful sound of a distant foghorn.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, your tired feet sink into the soft, white sand of the beach. The sound of gently lapping waves is soothing, and the sea breeze carries the fresh, briny scent of the ocean.
travel_descriptions.east: Going east takes you over a narrow causeway, past pools teeming with crabs and starfish. Eventually, you arrive at the stunning turquoise shore, its waters glittering under the warm sun, suggesting a treasure trove beneath.

name: Turquoise Shore
description: A beautiful turquoise color water by the shore. It is filled with many gems and gold.
background: It is said that this place is lived my mermaids and they love to find and collect gems and gold. They love shiny things.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, you'll encounter a haunted and decaying beach house, unwelcome due to the stories of the dead around.
travel_descriptions.south: As you head south, you'll find yourself at a dilapidated, yet populated, fishing pier brimming with culture, history and a slight hint of danger.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling eastward, you'll gradually approach the pristine and well-kept coast, marked by its gleaming white sand and a scenic and peaceful ambiance.

name: The Beach
description: Sand that is white as snow. the water is as clear as a crystal. down the shore is some cliffs
background: This beach is a very famous beach that everyone that lives in the area knows about. Most people come every summer and enjoy the weather.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking towards the Fishing Pier, the scent of salt and fish grows stronger. The echoing squawks of excited gulls fills the air, accompanied by laughter and conversation from the village fishermen.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east towards the Beach House, the sand crunches beneath your feet as the sound of waves softly washing ashore lulls you in a comforting rhythm. The breeze carries a whiff of lavish extravagance from the golden structure on the horizon.

name: Pier Walkway
description: On the seashore facing the pier, seagulls squawk as they swirl overhead. The smell of salt fills the air, and the gentle, dull roar of the waves lapping the beach is omnipresent. A gentle breeze blows, and the chatter of the villagers fishing drifts down to the shoreline from the pier.
background: The fishing pier is immediately accessible from this small walkway that extends form the beach.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west leads you down a rickety walkway, covered in barnacles and creaking with each step. You can hear the distant chatter of fishermen and the cries of circling seagulls as you make your way towards the Fishing Pier.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south, you navigate through soft beach sand until you reach water, where a glorious abandoned battleship waits. The sea breeze becomes stronger, carrying the scent of the old wood and salty sea water. You gaze in admiration at the ornate details and the buzz of activity around the ship.

name: Throne Room
description: ornate and luxurious, the throne room gleams with gold and precious jewels. Priceless painting of past kings line the sides. underneath a vaulted ceiling regal a red carpet connect the throne room entrance to the golden throne itself.
background: The throne room is the pride and joy of the castle. The king commissioned hundreds of craftsman to construct expensive interior. The king often being important ambassadors to this room to impress with his power

travel_descriptions.outside: Stepping away from the golden opulence of the throne room, you make your way towards the quiet dignity of the King's Quarters. The transition is like stepping from sunshine into moonlit calm, and the sense of royal grandeur never fades.

name: A Battleship
description: It is a glamorous wooden ship.  It glistens like there are diamonds encrusted on the hull.  There are ornate railings on the stairs as it is a massive boat.  There is even a sea monster on the bow, complete with jeweled eyes and gold hair.
background: This boat is abandoned.  No one has been able to board her for centuries and it is under suspicious circumstances that now it appears to have life aboard it.  People watch daily from the shore to see what look like little fairies buzzing all around and inside this ship.

travel_descriptions.north: On the seashore facing the pier, seagulls squawk as they swirl overhead. The smell of salt fills the air, and the gentle, dull roar of the waves lapping the beach is omnipresent. A gentle breeze blows, and the chatter of the villagers fishing drifts down to the shoreline from the pier. The fishing pier is immediately accessible from this small walkway that extends from the beach.
travel_descriptions.west: The shore near the docks. There is fog except on rare occasions. More dangerous than most people would like. You never know what dangers luck from creatures leaving and entering the waters. The light house and docks near it are the safes place because of the lighthouses enchantments. Protecting travellers. The shores themself as well as the waters are dangerous. The creatures that live in the water are not to be taken lightly any one who does regrets it.

name: Old Docks
description: The shore near the docks. There is fog except on rare occasions. More dangerous than most people would like. You never know what dangers luck from creatures leaving and entering the waters.
background: The light house and docks near it are the safes place because of the lighthouses enchantments. Protecting travellers. The shores themself as well as the waters are dangerous. The creatures that live in the water are not to be taken lightly any one who does regrets it.

travel_descriptions.east: Boarding the abandoned battleship from the Old Docks is an eerie experience filled with anticipation. As you step on the ancient wooden planks, you can hear the distant whispers of the sea.
travel_descriptions.north: Walking from the Old Docks to the Fishing Pier, you witness the daily life of the villagers. The wind carries the salty scent of the sea and the creaking sounds of old wooden planks under your feet.

name: Large Cliffs
description: Towering cliffs of gray granite line the coast. A few meters of sand lie between the ocean and the base of the cliffs.
background: Those that are particularly daring might climb up or down them. Others like to sit on the top and enjoy a nice, elevated view of the beautiful blue sea. These cliffs are a point of historical significance, as they marked the point of the colonists' first arrival.

travel_descriptions.north: To reach the Lighthouse from the Large Cliffs, a strenuous but scenic uphill climb awaits. The terrain is rough, but the breathtaking view of the vast sea below offers a soothing distraction.
travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west back to The Beach from the cliffs involves a cautious descent along the jagged rocks. The rhythmic sound of the ocean waves crashing nearby provides a soundtrack to your journey.

name: Beach House
description: A marvelous beach house that sits upon the fine white sand of the beach. It looks mighty expensive, as the house has solid gold walls. A gigantic and lavish marble pier extends into the ocean out in front of the house.
background: The beach house was built by the king as a means to escape the stress of rule. He goes there every summer and throws raging parties out on the magnificent pier. Few know of this lavish getaway, but those that do are marveled by its opulence.

travel_descriptions.north: You walk towards the towering lighthouse, feeling the soft sand underneath your feet. The sound of crashing waves is gradually replaced by the chirping of seagulls as you approach.
travel_descriptions.west: As you head west, you can feel the sand becoming increasingly warm. The sound of distant merry chatter of beachgoers starts to waft over, intermingling with the inviting scent of the ocean.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you can see the shimmering turquoise water getting closer. The sight of shiny pebbles on the shore and the cool breeze blowing from the serene water makes the journey mesmerizing.

name: Enchanted Light House
description: Slightly rusted and corroded from the crashing waves, elegant and tall. each window and opening is lined with a bronze trim.  Some gears can be seen turning along the side, rotating a middle section of the light house.
background: This desolate shore is known for the enchanted light house, Legend has it that it can disappear on some nights, causing ships to crash into the coast. Its origin is unknown, which makes it even more intriguing.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the Enchanted Light House, the air becomes thick with the salty scent of the sea. The haunting creaks of the old wooden staircase echo in the narrow passage as you move towards the lighthouse.

name: King'S Quarters
description: The room is large. The largest of all the throne rooms. The carvings on the wall are ornate and historical. The room is clearly built for royalty. The bed is covered in designed covers. It is truly a sight to see.
background: The context of this location is this is the King's quarters. The King had this room specifically designed when he had taken over from his father. He made sure that this was the most extravagant room that anyone had seen.

travel_descriptions.inside: Passing under the grand archway into the ornate and luxurious Throne Room, you can't help but be awestruck by its opulence.
travel_descriptions.east: The journey towards the east takes you to the breathtaking views of towering Large Cliffs. The feeling of elation washes over as you admire the granite giants.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading towards the west, the calming breeze from the Coast hits your face. The soft whir of the ocean waves and the crunching sound of the white sand makes the journey mesmerizing.

name: Coast
description: The coast seems to stretch on for miles in either direction.  The ocean itself has receded some and the tide has not yet rolled in.  The water laps half-heartedly at the sand and the glistening shades of seashells dot the wet sand.  All around the sand gleams a shade of white.
background: This seashore is the pride and joy of the nearest town.  It's kept immaculately clean and the white sand is something that is readily boasted about.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west from the coast, you leave the soft sands and calming waves behind, as the route starts to ascend towards a majestic castle in the distance. The sight of the spectacular King's Quarters looms overhead.
travel_descriptions.north: Moving north, the gleaming white sands of the coast become richer in hue until you find yourself standing before the stunning Turquoise Shore. The journey is marked by the shimmering sea, teasing the shores with playful waves, holding a promise of the treasures beneath.

name: The Barracks
description: Run down and smelly, the barracks houses a dozen of the king's guardsmen.  It's made of wooden slats nailed together somewhat hastily, and the brisk air from the outside whistles through some small cracks between the panels.  There are six beds in an open sleeping quarter, with a wooden chest at the end of the bed where the guardsmen store their personal belongings.
background: The barracks mainly serves as the sleeping quarters for the guardsmen when they're off duty.  After a long day of keeping the castle exterior secure, the guardsmen need a place to lie down and rest, as well as eat and drink.  Guardsmen need be on call frequently, so the barracks is very close to the castle should a danger arise and the men need be called upon.

travel_descriptions.east: The journey from the barracks to the stable consists of a short stroll across the courtyard. The sound of horses neighing grows louder as you approach.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north towards the archery zone, the clatter of practice arrows hitting targets grows increasingly closer as the lush green grass crunches beneath your feet.
travel_descriptions.west: To reach the weapons storage room, you must traverse the castle grounds, passing by training soldiers and the occasional royal guard. The air grows denser with the scent of cold steel and well-oiled weaponry.

name: Stable
description: It's constructed from old mossy stone from the nearby river. The horse's stalls inside are wooden. There is hay scattered across a dirt floor. Along the walls there are rustic tools, such as rakes, pitch forks and tools created by the blacksmith. The grain for the horses is stored in clay pottery. Regal and majestic Thoroughbred horses occupy the stables.
background: The stable houses all of the king's horses, so it is necessary to be very clean. The groomsmen make sure the horses are always clean, with the hooves properly shooed on the horses. The horses always have on the king's livery colors, displaying the kings crest and colors. Sometimes, you will find some of the stable workers sleeping in the loft, on a fresh stack of hay. It is a bit drafty and musty, but clean and dry. The king insists that it looks clean and presentable, as often the royal family will go riding or shooting.

travel_descriptions.north: Travelling north, the path is worn and covered with hay, a testament to the many horse trips made from the stables.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving south, the smell of musty timber and the faint chattering of guardsmen can be heard as you approach the barracks.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, the path is well-trodden, leading towards the looming silhouette of the sturdy main gate.

name: Horse Stables
description: It is dull to look at. The stable has hay laying everywhere, grey stones making the walls, and large heavy wooden beams hold up the ceiling. So, everything is brown or grey or other shades that bore. There are sections for horses made of wood but looks rickety.
background: Not many people go to the stable because they have the stable hand bring the horses to the entrance of the castle. It leaks and is falling into disrepair. For the stable hand it is home. There is a sense of comfort in the drab old building with the gorgeous horses.

travel_descriptions.east: Moving east, you approach the Royal Stables across the sprawling castle lawns. The scent of fresh hay is more potent here, mixed with the rich aroma of healthy, well-kept horses.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, the path towards the plain Stables is less glamorous but yet filled with anticipation. The sounds of horses neighing in the distance sketch a vivid picture in your mind.
travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west, you can clearly see the Stable Hand's Quarters. A light haze of woodsmoke drifts from a small chimney, and the faint clatter of tools against stone hints at the diligent work happening within.

name: Main Gate
description: the main gate is new and guarded, it is not run down lie many parts of the area. it is meant to intimidate attackers by making them think the area is all new and not worn down.
background: the gate being new was the idea of leaders, many resources were poured into the area, to the dismay of many members of the area

travel_descriptions.east: As you move towards the stable, the scent of hay and sounds of horses braying become stronger. You feel like you're stepping back in time, surrounded by rustic tools and the old stone construction of the stable.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west towards the entrance, the ambience shifts. The vibrant energy of the entrance, pulsing with faint whispers of magic, replaces the earthy scent of hay. Shimmers catch your eye as you get closer to the mossy, aged entrance.
travel_descriptions.outside: Venturing outside the castle, you're struck by the beautiful tapestry of gems and artifacts adorning the castle walls. The sight of ancient stones and lush gardens is a visual treat, reflecting the castle's rich history.

name: Royal Stables
description: The royal stables hold all of the horses of the noble people living in the castle. They are very well constructed, consisting of expert mason work and fixtures of some sort of heavy, forest-scented wood. Each horse has a large stall, lined with fresh hay replenished by stable hands daily. On the walls of stable, there are tools used to care for and groom the horses, hung on hooks. The stables are lit by lanterns hung throughout the stables.
background: The stables were built when the castle was built. The king was particularly fond of horses and so he requested a very studious stable to fill with the highest quality horses. The horses who live there are all very healthy, strong and skilled.

travel_descriptions.west: Leaving the comforting warmth of the lantern-lit Royal Stables, you head west towards the dilapidated Horse Stables. The transition from the regal to the rustic is abrupt and stark with the path littered with loose hay and characterized by a foreboding quietness, save for the occasional nicker from the majestic creatures housed within.

name: Archery Zone
description: The archery zone is spacious and always bright with light. The field is green and the targets are bright red.
background: The archery grounds are home to the skills and teachings of archers of all ages and classes. The master archers teach the younger ones about the art of the bow.

travel_descriptions.south: You take a brief, brisk walk through a well-trodden dirt path, dense with the scent of pine and pungent earth, to find yourself in front of The Barracks.
travel_descriptions.east: Walking east leads you down a winding pathway. The sound of gentle sand crunching under your feet resonates as you approach the humble Arrow House.

name: Stable Hand'S Quarters
description: The stable hand's quarters are very plainly decorated, with wooden torches situated in stone carvings in the wall. There are bunk beds with cheap hay and feather mattresses for the stable hands to rest in while not working. There are small sacks, as well as beaten and splintered wooden chests for them to keep their belongings in. One small window shines light into the very center of the room.
background: The stable hand's quarters provide a place for the workers to rest and relax in while not at work. They are not too far from the stable so that at a moments notice the stable hands can respond to their call for work.

travel_descriptions.east: A short walk leads from the quarters to the horse stables. The path is packed dirt, well-trodden by many stable hands going about their daily duties. As you get closer, the smell of horses and hay becomes more pronounced.

name: The Acid Yard
description: A yard in a shape of a circle is surrounded by sad, dried down trees, long ago have they died and give no sign of life. The ground in the middle is apparently not producing any fresh grass, all that can be found there is a bunch of rocks here and there. There is many barrels laying on the ground, all bearing signs of passed time on them, broken and useless. There is an  air of mystery surrounding the place and a smell so unpleasant no one dares to wander around this place.
background: Acid yard being the least liked place in the entire castle grounds is by far, the most mysterious. Rumor has it long ago a mad king used it for torturing the enemies by pouring an acid down on every single one of them, bit by bit until they were screaming the answers to his questions. It has created a large yard contaminated by acid on which nothing but a few mosses will grow.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving north from the Acid Yard towards the Weapons Storage Room, the air changes from stinging vapours to the metallic tang of sharpened steel. The chilling atmosphere of the abandoned yard lessens and the ominous presence of numerous weapons welcomes you instead.

name: The Weapons Storage Room
description: The weapons storage room is a large open room lines with all sorts of weapons mounted on the walls. Every sort of weapon imaginable is here, neatly organized and mounted in groups. The commonly used weapons, such as swords and spears are presents in such countless numbers as to require tall wooden chests on the ground to contain all of the extras. More rare weapons are simply grouped on the walls, as fewer warriors are capable of using them and the demand is lower. There are also some mysterious weapons whose use and user is yet undetermined.
background: The weapons storage room serves a practical purpose, and is also used to provide a sense of glory and intimidate. It shows off the abundant weapons the kingdom possesses and the number available for use suggests a vast army also available for war. The mysterious weapons are weapons taken from vanquished enemies as a prize. They remind visitors of the victory, and provide a chance for a warrior to distinguish themselves by learning to use the weapon efficiently.

travel_descriptions.south: A brisk walk through a narrow, chilly corridor leads you to the gloomy Acid Yard, a place fraught with eerie whispers of a time forgotten.
travel_descriptions.east: Walking towards the east, the air grows thicker with the robust sense of duty and discipline exuded by the looming Barracks, a sanctuary built on the foundation of loyalty and service.

name: Arrow House
description: A small shed with an earthen floor, holds two tables upon which rests neatly arrayed wooden boxes, each of which holds a score of newly made arrows. A third table holds several more large boxes, wherein spent and damaged arrows are placed, so any part still serviceable may be harvested. A few worn practice bows hang upon the walls and a small number tools, as well as replacement strings and polishing equipment rests in boxes under the shelves. Another set of neatly arranged boxes contains newly made parts, for the Fletcher to transform into viable arrows. A small wooden chair completes the furnishings.
background: An old Fletcher carries out his duties, smiling dutifully and politely at the archers and other visitors to his arrow house. He is constantly working, though is known to entertain extended visits from specific masters and the court jester. A master of archery in his own right, it's commonly said that no one in all the land can out shoot him. In spite of challenges, taunts and pleas, he refuses to shoot an arrow, save for when testing bows or new types of arrows.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west to the Archery Zone, you take in the peaceful serenity of the green field and archers pursuing their craft, lit by the steady bright light.
travel_descriptions.up: Heading up to the Battlements, the age-old structure of the castle looms with an aura of historic pride, cooled by a gentle breeze passing through the narrow slots and humming past the formidable cannons.

name: Battlements
description: The battlements are on top of the castle, in between the towers. These walkways have raised walls to prevents soldiers from fall off them or being picked off by archers. The walkways have narrow slots carved out at regular intervals for archers to aim through with getting hit themselves. There are also wider slots at longer intervals with cannons stationed at them. Flush against the outside walls are short, long boxes for soldiers to place their extra weapons in when preparing for a seige.
background: The battlements are very old, as this castle has not been breached before. They have somewhat recently been remodeled to create the larger slots for cannons, but the rest of the design is tradition instituted by highly respected and successful soldiers. The reason the battlements have worked so well is that the king asked his best generals to design the most efficient and effective battlements possible, and gave them all the resources to do so. Out of appreciation for their generous king, the soldiers have worked extra hard to defend the castle.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending down from the battlements, you traverse a narrow stairwell embedded in the castle's thick stone wall. The path is steep and winding, lit by a few torches flickering in iron sconces. Finally, you arrive at the Arrow house, the air becoming scented with fresh wood and the quiet, constant sounds of the diligent Fletcher at work.

name: Entrance To Castle
description: This entrance has seen better days.  The stones are a bit askew, and have lots of mosses growing on them.  But there is also a magical quality about this entrance.  It is not something you see, but rather feel.  And every now and then you can catch a shimmer out of the corner of your eye.
background: This is the entrance to the castle of the King that is under a spell.  There are little fairy lights all around, but no one can catch them.  They hover around this entrance, making sure that no one enters, and no one leaves.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking towards the east, you approach the Main Gate. Its grandeur speaks volumes about the wealth of this kingdom; this is no ordinary gate.
travel_descriptions.inside: Moving inside, you head towards The Barracks. The air grows chilly and filled with the musky scent of the guardsmen, telling tales of their brave endeavors.
travel_descriptions.outside: Venturing outside takes you Beyond The Wall. The lush greenery and the grand houses belonging to the king's aides make this area a heartwarming sight.

name: Outside Castle
description: The outside castle is beautifully decorated with priceless gems and artifacts. The stone used is ancient and antique with a shiny gloss of silver. The gardens outside the castle are a beautiful green and have the most delightful flowers.
background: The outside castle was constructed in ancient times before any other building. It's concrete was one of the first ever used, and the stones used on the entrance door date back to the prehistoric age.

travel_descriptions.inside: Passing from the outer antique castle walls, you approach the Main Gate. Unlike the rest of the building that holds a timeless charm, the Main Gate reveals the modern influences with its solid framework and intricate security. The contrast is startling but equally mesmerizing, a clear indication of a place that respects its past but doesn’t shy from progress.

name: Beyond The Wall
description: This is the area beyond the Inner Castle. It consist of large green land, that sprawl all the way to the horizon, with a line of six luxury houses in the middle. It is home to some of the Kings immediate aides, such as War Officer, Military Commander, and Agricultural Advisor.
background: This used to be a grassy meadow but as the Castle expanded with time, the King Omako III decide the King would need to find space for his closest aides so that they could always be a few minutes away if duty called. This Outside Castle was then renovated and luxury homes were built.

travel_descriptions.inside: Traveling from Beyond The Wall towards the Entrance To Castle, you can't help but feel a sense of apprehension. The six luxurious houses behind slowly give way to the expansive greenery, until finally, the majestic structure of the castle looms in the distance.

name: The Thrones Of Death
description: The main part of this room room would be the throne.  It is a shiny black with some gold ornate decorations on it. It sits on a black and gold pedestal. There is  a smaller throne in the room decorated in purple and gold.   It does not sit on a pedestal.  The room is decorated in tones of purple and blue with black accents.  This signifies death.  There are paintings of dolphin on the all.  Also to signify death.  The dolphins are typically gray.
background: The Thrones of Death is the room where murders are brought to and chained to the back walls.  They are then whipped and sometimes tortured to their impending death.  The Watchman wears a black hood and watches over the torturers.  The declares when a murderer has passed.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the Thrones of Death leads you to the ghastly Lower Dungeon. The journey is lit by grim torches with dripping walls on either side. The echoing sound of water drops accompany you, setting the tense atmosphere.

name: Lower Dungeon
description: The lower dungeon is set below the mail hall. It is dark, lit by only a few dim torches. Water is constantly dripping down the walls, giving it a dank and musty smell. There are manacles and cages set along the walls. In the middle of the room sits a table with manacles on all corners which are attached to a large rotating lever.
background: This room is the torture chamber and dungeon for the worst criminals. The light of day never reaches this room so as to help break those tough criminals. The table in the center of the room is used for torture. This room was built before the actual castle above it. It predates all the current inhabitants of the land. No one knows who built it or what it's original purpose was for.

travel_descriptions.up: Ascending from the damp and eerie dungeon, you find yourself entering an ominous chamber called The Thrones of Death, marked by the chilling presence of decorated thrones symbolizing the inevitable end.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the confinement of the dungeon, you approach the Reaper's Lair; a place so gloomily dim and lonesomely quiet, it sends a spine-chilling sensation as you approach the door.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, a growing heat hits you as the gruesome and dreadful sights of the Devil's Den unfold. Covered in gore and marked by eerie skulls and scattered bones, it is a direct vision of hellish horror.

name: The Dark Kings Throne Room
description: Filled with skeletons and zombies and dead bodies, the throne room of the Dark King has literally no light.
background: The Dark King created the room himself, erecting it with only a few words. It gains magical power with every person that enters the netherworld.

travel_descriptions.west: Traversing to the west leads the path to the Lord's Castle. The journey is eerie and foreboding as the path is hidden amongst high rocky terrains and ensnared with the aura of fear and dread.

name: Reaper'S Lair
description: A room that gets very little light except for a dim candle on a pole. The walls are made of blackened stones. A wooden door with a heavy lock stands tall.
background: The reaper of the town desired his home to reflect his profession. He commissioned workers to create this dull and fear-worthy lair. Since then, no one except for its rightful owner has stepped foot in the room again.

travel_descriptions.north: Descending into the gloom, the sound of water dripping and the stench of damp rock herald the approach to the Lower Dungeon.
travel_descriptions.south: As you head south, the air grows increasingly hot and the ground beneath you hardens into cooled magma heralding your arrival at the Lava Lake.
travel_descriptions.east: Journeying east, the sound of distant screams becomes gradually louder and the air takes on a sinister chill, signaling your approach to the Whipping Chamber.

name: Torture Chanber
description: This room is very grim and evil. There are many torturing devices strewn about. There is also blood all over the walls. The smell is putrid and relentless.
background: This room is for torture. It has taken many souls and given them a slow death. It was created by the dark lord that rules over the kingdom. It is 500 years old.

name: Whipping Chamber
description: a stone wall with straps for tying up men and women to be punished for their immortal sins
background: This sis a punishment room where droves of damned soles are strapped to stone walls and whipped by demons until their screams burst their throats

travel_descriptions.west: Travelling west, one must traverse a labyrinth of dark corridors, filled with the faint sounds of whispered voices and eerie stillness, before reaching the imposing entrance of Reaper's Lair.
travel_descriptions.south: Taking the path southwards leads through a set of ancient gates, down a series of stone steps slick with cold dampness, into the dreaded Dungeon, the air becoming increasingly heavy with sheer gloom.

name: Lord'S Castle
description: This is the location in the netherworld where the Lord and controller lives.  It is in the center of the netherworld and is difficult to reach as it is built on high rocky cliffs.
background: The Lord's Castle is the tallest and most ominous looking structure in the netherworld.  All inhabitants of the netherworld live in fear of ever being summoned there as if they are, they know their time of reckoning has come.

travel_descriptions.east: Journeying east, you tread the rocky paths leading to the Dark King's Throne Room, the oppressive air thickens with every step and whispers of looming despair envelop you.
travel_descriptions.north: As you head north towards the Devil's Castle, an intense heat gradually pervades the atmosphere, making the netherworld wind feel like the devil's fiery breath against your skin.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south, the decayed vegetation of the Withered Gardens becomes increasingly visible. The once vibrant plants are now bereft of color, lending a ghastly silence to the chilling wind.

name: The Pit Of Despair
description: A sinking hole in the ground, roughly 15 feet in diameter, covered by the grabbing appendages of sinners who once walked in the land of the living. A cacophony of moans, screams and scratching bellows from the depths of the cavern. There is a pool of blood, tears and excrement at the bottom of the hole where limbs can be faintly seen trying to reach the surface but never able to.
background: The Pit of Despair is one of the many landmarks in the Netherworld to maximize human suffering. However the Pit is for agonizing and elongating pain until one's psyche and mind crumble.

name: Devil'S Den
description: The Devil's Den is dark and fiery; no one dares to look at the blood covered walls. Skulls on stakes line the walls, with piles of bones scattered on the floor.
background: The Devil's Den is where the most evil creature rules the netherworld, collecting souls from the human world. It is a place humans fear to enter, knowing they will never escape.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the Devil's Den through a narrow, twisting catacomb, you eventually reach the Lower Dungeon. The journey is oppressively dark and filled with eerie sounds.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east from the Devil's Den, you traverse a bridge of bones over bubbling lava. You finally enter the Viewing Room with its haunting scene of ghosts watching the living.

name: Lava Lake
description: A vast lake of molten magma. The temperature is well above that which would kill most mortal beings. It is surrounded by black rock formed by cooled magma. The bubbling pit seems entirely devoid of life.
background: Lava lake has existed through time immemorial. It is sustained by fresh magma that oozes through cracks in the earth at the base of the lake. No creature dares go near it for fear of being swallowed and imprisoned by it.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north, you feel a chill in the air as the heat of the lake fades behind you. A grim aura of dread fills the atmosphere as you journey towards the Reaper's Lair.
travel_descriptions.west: As you head west from the molten beauty of Lava lake, you face the dark, gloomy structure of the Dungeon. The air grows moist and its earthy, dank smell overwhelms you.

name: The Devils Castle
description: It is a castle that has burning flames that burn for eternity all around it. It is the tallest structure in all of the netherworld. It is dark and pitch black in some areas. It can be seen from miles away.
background: This castle houses the devil. He is pure evil and is looking for slaves to worship him. These ancient grounds have many lost souls living among it.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending down from the castle, your surroundings slowly transform as the burning flames are replaced by towering rocky cliffs, ushering in the looming presence of the Lord's Castle.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west from the castle, the landscape morphs from a scorched, hellish terrain to a rugged, craggy mountain dotted with treacherous caverns.

name: Withered Gardens
description: Dead trees and plants cluster in this garden, their branches thin and bone-like.  As they sway in the ghostly breeze, they look almost like skeletal hands, grasping for any living presence nearby to drain the life out of them.  There is a a dried up fountain made of cracked marble, and a bench that is made of rotting wood.  It looks as though it might turn into dust at the slightest touch.
background: This garden was once the pride and joy of the Goddess who lived in the netherworld.  She would sit on the bench and sing to the souls that wandered the lands of the Dead, giving them peace and comfort.  However, she was betrayed by one who she trusted most, and was locked away.  Without her kind divine radiance, her garden soon withered away to the husk it is now.  None but the most foolhardy and desperate venture into it, for few who enter it return, and those that do are not unscathed.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving towards this direction, you feel a growing sense of dread. The path weaves through lifeless trees and overgrown plants, finally revealing a towering cliff atop which sits the ominous Lord's Castle.

name: Dungeon
description: Dark and dreary, the dungeon hosts a portal for evil to access the netherworld. The moist dank smell casts doubt of goodness as you see the drab construct of jail cells lining the perimeter of the room.
background: The dungeon hosts the evil of evil. It is the darkness of the netherworld, holding the secrets of evil that are withheld from the good.

travel_descriptions.north: Venturing north from the Dungeon, you are met with the horrifying sight of the Whipping Chamber, where the echoes of tortured souls resonate against cold, stone walls.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east from the Dungeon, uncomfortable heat begins to wrap around you as you approach the Lava Lake; its molten magma showcasing the destructive power it holds.

name: Viewing Room
description: The viewing room is where those who have passed on come to watch their family members in the living world one day per year. The room resembles an opera theater. There are seats throughout the room and boxes for those who were wealthy in life to sit in. There is a stage with a large magical dome on it for viewing.
background: The king of the netherworld had the room created by a witch several centuries ago so that he could look in on the love of his life. The witch only allowed the ball to show the living one day per year to keep the dead from pining away in the room year round.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west from the viewing room, the light wavers as you move towards the gaping maw of the Devil's Den, the heat washing over you in fiery waves and foreboding darkness consuming all sight.

name: Cavern
description: a lonely and isolated place, a cavernous hole in the side of a craggy mountain that leads to a network of underground tunnels.
background: This cavern is home to many lizardlike creatures that are blind and live in the dark. They dwell in the cavern and lower tunnels, dragging the souls of the undead down occasionally to eat and torture

travel_descriptions.east: You traverse through the mountain’s winding tunnels, where the distant glow of magma becomes brighter with each step. The cavern opens up to a vast abyss, the chilling wind carrying the sound of agonizing souls. Approaching the Diablo’s fortress, the air grows warmer, the smoky air filled with the scent of ashes.

name: Winding Staircase
description: The outside of the Wizard's tower is spacious. There are trees to the left and and right just across from the entrance to create a path of where to walk. The Tower itself seems to extend to the skies. Magic surrounds the tower keeping a force field up at all times. It glows and hums as magic courses through it.
background: The original wizard to make the tower wanted to make sure that it's power and those inside of it never got into the wrong hands. So he created a spell that is taught to everyone who comes to learn their ways. Even some of the human travelers who come by have been known to know the special incantation to protect the tower should it's teacher fall.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending the stairs towards the Guard Shack, you feel a palpable weight lifted as you leave the magical aura of the tower behind. The path is worn but well-maintained, flanked by tall trees rustling quietly in the wind.
travel_descriptions.up: An air of anticipation fills you as you make the ascent to the Wizard's Quarters. Every step seems magically charged, the way lit by an ethereal glow that dances upon the ancient stone steps.

name: Guard Shack
description: A nondescript square building that has room for two guards that change shift every 8 hours.  There's a fireplace inside, food enough for a week and a large earthenware jug of water for cooking and drinking.
background: The Tower itself was built to house only two people at a time.  There is but one way in, and one way out.  The guard shack houses those who make sure nobody unwanted gets in, and nobody unwanted gets out.  They take their jobs very seriously, even though there's almost little to no activity.

travel_descriptions.up: Ascending the winding staircase, you feel an enchanting aura all around, a magic so surreal that it makes your senses tingle.
travel_descriptions.outside: Crossing the castle foothills proves to be a unique encounter with nature’s craftsmanship, each mound and crest hinting at legendary tales of the land's creation.
travel_descriptions.east: As you make your way towards the tower, you witness a manifestation of striking architecture. The towering structure intimidates, but the sight of guards maintaining vigilance provides a sense of safety.

name: Top Side Tower Overlooking View
description: Wide flat landscape. Wonderful view, stretching out for miles. Strong tower made of stone, small hills and mounds throughout the landscape. Large stairs inside the tower leading to the top.
background: This tower was made by the lands lord, as a watchtower the first defense and first response. It its considered an honor to be on tower watch, and light the signal fire to warn the nearby town and castle of pending danger!

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the tower, you traverse the ancient stone steps that have been worn by time. As you approach the base, the imposing stone tower looms above, its aged stonework projecting a sense of stoic resilience.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward from the tower, you pass through a rugged trail that takes you towards the castle's watchtower. The journey tests your mettle, but the sight of the vital defensive structure being manned by diligent guards gives you a sense of purpose and reassurance.

connections.down: In Front Of A Stone Tower

name: Wizard'S Quarters
description: Dark and musty, the Wizard's Quarters are filled with ancient tomes and mysterious items.  Scrolls and jars of mysterious reagents line the walls of the Wizard's Quarters, and magical lights flicker with a mysterious green flame.
background: The Wizard's Quarters are home to the enigmatic Wizard.  Often sequestered here for months at a time,  The Wizard's Quarters are seldom seen by anyone other than the wizard himself.  Travelers often seek the access to the Wizard's Quarters to request help from the powerful Wizard.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the Wizard's Quarters, one must carefully navigate the sinuous and narrow Winding Staircase. The stone stair seems carved directly from the tower's winding core, imbued with an enchanting nimbus, evoking a sense of trepidation and wonder.
travel_descriptions.east: In the east, a dramatic shift from the tranquil ambience of the Quarters leads towards the chaotic domain of the Wizard known as the Reagent Room. Borderline-obsessive research and experimental magic exemplified as scrawled formulae, makeshift apparatus, and a spectrum of bizarre concoctions captivate every gaze.

name: The Winter Gardens
description: The Winter Gardens' name is a bit of a misdirection - there are flowers here that bloom at many different times of the year.  It's almost the size of an entire town square, and it has almost every known flora of the Continent in it.
background: The Winter Garden was named not because most of the flowers bloom in the winter [not true], but because the Princess who came up with the idea did so in the dead of winter.  At first, only winter blooms were planted but as time went on, she kept adding and adding and adding on to it.  It's a very popular place to visit for people of all ages.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending from the lush Winter Gardens, one traverses through impeccably maintained foliage before reaching the naturally wild and earthy Castle Foothills.
travel_descriptions.inside: Taking a hidden path amidst the vibrant flowers, you enter into an uncannily still passageway that leads toward the mysterious darkness of the Wizard's Quarters.

name: In Front Of A Stone Tower
description: A large tower stretches high into the sky. It is made of gray stone blocks, some of which have softened edges illustrating aged signs of wear. Sparse grass grows around the base of the tower, dwindling down to nothing near the dark open doorway at the tower's front. A few rays of light shine into the doorway and brighten a rough stone floor, with specks of dust being illuminated by the sun's rays.
background: This tower was created a long time ago by workers unknown. It appears rather old, but has withstood the test of time.

travel_descriptions.up: Ascending the large steps, you feel small in the towering presence of the stone structure. The climb is strenuous but the view promises to be worth it.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east, the landscapes shift from the monotonous grey of the stone tower to a fortress alive with activity and anticipation.
travel_descriptions.inside: Entering the tower fills you with a sense of awe and trepidation, surrounded by ancient stones and an air of mystery.

name: Outside Tower
description: Moss grows from the tall stoic like structure adding to its mysterious presence. The stone walls appear insuperable like a mountain. The top is a pointed dome.
background: The outside tower vital for defense and the appearance of domination in the surrounding area. Along with its appearance, it fully functions as a defense against enemies far and wide.

travel_descriptions.inside: Entering from the outside, you brace yourself as you cross the dim-lit threshold into a different era, herded by stern stone-clad walls.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you tread cautiously down the worn path leading to the tower base, the warm glow of torch fires casting long, haunting shadows.
travel_descriptions.west: Turning west, you embark on a journey towards the Winter Gardens, your senses enlivened by a meandering path laden with a mesmerizing kaleidoscope of blossoming flora.

connections.inside: In Front Of A Stone Tower

name: Castle Foothills
description: Castle foothills are low mounds of earth, round on the top, swelling up from the ground. they have grass on them, and they are not flat, but rather uneven.
background: These low hills are naturally occurring and made, presumably by the gods, who got sort of chilly one day, and shivered so hard the earth furrowed and sort or got wrinkled up and never was the same afterwards, although some of the gods tried to smooth it back out, but they didn't try that hard, actually

travel_descriptions.north: Moving north a panorama of beautifully manicured gardens, blooming with flowers of all hues and scents, gradually unfolds before you. The journey, though a bit uphill, can be pleasant with the tranquil ambiance of nature.
travel_descriptions.inside: Venturing inside leads you to a sturdy, compact shack. The faint aroma of burnt wood and food lingers on the way having to squeeze yourself through a narrow path. The path is stern, reflecting the seriousness of guards' duty.

name: Tower
description: This outside tower is made from big stones. It is grey with wood trim. There is one glass window that is used as a lookout tower.
background: This outside tower is used to guard the castle. This is at the front of the castle and always has many guards working there.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking from the tower to the guard shack feels like an unwelcome downstep, from the majesty of the tower to the humble, demure guard shack. The trek is short but the drop in grandeur is palpable.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending to the top side of the tower offers an exhilarating experience. The stairs are steep, but the view from the top extends for miles, rewarding any who dare to scale the heights. It's a journey of excitement, trepidation, and awe at the expansive landscape that unfolds.

name: Watchtower
description: The tower is the largest section of the castle. It contains an observatory for nighttime scouting, but is also used by the wise men to study the stars. Armed guardsmen are always to be found keeping watch.
background: This is the first line of defense for the castle. Any incursion against the royal family begins here. At the first sign of trouble, the watchmen alert the castle with the use of an alarm horn they have on their person at all times.

travel_descriptions.east: You traverse through the open field feeling the cool breeze, as you approach the overseeing tower made by the land's lord, admiring the stretches of landscape and the strong stone structure.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving southwards, the formidable sight of the stone tower looms larger as you approach. The journey is quiet, save for the rustle of sparse grass under your feet and the gentle whisper of the wind.

connections.south: In Front Of A Stone Tower

name: The Tower Base
description: The tower base has a path of cobblestone leading to the entrance. Two torches are lit with large blazing fires. Most of the tower base is covered in moss.
background: This tower is a beacon of hope for the nearby village. It is where soldiers gather in times of war. The path to the tower has been walked upon by the country's greatest generals.

travel_descriptions.up: As you ascend towards the Outside Tower, you witness the moss-interspersed stones enhancing the mysterious appearance of this crucial defense point. The journey feels like scaling an insurmountable mountain, reflecting on its domination over the surroundings.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north takes you to the Tower, passing through stern grey stones with wooden trim. The presence of numerous guards enhances the importance of this lookout tower, which also stands as a sturdy guard to the castle.

name: Reagent Room
description: The room is incredibly messy, with many opened books and glass decanters littered across the room. Bright and glowing liquids sit inside bottles and jars and many animal test subjects are caged up. The room is seems to be very dangerous and filled with weird experiments.
background: The reagent room is where the Wizard likes to experiment with his chemicals. Once he studies about potions and collects certain ingredients, he comes here to mix and experiment on all the odd chemicals. Many inventions and elixirs were created here.

travel_descriptions.west: You leave behind the chaotic atmosphere of the Reagent Room, moving into a dimly lit corridor. The smell of old parchment grows stronger as you approach the Wizard's Quarters.

name: Boathouse
description: The boathouse is a very small building with peeling paint. It is made out of wood, with one half planted in the water on stilts. Inside, there are boats floating in the water. There are hinged doors which can be opened to allow boats to come in and out. There are some ropes and other tools a boater may need stored in the boathouse.
background: The boathouse was built on the small lake when the king found it while exploring as a child. His father was proud of his adventurous son's discovery and built the boathouse as a reward. The boy spent many days in there, reading or relaxing, or boating on the lake.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey to the Soldiers Camp involves a trek through dense undergrowth, where the air starts to fill with the subdued energy of a hidden military encampment.
travel_descriptions.east: The path from the boathouse to the Bog is filled with sticky mud and tall reeds, the croaking of frogs growing louder with each step.

name: Soldiers Camp
description: The camp is hidden away in a light forest of trees and brush that might be hard to find if there had not been a symbol on the trees leading up to it. You can feel the anxiety of the soldiers here, as this camp is not well fortified by any conventional means, but instead is supposed to be hidden and camouflaged to throw off anyone that might pursue. The camp is nothing more than a fire and some barracks. Nothing fancy to see.
background: This soldiers camp was created as there was need for a training and resting area for the soldiers of the king's royal army. The location is ideal as they have water and material. The king himself was excited by this spot.

travel_descriptions.south: Travelling south from Soldier's Camp, you traverse through dense thicket before reaching a serene lake. The boathouse lies ahead, its wooden structure a comforting sight amidst the quiet rustling of the lake waters.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading eastward from the camp, one must wade through the muddy swamp, its pungent smell permeating the air. Through the damp foliage emerges the intimidating structure of the military outpost, a constancy in the changing swamp.
travel_descriptions.north: As you trek north, the ground underfoot hardens to a cobblestone pathway leading to a mysterious bridge. The troll's bridge, notorious in every traveler's tales, looms ahead.

connections.east: A Military Outpost At The Heart Of The Swamp

name: Murky Water
description: The water is murky and dark. There are unknown dangers lurking in it, such as alligators and poisonous snakes. Plants and trees hide more dangerous animals. It is cold.
background: The swamp is a place where people go to tell scary stories. Brave children will sometimes venture there before their parents pull them back. Healers will sometimes look for plants that can have medicinal qualities in the murky depths.

travel_descriptions.east: Trudging through the cold, murky water, one makes their way towards visible buildings on stilts - the Boathouse.
travel_descriptions.west: Venturing west, the cover of trees grows denser, leading into the darkest part of the swamp, where creepy shadows lurk and the sounds of unknown creatures echo.

name: A Military Outpost At The Heart Of The Swamp
description: Moist, and murky the bog remained. As you reach the outpost that description doesn't change seeing the bog gobbers swimming through the thick water, and fermenting goblins perched atop the outpost's walls.
background: This outpost was set up to ward off the evil swamp monster Hoakbera from the Gumerian goblin clan. Ever since the year 193 the monster has been running amok in the swamp and nearby lands destroying livelihoods of goblins and moblins alike.

travel_descriptions.west: The path towards the Soldiers Camp is filled with the strife and tension of the military life, heightened by the camouflage and hidden nature of the area.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south towards the Bog, one is confronted with the cacophony of croaking frogs and the need for careful footing on the few dry spots.
travel_descriptions.east: The journey east towards the Haunted Swamp brings about a sense of fear and uneasiness, as one traverse the misty and smelly path into an area rumored to be cursed.

name: Bog
description: Frogs croak in the reeds that surround the bog. The water is very murky and underneath the surface tadpoles dart around. There are minimal places to stand to stay dry.
background: The frogs have made a home in the murky waters of the bog because they are able to hide from predators more easily. The seldom need to be on dry ground and there are a surplus of bugs for them to consume. The reeds are so tall that when birds land on them the frogs can see them and swim quickly away.

travel_descriptions.north: Navigating through the murky bog with tadpoles skirting away as you approach, you find the damp and dank military outpost rising in the heart of the swamp.
travel_descriptions.west: Tromping across the bog, observing leaping frogs and buzzing insects, the sight of a quaint boathouse on stilts paints a serene picture against the swampy backdrop.
travel_descriptions.east: Trudging through the sludgy bog under the echo of croaking frogs, the ominous visage of the witch’s house looms ahead, seemingly resisting the pull of the swamp.

connections.north: A Military Outpost At The Heart Of The Swamp

name: Troll'S Bridge
description: Muddy and murky waters lie under a bridge that seems to go nowhere. It is made of cobblestone and just as long as it is wide. Beneath it live a hideous troll that makes people pay to cross.
background: The troll has lived there for ages. It is a myth that he was cast there by a witch. Other's believe he so ugly that he was thrown away by his parents and he learned magic that gave him eternal life. He guards the cobblestone bridge and terrorizes people

travel_descriptions.south: A rugged path leading through dense forest to Soldiers Camp; the nervous energy of the soldiers can be felt from a distance.
