travel_descriptions.east: A narrow footpath towards Haunted Swamp; the chilling fog and eerie silence create a sense of unease.

name: Darkest Part Of The Swamp
description: The light doesn't pierce the heavy overhanging trees in this near pitch black area of the swamp.  The water is extremely murky and there are occasional fins poking up from the water belonging to some kind of creature.  The air is thick and heavy and insects constantly buzz about.
background: Creatures come back here to rest and feast on what they've captured from the main areas of the swamp.  This is an extremely isolated area that few humans ever come to willingly.

travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east, the heavy foliage begins to thin, allowing more light to filter through. The ground becomes increasingly soggy, and the air smells strongly of algae and decomposing vegetation, leading to the Murky Water.
travel_descriptions.north: Moving north, the swamp becomes more treacherous. Solid ground gives way to a sea of mud that sucks at your boots, and the trees grow close together, obscuring the sky. The chorus of insects fades, replaced by an eerie silence as you approach the Quicksand Pit.

name: Witch'S House
description: Old and worn by the time that has passed and the environment where it was built, the wood rotted and worn by the swamp. It should have sunk years ago into the swamp but somehow it remains standing despite the ever sinking earth around it.
background: This building was created by a coven of witches that used to roam the swamp, taking the children of the local village on its edge for use in their dark rituals. That is until the day a group of witch hunters tracked each of them down and strung them to the pyre. Now it sits as a reminder to those who use the swamp for their dark means that not even the mires are safe.

travel_descriptions.west: Wandering towards the west, you trudge through dense reeds, the croaking of frogs echoing around you as you navigate the murky waters.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, a cold chill runs down your spine, the air grows heavy, and the smell of decay fills your nostrils as you enter the dreaded Haunted Swamp.

name: Haunted Swamp
description: A misty, foggy area with the swamp. It is dirty and smelly.
background: This is a place that no one dares to go to. It is said to be haunted with many ghosts. Many people who have came here never returned home.

travel_descriptions.west: Navigating through the murkiness, you notice goblin-like creatures moving about. The oppressive humidity and the peculiar noises make you aware that you're nearing the swampy outpost.
travel_descriptions.south: As you head south, the damp earth gives way to a more foreboding scene. A scent of rot and decay wafts through the air as the dilapidated Witch's House comes into view.
travel_descriptions.north: Moving north, you traverse a path mired in puddles and overgrown. An enduring feeling of unease prevails as the silhouette of a cobblestone bridge under watch by an ominous figure looms ahead.

connections.west: A Military Outpost At The Heart Of The Swamp

name: Quicksand Pit
description: A large, gurgling pit of quicksand. Many adventurers and poor critters lie at the bottom of the pit. The pit is surrounded by an extensive swampland and is shielded by the many trees and shrubs that surround it.
background: The quicksand pit is relatively unknown by villagers because those that fall victim to the pit never make it out to tell its location. The pit swallows up 100 villagers a year on average. The villagers chalk up this statistic to a monster known as Bigfoot, snatching and eating people up while they sleep.

travel_descriptions.south: As you journey south, the greenery in the Quicksand Pit gives way to the darkness and serenity of the swamp. There's an eerie silence, broken only by strange rustling noises.
travel_descriptions.west: Leaving the quicksand behind, you move west over slippery moss-covered rocks. The air lightens as you approach the grassy bank, lively with the chatter of critters.

name: Bank
description: This is a grassy area that surrounds much of the swamp.  It's a plain field with some trees nearby along with some rocks.
background: The bank is where you will often see turtles sunbathing and various other wildlife resting before the waters of the swamp. You will also see peasants going out to fish in this spot

travel_descriptions.east: Venturing east from the bank, the ground turns from solid to muddy the closer you get to the Quicksand Pit. The air becomes heavy and damp, the smell of decayed foliage permeating the atmosphere as the taste of fear lingers at the back of your throat.

name: Hilltop Temple Grounds
description: A tall white building with stained glass windows and surrounded lush green grass.  It sits on top of a hill with many steps to climb.  Each room has a different setting and painted walls to set the mood.
background: Many people journey to the temple for peace, solitude, reflection and meditation.  They journey up the hill and steps that are cut into the side of the mountain.  Once they reach the temple grounds the view is luxurious, breath taking and serene.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending the hill from the Temple Grounds, one travels along a path lined with ceremonial stone pillars, leading to the imposing Temple Entrance.
travel_descriptions.west: Making your way west from the hilltop Temple Grounds, you stroll down a winding path surrounded by enchanted woodland, the sounds of nature guiding you towards the serene area Outside Of The Temple Offices.

name: Temple Entrance
description: The Temple Entrance is a large arch lined in ancient stones. There is a long walkway flanked by lighted torches. Immediately in front of the interest there is a surface with 5 rocks of different shapes and textures. To enter the temple, one must input the correct "code" by moving the rocks in front of to the correct spots.
background: The temple entrance is the only way to enter the temple of the Gods.  It was constructed a year after the temple was built to keep out the evil that didn't belong.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey to Hilltop Temple Grounds is a tranquil trek up a staircase cut into the mountainside, ending with a breathtaking view.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving towards the Temple Courtyard, you encounter a bustling congregation of people adorning the space with colourful cloths and prayers.
travel_descriptions.east: To reach the area Beside Temple Entrance, one must navigate a labyrinth of dense foliage and ancient, weather-worn stone.

name: Outside Of The Temple Offices
description: Outside the office is a beautiful garden filled with white flowers surrounding the entire building. There is a yellow brick road leading to the church. The surrounding trees and plants are beautifully trimmed and gives the area a peaceful atmosphere. Many doves and other birds love hanging around here enjoying its serene environment.
background: The area outside the office was made to look incredibly peaceful and beautiful. It was a place where people would feel calm and comfortable enough to express their sins and seek help from the clergy. Although the office may be simple, the outside looks similar to a king's garden.

travel_descriptions.east: As you move towards the Hilltop Temple Grounds, the path slopes upwards, and the air becomes more serene. The stepping stones lead you through an expanse of trimmed greenery and the tranquil chirping of birds surrounds you.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading to the Temple Guard Station, you walk a path that bends around the hill. You pass through a series of tall trees and can see the guards going about their duties in the distance. The aroma of burning firewood is strong as you approach.

name: Temple Gardens
description: The temple gardens are a beautiful place. There are many trees and flowers all over the Temple. There is a small water spring here.
background: Many funeral ceremonies have been held in this garden, staining its tranquil presence with haunting memories.

travel_descriptions.north: Your footsteps echo on the stone path as you leave the lush Temple Gardens, transitioning to a serene atmosphere surrounded by a beautiful white blossom garden leading to the outside of the temple offices.
travel_descriptions.west: Following the path towards the west, you leave the peaceful gardens. The ground gets rougher, and the sounds of guards chatting indicate the proximity of the Guard Station.

name: Temple Courtyard
description: There are lots of ornate statues everywhere.  It is pretty busy because everyone comes here to pray. There are colorful pieces of cloth tied randomly everywhere.  There is also a huge statue in the middle that everyone is gathered around to pray.
background: The temple is where everyone comes to pray.  It is the only temple for miles, so it is usually pretty crowded.

travel_descriptions.north: Traversing from the Temple Courtyard to the Temple Entrance, you admire the ancient grandeur of the arch and its stone pathway lined with flaming torches, readying yourself to solve the puzzle of the rocks.
travel_descriptions.west: Meandering from the Temple Courtyard to the Spring Bath, you feel tranquility wash over you as you pass by sweet-smelling rose bushes and approach the clear, mystical spring with its calming aura.
travel_descriptions.south: Ambling from the Temple Courtyard to the Decoration Shop, your mood is lightened by the beautiful display of home and party decorations and the aura of warmth suffusing the cobblestone building with blossoming flowers.

name: Beside Temple Entrance
description: The entrance to the temple is quite hidden - shrouded by many trees and shrubs. One wouldn't even think to give it a second glance, as the stone that was used to create the entrance is worn down. The textures and characters that once adorned the entrance are memories of the past.
background: The temple entrance is how one would gain access to the temple. It is very hard to find and many archaeologists try to find it every day. The king has a reward of one hundred sheep to the first person to find its location.

travel_descriptions.west: Venturing west leads you towards a large arch of ancient stones. As you approach, the glow of torches guides your way, illuminating a mysterious assortment of rocks. To reach the other side, you must decipher the code and arrange the rocks correctly.

name: Temple Guard Station
description: The guard station consists of a wooden building with a hay thatched roof.  Inside are some hay filled sleeping bags and a fireplace used to cook and generate heat during the colder months.  There's a small fire pit outside along with some wooden seats where guards huddle around and talk about the last gossip.
background: This guard station is used to house guards protecting the temple.  Frequently temple priests will come here to complain about lax security.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving from the guard station to the offices, you'll walk along a cobblestone path, flanked by rows of beautiful white lilies, leading to the imposing edifice of the temple office. You can hear the cooing of doves perched on the surrounding trees.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east towards the Temple Gardens, you navigate through the narrow footpath, with towering poplar trees on either side. The fragrance of flowers wafts through the air and the gentle rush of the water spring can be heard in the distance.

name: The Spring Bath
description: The spring bath is a deep, natural pool of crisp and clear spring water. It is surrounded by rose bushes on all sides except a northern and southern opening, which lead out of the enclosure of roses.
background: The water here is thought of to have some mystical properties, being that it is always cool and clear. The water from the spring is always used to bathe the bodies of those who are deceased prior to their funeral services. This is thought to help the deceased along in the afterlife, by imbuing the body with the mystical properties of the water.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking from the spring bath to the east, the sweet aroma of rose bushes fade away replaced by the smell of burning incense. Gradually the solace gives way to a sense of spiritual awakening, to the buzz of devout prayers at the temple courtyard.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south from the spring bath, the coolness of the water is replaced by the warmth of creativity from the decoration shop. One has to navigate through a cobblestone path lined with various colorful blooms before the inviting wooden sign of the shop comes into view.

name: Decoration Shop
description: Outside the Temple is the decoration shop.  It is made of cobblestone and has flowers growing on the sides and back of it.  It has a large wooden sign hanging out front identifying it.  The shop is full of decorations for your home as well as for parties.
background: The decoration shop is where all of the royal family goes to purchase the decorations for their homes. They go there also to buy decorations for outside, such as plants for outside temple.  The decoration shop is a happy place that is full of warmth and generosity.

travel_descriptions.north: Heading north from the decoration shop, the air grows thick with the scent of incense and devotional hymns can be heard in the distance. Statues start appearing around, leading the way to the Temple Courtyard.
travel_descriptions.west: A quick turn to the west brings about the sudden smell of roses and a drop in temperature. Water can be heard gently lapping against the stones as approach the Spring Bath.

name: Main Entrance
description: There are religious statues standing outside this temple.  The outside of the temple is fairly plain itself and imposing looking.  The floor is made out of stone with a bridge leading to the entrance.
background: This is where all those who worship come through.  They are greeted by the impressive statues standing outside the temple.

travel_descriptions.north: A serene journey passing through a well-paved path, lined with beautiful trees and a gentle stream running alongside. The uphill trek is a peaceful one, filled with the sights and sounds of nature and the refreshing mountain air.

name: Bone Pit
description: Grungy and damp, a hole in the ground filled with remains of the fallen. A pungent odor rises from the opening, warding off anyone nearing the area. Ivory spikes with brownish red tips line the outside of the pit.
background: The bone pit is rumored to have been originally used by an ancient king to persuade traitors to expose their counterparts.  The king was said to toss the traitors loved ones into the pit, one by one, until he got his answers, eventually tossing the traitor in as well.

travel_descriptions.east: As you move towards the east, the scent of decay fades behind you, gradually replaced by the more comforting scent of the temple grounds. The solemn statues greet you from afar.

name: Temple Main Room
description: The massive statues are the biggest sight to behold of this room. There are four main statues, all of which resemble old monks of passed time who once served the Temple. Adjacent to these statues are drapes that fall from a 50ft ceiling all of which have their own distinct color and symbol, representing different villages in the area. There are massive pews on both sides of the room, adjacent to the red carpet down the center leading to the main throne under the statues.
background: The monks of this Temple are avidly religious. The worship not only the past lives of old monks, but deities as well. These monks are supporters of Victorian architecture, and it shows within the walls of this room.

travel_descriptions.south: As you leave the temple main room, your path gradually descends toward the Temple Entrance. The air grows lighter, less oppressive, as you navigate the high arches and pass the stone Monks' statues for the last time. The torchlight flickers intermittently, casting long, dancing shadows that lend an eerie feeling of bidding farewell to the sacred spaces you leave behind.

name: Outside Temple
description: The outside temple is surrounded by lush green trees that have aged beautifully and carry beautiful blossoming jasmine flowers with a pink and white outline. The candles melted around the temple shine brightly and bring a light of glory to the place.
background: Outside the temple by the entrance is where the building of it started. It started with 400 steps of stairs coming up the mountain, and at the top of the mountain after the war, the temple was built. It has held many festivals, and the front door is made from a rare wood from a tree that doesn't exist anymore.

travel_descriptions.inside: Moving from the lush, aromatic environment surrounding the temple, you cross the journey of 400 stairs towards the main entrance, greeted by religious statues marking the passage to the sacred interior.

name: Garden
description: Many beautiful types of flowers and plants grow here.  There's a small shed used for store gardening equipment.
background: Members of the royal family come here to unwind and contemplate matters.  There's artists who also come to create paintings of the beautiful flowers here.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking east from the garden, one can catch the scent of horses and hay, reaching the plain wooden stable with some handsome horses.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, one leaves the tranquility of the garden, walking into a grand courtyard made of hand carved stones, where one might luck upon the king taking a stroll.
travel_descriptions.west: Travelling west from the garden, lush greenery gives way to a more manicured and grand setting, the esteemed Palace Garden, well-tended by royal gardeners.
travel_descriptions.up: Moving upwards, one enters the humble peasant living quarters, a stark contrast from the royal garden with its bare and primitive setup.

name: Stable
description: A plain wooden building with some hanging tapestries.  There are some handsome looking horses that reside here along with some farm equipment stored inside.
background: This is where the royal family's horses are stored and cared for.  Servants come here to take care of the animals along with retrieving equipment.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the garden, you are met with a mix of sweet and earthy aroma of the flowers and plants. As you admire the detailed designs of the tapis, the stable slowly fades from view.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading for the training fields, the clattering of swords against shields and the shouts of training soldiers begin to fill your ears as you leave behind the quiet stable.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending towards the moat, the smell of damp earth and murky water engulf your nostrils. The sight of the stable becomes smaller as you plunge further down.

name: Courtyard
description: The courtyard is a huge pavilion of stone patio outside of the palace. It is in the shape of a large rectangle and boarders the west end of the palace. It is bordered in luscious hedges dotted with colorful flowers, particularly roses. Throughout the courtyard there are potted flowers, stone benches, statues and bird baths and fenced garden plots, and also a central atrium, that all evoke the feeling on an Arcadian garden.
background: An ancient king and queen, when they had just been married, built a new summer palace. The king let the queen design the beautiful courtyard as a gift. From then on, the courtyard had been one of the most famous, beautiful focal points of the palace.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking towards the Garden, the scent of blooming flowers intensifies and various twittering birds can be heard. A path lined with vibrant, well-manicured flora guides you to your destination.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, the peaceful ambiance of the courtyard gives way to the clamor of Training Fields. The path is worn, evidence of countless footsteps of the knights who have tread this way.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving towards the Main Castle Doors, the grandeur of the castle comes into view with each step. The golden doors gleam under the sun, reflecting the castle's magnificence.

name: Training Fields
description: The training fields are a large expanse of grass fields, filled with all sorts of training apparatus for the noblemen and soldiers. The grass is not anything fancy, scuffed up and dry in many places, but it gets the job done. There are hay bails arranged all over, training courses, archery targets, weights and more scattered about in stations.
background: The training fields have been being used for several generations. The inhabitants of the palace used to train somewhere else until flooding destroyed the area, and it was moved here. The fields have been an efficient place and have hosted all of the fighters of the kingdom at some point.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west transports you to a grand courtyard bustling with people and surrounded by the architectural majesty of the palace.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading towards the south, noises of neighing horses and the scent of hay reach you as you approach the royal stable.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving eastward, you encounter the majestic exterior of the palace courtyard, filled with beautiful flowers and vines, grand fountains, and sit spots where people gather.

name: Palace Garden
description: The Palace garden is a lavish and lush garden filled with delicate roses and towering trees. In the center of the garden stand's a statue of the nation's founding leader. The statue is surrounded by a moat. There are stone walk ways throughout the gardens for visitors to walk through.
background: The palace garden was created to provide a place of relaxation for the town's royalty. It is tended to by the most esteemed gardeners, and is always well taken after.

travel_descriptions.east: You stroll along the garden path, smelling the sweet scent of blooming flowers mixed with damp earth. Majestic trees create a canopy of leaves above your head, providing shade and freshness while you move towards the vegetable garden.
travel_descriptions.south: You depart the garden, making your way towards the stony courtyard. The stones underfoot are warm from the sun, and the sound of birds can be heard in the distance. You pass by carved benches and statues, catching glimpse of colorful blooms around you.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the palace garden, you smell the freshness of clean linen. Sunlight filters through the trees, throwing dappled light on the path that leads to the bustling area of laundry lines.

name: Peasant Living Quarters
description: The peasant living quarters are generally very bare, dirty, and primitive for the most part.  It's essentially a large straw hut with hay-filled sleeping mats on the floor, and piles of clothes.  There are several plain white sacks containing potatoes, apples, and other basic foods for the residents here.
background: The peasants come here at the end of a long day to rest and get ready to do it again.  They find themselves quickly falling to sleep after a long day.

travel_descriptions.down: Walking down a worn, dirt path surrounded by greenery, you arrive at the encircling smell of fresh vegetables and herbs.
travel_descriptions.west: A short journey across the courtyard brings you to the edge of a wide, dangerous moat with sparkling water.

name: Moat
description: The thick moat is filled with murky dark water. It is very wide and surrounds the entire castle. Alligators and other dangerous creatures roam the moat, ready to warn away intruders.
background: The moat protects the castle from those who would do the castle harm. It is very deep and its gators keep everyone away. It sparkles under the summer sun. People warn their children to stay away!

travel_descriptions.up: To reach the Peasant Living Quarters, you must navigate the castle's complex layout, traveling through the bustling courtyard and residential area filled with scurrying servants and lingering smell of wood smoke.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you must cross the open castle land, stark in its simplicity yet magnificence, with the assortment of royal horses grazing idly, leading you towards the royal stables.

name: Main Castle Doors
description: The main castle doors are ornate. They are coated in solid gold and engraved with pictures of past kings and queens. They have huge gilded handles. They are heavy and have a faint metallic odor. They gleam in the sunlight.
background: It takes four large men to open each door. They provide a strong defense for the castle. During the day they usually remain open as people come in and out of the castle. At times when the castle is under siege, the doors are closed. They have never been penetrated by the enemy.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving north from the castle doors, you cross the large stone bridge over the castle moat. The courtyard can be seen in the distance, surrounded by lush hedges and colorful flowers. You can hear the faint sound of birds chirping.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west from the castle doors, you pass through a narrow cobblestone path lined with rosemary and lavender. After a short walk, you reach the entrance of the Royal Gardens, signaled by an ornate wrought-iron gate.

name: Garden
description: The bright green shoots of new vegetables and herbs are seen in rows of dark brown earth. The stone wall that surrounds the garden is low enough to let in the warm sun. A basket has been left near the wall for gathering items for meals.
background: The King's late mother had a humble background and it was her idea to ensure the palace had a vegetable garden so they could make homey meals.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking towards the stable, the soft scent of hay and horses grows stronger. The clomp of hooves on wooden floors is heard before the building comes into view.
travel_descriptions.south: Strolling southwards into the Courtyard, the fresh open air and vibrant colors from the flowers create a sense of serenity. The sound of people conversing in quiet tones can be heard as you approach.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward, the delightfully fragrant smell of flowers and the faint sound of chirping birds guide you towards the Palace Garden. It is a journey that is calming to the senses.
travel_descriptions.up: As you ascend towards the Peasant Living Quarters, the simple and bare conditions contrast greatly with the grandeur of the Castle. It is a stark reminder of the life lead by those serving the royals.

name: Courtyard Exterior
description: Paths as well as vines, fountains, and sitting areas are decoratively placed through out the courtyard. It's a place where people are welcome and arrive to enter the castle of the court.
background: Centuries old but maintained to look as good as it ever has. It's suppose to be a place to make the people of the kingdom feel like their king is a servant to them not them being servants to a king. People gather and arrive here to see the king, petition the court or just meet with friends who live or work at the castle.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west leads to the training fields, a vast expanse of dry grassland dotted with various training paraphernalia where warriors and noblemen hone their skills.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you enter the stone-paved courtyard. Its tranquil atmosphere is further enhanced by beautiful flowers, stone statues, and the sound of trickling water from various fountains.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving eastward, the hidden garden unveils itself. Overgrown yet still breathtaking in its chaotic beauty, the sight of roses and the statue of a woman evokes a sense of mystical serenity.

name: Laundry Lines
description: The laundry lines extend for meters. 6 rows of lines go from north to south. The area is filled with people putting their clothes to dry. All the lines are in an opening of trees that the sun hits perfectly to help dry. To the right you can see a stream through the tree where people go to wash their clothes before they hang them to dry.
background: The laundry lines were set up so the villagers could have a good place to dry their laundry next to a river. They used to hang them at home but as there were times the sun wouldn't hit them directly it became a bad way to manage so instead they came together to get a place where everyone could dry.

travel_descriptions.up: Walking from the laundry lines you will enter the Palace Garden, a breath-taking transition from the simplicity of the laundry lines to an extravagant display of nature carefully crafted by the finest gardeners.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west from the laundry lines takes you to the Courtyard. A short walk will have you leaving behind the common simplicity of the laundry lines to the impressive stone architecture and well-manicured flora of the Courtyard.

name: Courtyard
description: Hand carved stone surround the courtyard made by the most skilled masons with their impervious designs. Its large and quiet with hanging moss, and several beds of flowers.
background: The king loved to stroll through the courtyard to think on his reign. The king will often bring subjects to walk and talk about business and needs of his people.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking north from the Courtyard you are enveloped by the lush greenery and fragrance of the Garden, a sight that is sure to attract artists and royals alike.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east from the Courtyard, your footsteps take you to the bustling Training Fields, echoing with the clangs of steel and shouts of diligent trainees.
travel_descriptions.south: A trek towards the south brings you to the grandeur of the Main Castle Doors, their golden shimmer a vibrant testament to the palace's affluent past.

name: Royal Gardens
description: Lined with rose bushes that look as if they have been watered by the God's, the Royal Gardens is a beauty to behold. An intricate labyrinth made of shrubs is at the center ending with a fountain. There are various benches on the sides of the rose bushes and a small lake in the back drop.
background: The Royal Gardens were conceptualized by the late great Queen. She wanted a beautiful promenade to walk her dogs and converse with her bed maids about court gossip. It was originally commissioned to be 1/2 an acre but has been expanded as time has gone on.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking east from the Royal Gardens, the sight of gold coated Main Castle Doors gets larger, the engraved images of past kings and queens becoming clearer with each step. The faint metallic scent fills the air as one reaches the doors.
travel_descriptions.north: Towards the north, leaving behind the rose bushes, the path leads you to the stone patio of the Courtyard. The colorful flowers from hedges and aroma of roses take you to an entirely different world. The stone benches and statues become noticeable as you move closer.

name: Courtyard
description: An area with a beautiful garden in center surrounded by stone walls with entrances to different parts of the palace.  There's statues of mythological figures in different corners of the courtyard.
background: This is an area where members of the royal family entertain guests.  The inhabitants of the palace may also use this area to walk among a garden and enjoy the sunlight.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking towards the north, the aroma of different types of flowers become stronger which aligns the path to the garden.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you'll cross a long field with mowed grass which leads to the training fields--you'll hear the clashing of swords and archery targets being hit.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving southwards, you'll approach brilliant gold doors that lead to the royal castle--you can hear faint sounds of people and animals from inside the castle.

name: Hidden Garden
description: There are plenty of roses, wilted, but still red.  A large statue of a beautiful woman stands in the middle, ivy growing around her.  She seems very kind in her expression.  It seems as though she may be buried underneath.  There is an overgrown mess of plants that form an archway that she is staring at.
background: This is where the King buried the love of his life who died in childbirth.  She was very fond of dancing.  The king has not visited in some time and it is forbidden for others.

travel_descriptions.west: Exiting the Hidden Garden to the west, you cross the somewhat unruly greenery and pass under the overgrown archway, letting your fingers gently brush against the cold stone statue one last time. Leaving this silent memorial behind, you then step onto a cobblestone path leading to the Courtyard Exterior, where life blooms in stark contrast.

name: Scenic Overlook
description: This lovely clearing overlooks the great mountain range. It is covered in wildflowers of all different colors. There are stone benches where one can sit.
background: The scenic overlook is the most beautiful location on the trail. It was made to give people a place to sit and reflect on the beauty of nature. For many years, people enjoy it. There have been many proposals and was even a wedding!

travel_descriptions.east: The path to the Opening To The Drawbridge Of The Castle is laden with mystery and anticipation. The route is lined with dense forest and strewn with indications of historical conflicts.
travel_descriptions.south: The journey to the Grassy Plains feels like stepping into a nature painting. One can almost hear the flutter of butterfly wings and soft squeaks of tiny critters, as the sun casts cheerful rays on the stone pathway.

connections.east: The Opening To The Drawbridge Of The Castle

name: The Opening To The Drawbridge Of The Castle
description: The trailhead to the forest is a dirt trail, dusty as it has not rained in a while. The overhang of the trees is luscious and green with only patches of sunlight beaming through the dense canopy. There are many large trees, some with arrows still stuck in their trunks. The trail is treacherous as it leads through the densest part of the forest, through a stream and to a well-hidden castle. Once inside the forest, the shade and canopy has provided plenty of opportunities for foliage to grow making it harder to follow.
background: The trail leads straight to the drawbridge of the castle. There are arrows stuck in the trunks of the trees from previous battles and the trunks also show scarring from sword hits. The trail leads straight through the forest to the castle which is hidden by the luscious canopy of the trees. Worthy opponents of the castle can get through the trail; however, they then are at the trailhead and face the castle's kingdom and army.

travel_descriptions.west: Travelling west to the Scenic Overlook, you will stroll through lush greenery and wildflowers, with the breathtaking mountain range growing closer with each step.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south towards Knight'S Hunting Ground, you will traverse along a dirt path, encompassed by a rustling wildlife and thickly wooded areas, brimming with life and adventure.
travel_descriptions.east: Venturing east to The Ghost Trail, you will find yourself under the eerie glow of moonlight, in a path cloaked in ghostly legends, as the stars twinkle ominously overhead.

name: Knight'S Hunting Ground
description: The knight's hunting ground is lush and full of animals and other organisms. This area features trees, a long dirt path, and a variety of colorful wildlife.
background: There isn't very much to be said about the hunting grounds. Its keepers take a lot of special care to ensure there are plenty of animals to hunt.

travel_descriptions.north: The trailhead to the forest is a dirt trail, dusty as it has not rained in a while. The overhang of the trees is luscious and green with only patches of sunlight beaming through the dense canopy.
travel_descriptions.east: The Tree of Spirits is a large oak tree that is over 500 years old. It's branches spread out several feet and it is home to several animals.

connections.north: The Opening To The Drawbridge Of The Castle

name: The Ghost Trail
description: The Ghost Trail is dark, with no torches or writing.  The stars shine over head, the glow of the moon seems to beam in lulls. The trail seems to go on east or west as far as the eye can see.
background: It is rumored if you walk the ghost trail long enough you will end up like the little boy who led his family on this road to murder them.  Their spirits are said to collect little children.

travel_descriptions.west: The trailhead to the forest is a dirt trail, dusty as it has not rained in a while. Through the densest part of the forest, you will come across a well-hidden castle.
travel_descriptions.south: Heavily forested with dense undergrowth that stretches for miles, this is often used by the King and his family members for evening walks.
travel_descriptions.east: The trailhead is a worn down area leading in many directions, showing the wear of constant horse travel and other methods of transportation.

connections.west: The Opening To The Drawbridge Of The Castle

name: Tree Of Spirits
description: The Tree of Spirits is a large oak tree that is over 500 years old. It exceeds 100 feet tall and 10 feet wide. It's branches spread out several feet and it is home to several animals.
background: The Tree of Spirits is supposed to contain the souls of everyone who has died in the forest for the past 500 years.  Legend has it if you disturb the tree, it will capture your soul as it's own.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west from the Tree of Spirits, one enters the Knight'S Hunting Ground. The journey is rather serene, carrying the aroma of the forest with the occasional rustle of wildlife.
travel_descriptions.south: Southward from the Tree of Spirits are the Grassy Plains. The transition from forest to open fields is refreshing with a gentle cool breeze and a clear sky filled with cotton candy-like clouds.

name: Grassy Plains
description: Flowers are blooming all around and the sun is shining. Small animals are roaming the area looking for food and relaxing. The trail is located in the center of the grassy plain and is made of stone.
background: This trail leads to a cave deep in the forest. Many people have followed the trail and entered the forest to look for treasure that was lost long ago, but no one has been able to find it.

travel_descriptions.north: Traversing northwards, the ethereal whispers of gossamer winds lead to the mystical Tree Of Spirits, where vibrant, life-filled flora effortlessly transitions to an arena of timeless legacy.
travel_descriptions.west: Journeying west along the meandering stony trail, the panoramic vista of the Scenic Overlook unfurls in swathes of colorful wildflower expanses under the vast azure stretch of the sky.

name: Trailhead
description: the trailhead is a worn down area leading in many directions, it has shown the wear of constant horse travel and other methods of transportation. it is till well used but in need of a makeover
background: this area is notorious for fights and robberies, there are many poor people in the area who could use some food and money

travel_descriptions.west: Moving west from the Trailhead takes you down an eerily calm path. Darkness swallows up any light as you venture further into The Ghost Trail, feeling the crunch of fallen leaves underfoot and hearing the faint whispering winds that carry old tales of ghostly encounters.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the Trailhead, you enter the bountiful Hunting Grounds. You can hear the rustling of the lush green foliage in the breeze and distant calls of wildlife, creating a symphony of nature that is both soothing and exciting for any hunting enthusiasts.

name: Trail Exit
description: The woodland area creates a gentle, peaceful feel as one walks along past the leafy fronds and gently shifting foliage.  The path is firm and wide, having been traversed by many feet, but not so wide as to allow a merchant's cart to pass through.  A bird's cry sounds in the distance, followed by a ruffle of feathers, and then silence.  The beauty of the forest hides the struggle of nature that lies within...
background: This forest has an abundance of deer and other wildlife that the local peasants often hunt, when politics allow.  Various kings have shown their largesse or greed by allowing their subjects free (or lack thereof) access to what is official part of the Royal grounds, though no one of noble blood has been see there for centuries.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north along the wooded trail, the bones lining the path creak eerily beneath your footsteps. The once vibrant trail now hums with a mysterious energy.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east towards the Hunting Grounds, the scent of rich greenery grows stronger. Echoes of knightly yells and the rustling of wildlife resonate even strongly as you move closer.

name: Path In Forest
description: The trail path is a well designed path in the middle of a deep, dark forest. It is made purely from the bones of the innocent that were sacrificed to the ogre. There are eyes looking in the dark at you as you walk on the trail.
background: The trail used to be a fun and interesting trail to walk on in the light before the war against humanity. Thousands of humans fought for the right of the trail and now it is dark and mysterious.

travel_descriptions.south: The woodland area creates a gentle, peaceful feel as one walks along past the leafy fronds and gently shifting foliage.  The path is firm and wide, having been traversed by many feet, but not so wide as to allow a merchant's cart to pass through.
travel_descriptions.east: The trailhead is a worn down area leading in many directions, it has shown the wear of constant horse travel and other methods of transportation. It is till well used but in need of a makeover.

name: Hunting Grounds
description: The hunting grounds are spacious and full of wildlife. A variety of hogs and oxen cross the grounds every day. The fields are lush with green and the skies always deep blue.
background: The hunting ground is revered among knights. The greatest knights and archers practice day and night slaying pigs. Some say the grounds are even haunted with the spirits of the deceased organisms.

travel_descriptions.west: The woodland area creates a gentle, peaceful feel as one walks along past the leafy fronds and gently shifting foliage. The path is firm and wide, having been traversed by many feet, but not so wide as to allow a merchant's cart to pass through. Various kings have shown their largesse or greed by allowing their subjects free (or lack thereof) access to what is official part of the Royal grounds, though no one of noble blood has been see there for centuries.
travel_descriptions.north: The trailhead is a worn down area leading in many directions. Tattered from constant horse travel and other methods of transportation, it is in need of care. This area, notorious for fights and robberies, reveals the hardships of the less fortunate who frequent it.

name: Across The King'S Garden
description: Heavily forested with dense undergrowth that stretches for miles. A cool mist enshrouds the trees and shrubs. The sounds of birds chirping fills the air and in the distance, the rumbling of a waterfall can be heard.
background: Often used by the King and his family members for evening walks. It is part of the Kings Land that has been left untouched by man and is only presided by nature itself. It is said that the King often brings his war officers here to discuss secrets and make important decisions.

travel_descriptions.north: The path to The Ghost Trail is a haunting journey; it feels as though the air turns chillier as you continue forward.  A sense of eerie silence grows, as the chirping of birds falls away, replaced by the distant howl of a lone wolf. Before long, you find yourself engulfed in darkness, standing before the ominously named Ghost Trail.

name: Back Room
description: The back room holds the texts for the priest. There are a few bookshelfs with many books. There is a desk with some readings on it.
background: The priest uses the room to study and learn about religion. He reads the texts and chooses from them to speak about.

travel_descriptions.south: A brief walk down a narrow hallway of stone and history leads from the back room to the sanctuary, a journey quiet and contemplative as befitting of the religious atmosphere.
travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping inside the choir room from the back room, the atmosphere changes as the solemn silence gives way to the harmonious echoes of choir rehearsals past.
travel_descriptions.north: Travel from the back room to the church entryway requires a trek through the stony, dark corridor lined with religious emblems, a serene precursor to the grandeur that awaits in the main hall.

name: The Chapel
description: Quiet and serene, the chapel is lined with oak pews where worshipers can sit
background: Made 100 years ago, this chapel has a long history in this town. people have gathered here to worship for 3 generations!

travel_descriptions.outside: Walking towards the altar, you cross the expanse of the chapel, your footsteps echo off the stone floor. The intricate beauty of the jeweled cross captures your attention.
travel_descriptions.inside: Entering the fairies church, you're engulfed by smoke that seems to dance and play pranks. Tripping over unseen obstacles quickly becomes a shared experience among visitors.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east, you step into the Church foyer. The quiet murmur of waiting worshipers envelops you, their voices blending with the faint smell of incense and ancient stone.

name: Sanctuary
description: Enthroned in lavish hues of red and gold, the sanctuary is filled with candles and statues.  Enveloped by a high decorating ceiling, the sanctuary glistens with the sparkling golden adornments.
background: The sanctuary was built hundreds of years ago, paid for by a rich local family who was known for being very religious.  The sanctuary took 6 months to completely build.

travel_descriptions.south: You pass through a small doorway from the sanctuary, the sensation of hushed reverence giving way to the cozy bustle of the Rectory.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward from the sanctuary, you enter the Nave with its straight expanse leading to the pulpit, in contrast to the serene sanctuary you just left.
travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping inside from the Sanctuary, the transition is stark as you find yourself in the unpretentious confines of a small church. This change brings with it a certain rustic charm.

name: The Choir Room
description: It is a room with a table in the middle with chairs around it.  There is a closet that contains Choir robes that are long white and green accents.  There is a small keyboard in the corner.
background: The choir room is always filled with music.  Many people like to pass by and listen to hear the songs being sang.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking to the South, you feel a gentle reverence as you approach the Inside Church; a pious fragrance of olives and incense fills the air, mingling with the soft murmur of villagers in prayer.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading East to the Paladins' Memorial Chapel is like stepping into a vibrant tableau of valor and faith. The vivid mosaics guide your path and the tale of the Paladins unfolds with each step.
travel_descriptions.outside: Heading outside to the Rectory, the gravity of ages and tradition press almost tangibly against your shoulders. The rustic charm of the wooden establishment nestled amidst the noise of the world coaxes a sense of comfort from simplicity.

name: Prayer Bell
description: This is a semi-outdoors location with low stone walls, a great view of the surrounding town, creaky worn out floor, and a very large brass bell.  There is a long rope hanging down the center that one can grab and proceed to ring the bell to call people to service.
background: Church assistants come here to call worshippers to service.  It can be a bit of a pain as one advances in years and needs to make the trek up.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving northward from the Prayer Bell, you approach the Stained Glass Room, where the air fills with a profound sense of divine beauty listening to the silent stories narrated by the colourful glass figures.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending down towards the sacristy, you navigate through a dimly lit stone staircase, the hallowed atmosphere embraces you as you pass by rows of shelved relics and decorative worship tools casting long shadows.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending upward, you traverse a narrow passage, covertly tucked behind an austere wardrobe. The journey is an eerie experience, a testament to the church's history and the secrets it has safeguarded.

name: Church Entryway
description: The church has marble floors and a huge frost window. There are benches made from wood and a big organ can be seen at the front stage. There is gold trim all around the church.
background: This is where everyone comes to pray. It is a place to worship god and have ceremonies.

travel_descriptions.east: As you make your way to the east, you can see the confessional, shrouded in hushed silence and a sense of history, emanating a potent aura of faith and reflection.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, your path takes you to the Holy Alter where an ethereal beauty awaits. It is a sanctum aglow with the brilliance of precious metals and the potent energy of deep reverence.
travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping inside, you approach the Church Altar. The journey is accompanied by a hallowed silence that sets the tone, preparing your spirit for the manifestation of the divine.

name: Next To An Altar
description: A medium length table is covered with a deep red bolt of silk. The edges of the cloth have ornate embroidered gold patterns. A hefty sized ornate cross decorated in diamonds, sapphires, and rubies reflects bits of colored light across the top of the table. Up above, a decorative stained-glass window looms.
background: The altar is the proud centerpiece of the church. The jeweled cross is known throughout the lands, and by itself draws its own share of people to the church. During the daytime, colored light plays across surfaces and faces as the window is purposefully positioned to catch the sun's rays.

travel_descriptions.west: You exit the serene atmosphere surrounding the altar, stepping on the creaking wooden floor, moving towards the dense crowd gathered in the vast Sermon Hall.
travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping away from the public view of the altar, you slink into the sequestered Confessions Room, the scent of old wood and whispered truths touching your senses.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving south from the altar, you approach the imposing door of the High Priest Chamber, a place steeped in deep religious significance and locked away mysteries.

name: Inside The Fairies Church
description: No one has actually seen it, but a fairy interpreter asked a fairy and they described it as just a cloud of smoke and once in a while you trip over something in the floor.  The fairies purposely leave their trash in the floor because they think it is funny when people trip over them.
background: The fairy church isn't really a church like we think.  Its more of a place for fairies to play tricks on other fairies.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the ethereal realm of the Fairy Church, you enter the attic. The journey is steep and a little dusty, the light fading with each step you take.
travel_descriptions.inside: Going deeper inside the Fairy Church, you are drawn into the study room. The air grows heavier with knowledge and the scent of ancient texts fills your nose.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending further within the church, you approach the grand Chamber Entrance. The air seems to buzz with spiritual energy and the rich scent of burning candles is more potent here.

name: Church Coat Room
description: The church coat room is dark and smelly, holding all the coats and boots of the congregation who happen to be in the church at the time. There is a candle sconce high on the wall near the entrance, benches along the back of the room and huge baskets along opposite walls: one for coats and the other for footwear.
background: This room used to be a primitive bathroom ten years ago, but became too smelly and difficult to clean. People complained, and it was re-purposed as a coat room. It is vented at the top for when they used to burn excrement.

name: Church Foyer
description: This musty room is fairly plain and drab and is surrounded by stone walls.  There's religious tapestries adorning these walls along with some chairs for people to wait before the actual church is opening up to them.
background: Worshippers comes to the foyer to wait to be let into the main church for daily service.  This is also the place where rumors fly about as worshippers talk among each other.

travel_descriptions.north: Ascending the stone steps to the north, you can feel the cold seeping through the soles of your feet. As you reach the top, the grandeur of The Main Chapel unfurls before you.
travel_descriptions.west: A creaky path to the west leads to an old wooden Pew. The journey is filled with an eerie quiet that only amplifies the whispers of the past.
travel_descriptions.beside: Venturing beside the Church, you pass through rows upon rows of Church Pews. The journey is both daunting and awe-inspiring, with the shadowy hush a stark contrast to the outside world.

name: Inside Church Back Row
description: Inside the Church is the Back Row seat.  It is reserved for all who wish to mingle and have the status of the rest of the congregation but they do not.  They are not quite outcast, but they must wait for the proper respect of the rest.  In front of the painted black row seats are the rich mahogany sets.
background: The back row seats were designed in the village church to show there is something lacking in its occupants.  Those sitting there knew they had to wait for acceptance to reach the mahogany seats.  They weren't bad, they were just unknown or considered mysterious people.

travel_descriptions.east: A short walk from back row towards the front leads you through the long, wooden pews, capturing an environment imbued with reverence and faith.
travel_descriptions.outside: Stepping outside, the celestial light filtrating through the multihued stained glass paints a vivid tableau on the age-old pews, reflecting the church's spiritual and historical significance, making the travel almost ethereal.
travel_descriptions.inside: Moving towards the interior of the location, you'd find yourself amidst the dogs' domain, which is somewhat chaotic, giving insights into a quirky, informal animal society.

name: Popes Dormitory
description: This is the quarters where the pope of the church lives. It is a loft with a bedroom, and makeshift kitchen and a sitting area. It has a wall full of gospel books and materials and the linens are all silk.
background: This is where the pope of the church stays during his religious times of the year where he is to be present in the church at all times. This would usually fall around holidays, and there is only enough room in the dormitory for the pope himself.

travel_descriptions.up: A twisting wooden staircase leads upwards to the Bell Tower, the air growing colder as you ascend.
travel_descriptions.front: Moving towards the Front Row, you pass through the sacred space of the church, the scent of incense filling your nostrils.
travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping into the Confessional Room means letting go of the noise of the outer world, embracing the quiet and soulful solitude within.

name: The Rectory
description: This room is quite small and cramped. It's about the size of maybe three wooden carts, which is to say, it's very small. There are boxes all over the place and many candles and other church accessories. There are several big robes hanging next to what looks like a very small closet. Some candles shed an eerie light on the room, flickering softly. There is a small cabinet with several religious tapes and records and a few books. A book case is near and contains many common religious texts.
background: The rectory is one of the most important rooms in the church, as it is where the priest and others get ready before they start church, where the put on robes and cassocks and the like. It is vital to the church as a matter of fact. Visibility to the room is blocked off by the altar in front of it, so church goers cannot see it unless they walk behind the altar. It seems to be used as a bit of a storage area for religious artifacts.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking south to the Confessional, you creep through corridors imbued with a heavy air of sanctity. The faint scent of incense begins to permeate the air as you approach.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west towards The Sacred Temple, you traverse the austere garden of the Rectory, its peaceful ambiance a stark contrast to the enormity of the temple’s splendor that looms ahead.
travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping inside The Confession Box is a quasi-spiritual experience, with the claustrophobic space and solemn atmosphere making your heart pound in your chest.

name: Nave
description: Long, wooden pews are positioned one in front of the other from the front of the room to the back. There are ornate stained glass windows on each side depicting the steps in the Crucifixion story. A long, red runner goes up the middle of the room to the altar.
background: The nave was beautifully decorated and was a wonderful place to worship. The priests would go up and down the aisle to collect the tithings from the congregation every Sunday. The room was almost like an echo chamber in that when the congregation would sing it would sound like there were ten times more people than there actually were.

name: A Small Church
description: It's a very humble abode - any smaller and you could mistake it for someone's home.  In the front room is a small altar for prayer and offerings.  The two rooms to the sides are places where the priest and a traveler can rest.
background: There are many roadside churches in the land and this is but one of them.  Most travelers come here to rest on their way to the nearest town, still a day's travel away.

name: Inside Church
description: Small wooden crucifix decorations, wooden benches, small and dim windows, wooden walls, vases on small pillars, plants near church entrance
background: The church is a humble place of worship for a small and poor village. The local villagers don't have much and yet they place as much money into the church as they can.

name: Paladins' Memorial Chapel
description: The Paladins' Memorial Chapel is dominated by ornate mosaics made of thousands of tiny colored tiles in bright, vibrant colors which depict the heroic exploits of the Church's Paladins, including both victorious and tragic ones. The mosaics do not shy away from depicting bloodshed and gore. At the center is the shrine, which doubles as the Sarcophagus of the first Great Paladin. The chapel is always filled with white roses, which are reserved solely for the funerals of Paladins.
background: The Paladins' Memorial Chapel was built to commemorate the lives and deaths of the Church's many devoted Paladins. It was funded by donations by both normal people saved by the Paladins me wealthy local merchants looking to expand their own renown by proximity. The tiles were all fashioned by local workshops, and took up so much time and material that the price of porcelain and other ceramics skyrocketed during its construction.

name: Rectory
description: The rectory is very fragile and rickety due to age and various periods of neglect. Everything is wood-based and scratched up and chipped, including the beds strewn about. The clergymen would call it "cozy" but the space within is almost claustrophobic.
background: After years of renovations to other part of the complex, the rectory remains the oldest piece of the property. A close-knit order of monks had built the rectory hundreds of years ago as a way to house the workers and perhaps any wayward souls. All who work here, including sometimes the head priest, sleep here.

name: Stained Glass Room
description: the room is full of stained glass art of old and new testament stories, it has several old parchments and dust settling on the wooden chairs.
background: the stained glass room is used to educate people on old and new testament stories.

name: Sacristy
description: The Sacristy's walls are fitted with rows of shelves, each with a different trinket or worship tool sat upon them. There are various robes and gowns folded on these shelves as well for the members of the service to use. The stone room is flooded with light from the large stained glass window that sits on the eastern wall of the sacristy.
background: The sacristy acts as a storage for the church, and keeps the tools of worship when not in use. Prior to a service the priest can obtain all the items needed for the day's service inside of the sacristy. Though not at the forefront of the church, the sacristy is also open to the devout who may wish to act as alter servants for the service.

name: Hidden Passage
description: A rough, narrow passageway descends through the thick outer wall of the church. Stair-like stones lead downward into darkness.
background: When the church was constructed long ago, the pope of that time had a hidden passage installed behind the wardrobe to avoid capture in case of war. It has allowed several popes to escape harm. Several others have used it for less legitimate purposes.

name: Confessional
description: The room is a small box, composed of sharply cut stone. The room is uncomfortably small, and filled with a lingering scent of something unfamiliar to the occupants.
background: The confessional is used by the clergyman to collect the confessions of the parishioners. However it has secretly been used to gather sensitive information to blackmail the parishioners.

name: Holy Alter
description: The altar is big and it is also beautiful, it has many precious metals around it. It is said that the altar has a sample of every element in the kingdom, the most precious and unique stones decorate it.
background: The altar is the most holy place in the kingdom, royalty travels across the realm just to be in this holy place and get rid of evil. The leyend of its power is told frequently and one of the most known stories in the realm.

name: Church Altar
description: An ornate altar studded with many jewels. A chalice and a golden plate rest upon a white cloth. It is 5 feet high and 20 feet wide. The high priest stands before it while giving a sermon to his followers.
background: The altar was given to the church as a present from the King centuries ago, after the terrible crusades. Many visitors find the altar remarkable, since it is made of solid gold. Religious meal prep is the primary use of the altar.

name: The Sermon Hall
description: Inside the massive Church you can see a stage to the far back. Benches lines the hall where some are kneeling in prayer. To the far right there's a row of candles, some lit, some not. On the stage there are bleachers for people to stand on to sing the songs of their people. Sitting on the center of the stage is a large podium where the priest gives his sermons.
background: The Sermon Hall used to be the first thing you saw when you walked into the first. Back when it was first built there were only a few who came to visit and hear the Priest's words. And as more people came by, either from the village or just traveling the area started getting more and more full. People waiting at the confessionals, as there was only one at the time. Then while waiting for weekly services the smaller area could no longer hold everyone so they decided to expand upon it, and create a bigger space where everyone was welcome.

name: Confessions Room
description: This is a small, dark, confined wooden space with a divider that separates the priest taking the confession and the church goer.  There is a small seat on each side so that they can take their time discussing their sins.
background: When a worshipper feels guilty, he'll head to the confessions room in order to seek penitence from the priest.  There have been some terrible crimes divulged here but still remain secret.

name: High Priest Chamber
description: Many books and religious idols litter the chamber. A squat chair with a high back sits at an ornate desk. A cup of holy water lies on the desk. Bookshelves line the entire chamber with religious texts.
background: Many a high priest has taken residence in this chamber. It is where the priest works from and studies from. When he is not giving a service, he is in this chamber, poring over ancient religious texts, looking for anything he can use to give meaning to his religion. It smells of elderberries.

name: Attic
description: The attic is drafty and dark. Items such as handmade angels and Christmas decorations fill it. There is one small round window to let in light although they do not have glass. It is very hot and smells of dust. Extra candles fill one side and donations fill another.
background: The attic has been used for many years to store items.  It contains many years worth of materials that the church uses. They will use it to store whatever they need. It has been quite useful and helped to keep the lower rooms clean.

name: Study Room
description: A plain room with shelves of religious text are stored.  There are tables and chairs situated around the room available for use.  There are some trunks with books stored.
background: Priests and scribes come here to gain knowledge and translate texts.  The day's sermons are also composed here by candle light.

name: Chamber Entrance
description: The entrance to the chamber is very ornate. It is filled with many religious symbols. There are candles and prayer books on  a table right next to the door. It is a wooden door. There is a sign near the front, which lists the name of people within the church. They can smell the scent of candles burning.
background: People who need help come in and out of the door. It is where they enter the sanctuary to speak to the clergy. There is a sense of calmness that descends upon people as they enter the chamber. They go from the cold outside to the warmth of the chamber.

name: The Main Chapel
description: The church is a fairly simple one. Rows of pews lined up and facing a pulpit with podium and some stained glass on the walls. The building is made of old wood, but is sturdy and has stood for many decades.
background: The church has been the focal point of this village for a long time. The bell tower has always been used to announce good or bad things happening to members of the community. Whenever it rings, the inhabitants of the village gather at the church to hear whatever news is to be delivered.

name: Pew
description: The pew is worn from many years of being sat on during services.  It looks fairly basic upon first glance.  But there is something just under the surface, something moving.
background: This pew is in the church that the King and his family used to attend.  They have all died under mysterious circumstances and are buried in the cemetery.  No one has come into this church since then and it's fallen into disrepair.  But just under the surface, if one were to look close enough, there is something going on, something brewing.

name: Beside Church Pews
description: The church pews fill the church as far as the eye can see. They are made of wood, harvested from ancient trees long ago. They gleam with the look of tender love and care, since they are polished after each ceremony.
background: The church pews were built centuries ago by the first founders of GloopdeGloo. The founders wanted their followers to sit in something simple, but somewhat ornate. The pews are not comfortable by any means, but they are nice to look at. Numerous butts fill the pews every Sunday for the weekly ceremony.

name: Nave
description: There are rows of long brown wooden seats, a grey stone floor and transparent glass window panes depicting religious iconography.  There are also copies of religious literature available.
background: A fairly plain area, this is where the congregation meets.  They come here to listen to religious sermons, sing, and enjoy worship.

name: Nave
description: The nave of the church is a simple but ethereal looking room that is big enough to hold a couple hundred people. There are simple wooden benches, ten feet long, arranged in rows through the room, with one aisle down the center. The benches face the pulpit. Along the side walls of the room there are beautiful stained glass windows depicting Biblical imagery.
background: The church is the oldest church in the region. It was built centuries ago by Christian missionaries, and it has hosted many weddings, blessings, funerals and holidays of the local populations and their ancestors.

name: Along The Pews
description: The alter faces west so the rising sun hits the cross just right each morning. The bejeweled cloth that lay over the alter sparkle and the room practically glows.
background: People come far and wide to this church as it produces an almost magical atmosphere. People claim miracles have happened here because it is so beautiful.

name: The Dogs' Domain
description: there is puddles of saliva everywhere, as well as fecal matter. the area is unclean and smells as such. it is clear animals live in this area, and are very rarely seen by people
background: legend has it that the animals that live here are self sustaining and never eat food given to them by humans. they have an informal community set up.

name: Bell Tower
description: The Bell Tower is steep and rises high above the building. The stairs are made of rickety wood and go up thirty stories. The bell is so old that the cracks seem almost perfectly set in the iron.
background: The bell is rung daily at high noon. It also tolls when someone has died or married

name: Front Row
description: The hard bench is facing the most beautiful alter human eyes have ever seen. Gold drapes the walls behind where the preacher stands. A large dark oak and gold bench in front of where they would stand. A large piano off to the side.
background: This church has been around since early man and still has a large weekly following that gives all they can to keep the church in tip top shape.

name: Confessional Room
description: The confessional room is small and cramped, offering access to only a single person at a time.  Once inside this small, wooden room, A person is alone with nothing but the cardinal and their own sins.  The confessional room has a single wooden bench and small table holding a candle, with a sliding window that allows words to pass through to the other side.  The cardinal waits on the other side, ready to absolve someone of their sins.
background: The confessional room is one of the oldest rooms in the church.  Pilgrims come from far away to unload their sins and seek forgiveness from the cardinal.  Tucked away in a small corner of church, the confessional room is modest and secluded.  Although the demand is great, the confessional room is always ready for those who have need of it.

name: Confessional
description: The red velvet curtains provide privacy and speak to the washing away of sins as the repentant person leaves the booth. The solid oaken bench provides no comfort, and hurries the churchgoer along in their confession. Behind the sheer screen is the waiting priest. Ornate designs are carved into the side of the confessional. Above it is a painting, dulled by age, but still depicting Jesus' death and resurrection with resounding clarity.
background: The confessional is as ancient as Catholicism itself. Since the beginning of the Sacrament of Penance, this tiny, benched room has provided countless sinners with respite from their sin.

name: The Sacred Temple
description: The Sacred Temple is where spiritual individuals go to worship the Gods.  It is massive in size compared to other buildings in the town.  A lot of ancient symbolical artwork covers the windows and a deep glow comes from the alter.
background: The Sacred Temple has been around for more than the present local townsfolk can remember.  They also swear by it's powers on granting their wishes if worshiped correctly.

name: The Confession Box
description: It's a simple little confession box with a window where you can talk to the priest. The seat it wooden and lined with golden trim. The Window is covered by a golden cloth with a dragon on it.
background: This church is where all confess to the priest about their wrong doings. It is the center of the kingdom of Dark Thorn. The church is Thousands of years old and still stand for the just good of god. The confession box is one of many in the church.

name: Cloud Nine Bar
description: A bar in the clouds. Lively atmosphere with good drinks and even better views.
background: The bar was built as an escape from the doldrums of a working day. The bar is enjoyed by all citizens in the city in the clouds.

travel_descriptions.west: Descending towards the west, the busy, vibrant atmosphere of the Main Square Of The City In The Clouds gradually envelops you. Amidst the bustling crowd, a vast array of stalls and shops sell all manner of wares.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving southwards, the jolly sounds from the Cloud Nine Bar fade. Soon, the somewhat somber, lively environment of the Mess Hall Of The Servants greets you. Here, the workers take their meals and share their stories of the day.
travel_descriptions.up: As you ascend, the bar's hum diminishes; replaced by the silent majesty of the night sky and the quiet stars. Once you reach the serenity of The Moon Observatory, your view of the cosmos is unobstructed and breathtaking.

connections.west: Main Square Of The City In The Clouds

name: The Moon Observatory
description: The Moon Observatory is a dome shape with ornate wooden levers along the walls. When pulled the levers open the curved wooden ceiling to the night sky above.
background: The king commissioned the observatory to be built for his queen after she became enraptured with looking at the night sky and tracking the movement of the moon.

travel_descriptions.down: A journey filled with vertigo-inducing views as you descend through fluffy cloud formations and past floating islands, towards the ethereal glow of the Cloud Nine Bar.
travel_descriptions.east: An enchanting trek through a mystical mist-filled pathway. Echoes of magical spell chants and dragon roars can be heard as you approach the Wizards Dragon Egg Incubatory.

name: Mess Hall Of The Servants
description: this is a long narrow room with wooden tables down the center and wooden benches all along. candles burn on the table and sconces on the wall. there is black smoke and soot everywhere. the smell of garbage and bad cooking abounds. the cobbled stone floors are greasy and there is moss along the wall bottoms.
background: anyone who works in labor for the king is bound to be here at set times for whatever meals are left from the higher ups. some food is not too bad but the sanitation could be better. everyone from blacksmiths to tanners and fletchers will be found here at times and gossip runs rampant.

travel_descriptions.north: You ascend a winding brownstone staircase patterned with lichen, gradually noticing the rising decibels of jovial laughter and clinking glassware.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking down a series of narrow corridors, the echo of your footsteps gives ways to the buzz of countless voices amalgamating under the labyrinthine arches of the grand hall.
travel_descriptions.outside: Venturing beyond the servants' entrance, a crisp breeze gusts as you make your way towards the boisterous sounds and warm, inviting light of the Cloud Tavern.

name: Harp Store
description: it's a cloudy store selling harps for angel men
background: this is a business for angel men to purchase their musical instruments, they sell harps mostly, but there are some lyres and a few bouzoukis

travel_descriptions.east: Moving east from the Harp Store, you leave the melodic hum of ethereal instruments behind, stepping out into the busy hubbub of the Main Square of the city in the clouds, adorned with various stalls and bustling with the city's vibrant life.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south from the Harp Store means leaving behind the soft strumming of harps. You approach Dragon Lift, a dull, boxy building standing distinctly from its cloud surroundings, hinting at the rare and exciting experience of dragon riding that lies within.

connections.east: Main Square Of The City In The Clouds

name: Main Square Of The City In The Clouds
description: The main square is the central location of the city in the clouds, the city on the top of the mountain where the clouds pass. It is extremely busy, with many vendors selling wares such as the blacksmith and the sword-maker. The ground is made of stone, and buildings surround it. There are also tables where people can eat after they've gotten food from the various people cooking over open fires.
background: The main square is the central location for the city in the clouds. It is where people come to chat and spend the day. People come here to eat and learn the day's news. They can see the newest creations from the blacksmith. They also hold public meetings and performances.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking westward, the sounds of delicate musical notes fill the air as you approach the Harp Store, where angel men purchase their musical instruments.
travel_descriptions.east: As you make your way east, the atmosphere lightens, laughter and clinking glasses growing louder as you near the lively Cloud Nine Bar - an escape from the mundane.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, the grandeur of City Hall appears. Its doors, always open, welcome all citizens; a symbol of unending public service and the heart of the city's operations.

name: Cloud Tavern
description: this is a tavern in the cloud city, a rowdy place of winged drunkards throwing winged darts and drinking from winged tankards
background: This is the local watering hole of angel men who come here after work to socialize after work and blow off some steam

travel_descriptions.inside: Navigating through the uproar of the tavern, you disappear through an unassuming door into the dimly lit, smoky confines of the Servants’ Mess - an abrupt transition from the bar's frivolity to the labor-hardened ambiance.
travel_descriptions.west: Stepping westward, you take the amazing Cloud Elevator, ascending the sky-high layers of the city until you reach the unimpressive but intriguing Dragon Lift, evoking a sense of thrill at the exotic adventure that awaits inside.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east, a grand structure looms in sight - the hallmark of the city's vibrancy, the Grand Hall. The journey is a surreal glide through billowy clouds, casting transitory shadows against the colossal entrance to the hub of city life.

name: Grand Hall Of The City
