description: A great massive hall with chairs and tables. several door ways line the walls of the hall leading to other places. A massive front door that is slightly swung open.
background: The grand hall of the city is where most business for city matters take place. Be it a festival, exotic markets, or even the royal weddings. People may come and go to the grand hall as they please unless the massive door is shut which hasn't happened in years.

travel_descriptions.north: Exiting the grand hall via the city's main street, the shifting clouds and mountain air accompany your journey to the bustling main square.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward, the clinking of tankards and boisterous laughter lead the way to the lively Cloud Tavern.
travel_descriptions.east: Travelling east, the aroma of cooking food and distinct clamor of the servants' chatter mark the path to the Mess Hall.

connections.north: Main Square Of The City In The Clouds

name: Dragon Lift
description: You reach Dragon Lift via the Cloud Elevator, which is a series of rising clouds that you step on to ascend to the highest cloud in the city. Dragon Lift looks really drab on the outside. It is a dull brown, boxy looking building but has a red awning proclaiming Dragon Lift in golden script. Inside Dragon Lift, Joel is waiting in his tattered smock to rent you a dragon that you'll swoop around the clouds on. When you enter the door to Dragon Lift, you realize it's bigger than you imagined and feels like a barn with dragons in stalls that you can examine.
background: Dragon Lift has been around for over 75 years and even though the owner, Joel, is often sued by customers when flights go wrong, the business is pretty profitable.

travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east from Dragon Lift, you ride a dragon along the cloud path towards the clamor of boisterous angel men at the Cloud Tavern. The soothing rhythmic beat of the dragon's wings in the air makes the journey ecstatic.
travel_descriptions.up: Traveling up from Dragon Lift, the dragon whisks you above the cloud skyline towards the Harp Store that appears like a cloud fortress from distance. You feel the rush of cool, high altitude breeze against your face and the city beneath turns miniature.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south, you board a dragon and soar lower towards the city's Observatory. The impressive view offers the expanse of the cloud city beneath your feet and creates a blend of thrill and vertigo.

name: Observatory
description: High atop the tallest tower in the city, the observatory is a large, single, circular room. It contains one window, almost the entire length of the room. Dozens of telescopes are pointed outside of this window. Through these telescopes, people in the observatory can see in all directions. Inside the room are tables, lined with maps and instruments. Globes and scales are also found throughout the room. There is one door leading into the room, and one leading outside to the deck.
background: From high in the clouds, the denizens of the city always wished they could see what was going on in the world below them. By building the observatory in their tallest tower, the people knew that they could now see not only the goings on in their city, but could also see what was going on underneath their city. In this way they will always know if danger approaches them from below, and they will be ready to fight it. Ever since it was built, the observatory has been an important location for the defense of the city. Adjacent to the room they built a deck, and a large trumpet there can immediately notify people of an attack. Meanwhile, the security room below can be notified to ready their forces.

travel_descriptions.north: Taking a series of escalading clouds, you ascend higher into the city towards the drab but intriguing Dragon Lift, anticipation building at the prospect of a dragon ride.
travel_descriptions.up: As you move upwards to The Moon Observatory, you can feel a change in the air; it's cooler, thinner. The anticipation of viewing the night sky through the observatory fills you with a sense of excitement.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east towards the Wizards Dragon Egg Incubatory, the air grows warmer, filled with a magical energy. You anticipate being able to witness the fascinating process of nurturing dragon eggs.

name: Wizards Dragon Egg Incubatory
description: This room has stone recesses filled with hay. It is warmed by a fireplace and jars that glow blue and sit around the floor. the walls are covered with heavy cloth to further hold in the heat. the room is circular with a hall coming in from both sides. there is a round stone table in the middle with several pieces of lab equipment on it. there seems to be a few round objects like large stones buried in the hay at places.
background: this location is used by a wizard who has been in a kings hire. he is trying to both hatch, and train dragons to fight along with soldiers. female dragons are kept nearby under the guise of many promises or treachery.

travel_descriptions.west: Ascending the towering spiral staircase, you wind your way up to the Observatory. As you ascend, you can feel the air thinning and cooling. The city sounds slowly fade away replaced with the soft whispers of the wind.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you find yourself on a path lit by twinkling lanterns, leading you towards The Moon Observatory. The journey is peaceful, with the serene silence of the night occasionally interrupted by the hoot of an owl.

name: Underwater Cave
description: The underwater cave is dark and rocky. Inside the cave fish and tadpoles have taken over. The water is cold, no light gets in. Once inside, a rocky outcrop allows swimmers to come up for air.
background: This underwater cave holds many secrets. It is impossible to reach it from dry land. One must swim into the cave from the bog. Inside it is lit by a single ever-burning torch where the coven meets every full moon.

travel_descriptions.up: You scrabble up a slippery and dark slope, with the cold water dripping onto you from above.
travel_descriptions.south: A winding passage leads south, with faintly glowing crystals providing weak illumination of the damp walls.
travel_descriptions.outside: You swim through a narrow underwater tunnel that opens into a surprisingly clear and quiet river.

name: Bat Room
description: It is cold, dark and filled with bats. it is humid and there are some paddles on the ground.
background: There is a bat king and bat queen and their children bats. They live in the deepest place. They have a big mushroom like beds. Other bats are always working for royal family.

travel_descriptions.east: Navigating through the swarm of bats, the light from the entrance of the Bandit Lair soon starts to become more visible, characterized by a faint murmur of coarse voices and the clattering of steel.
travel_descriptions.west: As you move westward, the space plunges into a daunting darkness. The echo of your footsteps is the only company you have, signaling your entry into the Dark Cave.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending from the Bat Room, the echoes of bats slowly fade away and are replaced by the somber dripping of water, hinting towards the bleak Gallery above.

name: Underground Chamber
description: This location is very gloomy, damp and magical. Has a lot of geodes and various types of crystals.
background: Not just anyone can enter into this underground chamber because it is guarded by mystical lions.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey towards the Underwater Cave is filled with rocky terrain and cold, dark water. Along the way, you have to take a deep breath and swim underwater until reaching a rocky outcrop for air.
travel_descriptions.south: The path towards the Troll's Lair is hazardous, filled with the stench of rotten meat. You have to tread carefully around bones and stalagmites, keeping your senses sharp in the eerie darkness.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling to the Secret Tunnel involves slipping through a well-hidden door behind storage chests and barrels. The journey through the damp, mossy tunnel, lit by faint light at the end, is thrilling and chilling.

name: The Troll'S Lair
description: Covered with rotting meat from nearby wildlife, the Troll's lair reeks of death.  If the stench alone wasn't enough to scare off an unfortunate travelers who stumbled upon it, the bones of unlucky spelunkers would be.  The Troll places his spoils near the numerous stalagmites on the damp cave wall, his red eyes patiently scanning the dark cave interior for anything that may disturb his isolation.
background: Used as a story to scare local children, the Troll is very reclusive, and prefers a life of solitude in his lair.  While a few brave knights have tried to root him out from his home within the cave, none have ever escaped.  Now, most let him be, happy to grant him lease within the darkness underground.  The Troll leaves his lair at night searching for food, and then drags it back into the cave to feast on it.

travel_descriptions.north: You squeeze through a narrow opening into a claustrophobic pathway that leads to the Underground Chamber. As you move forward, you can sense the air becoming increasingly damp and mystical.
travel_descriptions.outside: Exit a teetering mouth of the cave that leads outside. As you fumble through the dark, the flickering torchlight and drawings on the cave wall guide you towards the outside world.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south, you cross a cold, treacherous path filled with eerie noises. The air is heavy with humidity as you approach the Bat Room, the echoing of bat cries reverberates around you.

name: Secret Tunnel
description: Your senses are met with the dank moisture of a secret tunnel. The stony walls are full of lichen and cave moss. Stalactites and stalagmites pepper the small channel, which bleeds in a pinpoint light from a far off point. The chill air of the King's forest whistles through the tunnel interior.
background: This tunnel provides escape to prisoners with enough coin to bribe the guards. While escape is possible through other means, slipping five copper to the militiaman in charge of relieving you of your wares may grant you access to the tunnel. The door was well hidden and unassuming, blending in the wall behind chests and barrels in the storage room. The tunnel is a natural formation, used by early pioneering guards to make a few extra coins on top of their salaries.

travel_descriptions.west: Delving into the Underground Chamber requires navigating through a dimly lit pathway lined with shimmering geodes and enigmatic crystals. A mystical aura permeates the air, resonating from the unseen mystical lions guarding the entrance.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling into the Cave is like venturing into the belly of the earth. It's an eerie trail that gradually disappears into the inky blackness, lit only by the sparse torchlight that bounces off the cold, damp walls.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending to the Underground River demands a blind leap of faith into the darkness. The subtle echo of water lapping against rocks is the only indicator of the hidden network of waterways filled with gleaming, colorful gems.

name: The Underground River
description: The river is small and winding and hard to see because there are no lights within its' location. The river has many colorful rocks and gems.
background: The local teenagers found this location by accident after sneaking away from their parents. It was known afterwards as a local hangout from parents and local stresses of life.

travel_descriptions.up: Your senses are met with the dank moisture of a secret tunnel, filled with lichen and cave moss. The chill air of the King's forest whistles here, promising an escape for those fortunate enough to find it.
travel_descriptions.outside: The brightness of the torch-lit cave contrasts starkly with the dark interior of the underground river. The journey breathes life back into you, with depictions of previous Kings illuminating the historical significance of this place.
travel_descriptions.south: As you swim towards the underwater cave, the chill of the water bites at your skin, giving way to a darkened habitat teeming with aquatic life. A hidden coven meets here under the glow of a single ever-burning torch.

name: Cave Exit
description: The large cave is covered along the walls with bright torches.  A large hole has been carved in the ceiling of the cave, right above the ladder that descends into the underground cave.  On good bright days, sunlight directly surround the hole with the gold ornate ladder descending into the underground part of the cave.  On the walls of the cave the torches illuminate many ornate drawings and paintings mainly dealing with the history of Kings of the realm.
background: This cave was discovered quite by accident during an expedition.  The explorer, Rosco Monteguy thought perhaps when finding it there was an underground stream.  He returned a year later to explore and upon digging the hole found a literal goldmine in jewels.  Rosco, ever the patriot returned to the King and told him of his findings.  Rosco is given a statue at the cave entrance to signify his achievement.

travel_descriptions.inside: Venturing inside, you travel deeper into the cave's stony heart, eventually reaching the creepy Troll's Lair that echoes ominously with distant drips of water.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, the echo of your footsteps leads you through a labyrinth of winding tunnels towards the gentle lapping sounds of the Underground River.
travel_descriptions.east: Walking eastwards, you move towards the dim sunlight seeping through the moss-covered entrance, where the faint sounds of the outside world grow gradually louder.

name: Dark Cave
description: Its dark, not much light can be seen in this hollow and empty cave site. Its made of stone that has been here seemingly since time began, the walls are hard as diamond, yet black like darkness itself.
background: Unknown cave happened upon, it seems there are no stories, or tales for this place. It seems untouched by human life, as if the world has kept this secret for itself for centuries. We will be able to tell the first tale of this location.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking towards the east, you can hear a faint flutter of wings and feel the temperature drop, hinting at the bat-infested room ahead.
travel_descriptions.west: Venturing to the west, you feel the dank chill of the unexploited cave, a silent monolith that whispers tales of the unknown.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling down south, an ominous vibe begins to creep over you as you near the infamous bandit lair, a place shrouded in danger and mystery.

name: Cave
description: Cold and dark, the moist cool walls enclose all who proceed. With just torches to light the way the large opening gets smaller and smaller.
background: The cave is a dark and mysterious place with stories of hidden treasure and littered with bones of those who have searched for it. The endless passages are enough to drive ones sense of direction aerie.

travel_descriptions.east: A daunting journey towards the east takes you to the Dark Cave. Facing complete darkness with the echo of your footsteps for company, you walk into uncertainty.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving west takes you towards an inconspicuous nook that exposes the Secret Tunnel. The journey is filled with an air of mystery, with the damp, stony surroundings of the tunnel whispering untold stories.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south introduces you to a grand vista of the Underground Cavern. The transition from the ordinary cave to the cavern draped in glittering gems is both exciting and mesmerizing.

name: Gallery
description: The cave is pitch black and smells of dank and mold. It's quiet except for a faint dripping noise from water overhead and the occasionally scurrying of an unseen rodent through the darkness. Barely discernable by the light of a torch is a small pile of bones in one corner. From what type of animal they are from is unclear.
background: This cave used to be used a a wine cellar many years ago, until alcohol was outlawed by the king after his son died in a drunken brawl. Now it sits empty and rumor has it, enemies of the kingdom are kept down here.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending into the Bat Room requires one to adjust their eyes to the deep blackness as air temperature drops and a distinct, musky scent of bats fills the air.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward towards the Underwater Cave, one must carefully wade through mud and murky water, with a constant feeling of something lurking in the depths below.
travel_descriptions.outside: Exiting the cave is a relief as you step out onto a massive ladder amid bright torch light that casts glowing shadows on the walls and reveals the cave's rich history.

name: Bandit Lair
description: The outside of the cave looks normal. Inside goes for about 10 feet til' you reach the front of the Bandit lair. Inside is a barracks and dining hall with beds and a big table with chairs around it.
background: A very well known bandit gang live in this cave. They have been known for stealing many royal treasures but also killing many innocents. The bandits know they are well known and use that to incite fear into the locals that settle near the cave.

travel_descriptions.north: Venturing from the Bandit Lair to the Dark Cave, you navigate through unsteady terrain, the air growing colder and darkness creeping in as you advance.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westwards towards the Bat Room from the Bandit Lair, the silence is replaced by bouts of high-pitched screeches. The walls gain a slick texture, and faint fluttering sounds fill the ears.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the Bandit Lair to the Entrance is like stepping out of a chaotic timeline into tranquility. The harsh laughter and clinking metal fades into a peaceful rustling of leaves and chirping of birds.

name: Entrance
description: The entrance to his cave is covered in hanging moss with shrubs on either side of the entrance.  The path to this cave is a small dirt one with low grass on the floor.
background: No one really knows what this cave is used for.  Some say for witchcraft and devil worship, others say mythical creatures reside here.

travel_descriptions.inside: Descending ladder into the brightly illuminated cave, you are surrounded by various ornate drawings and paintings narrating the history of the realm.
travel_descriptions.up: An unsettling sense of danger accompanies your journey towards the Bandit Lair, where lawlessness reigns.
travel_descriptions.west: Advance towards the whispering whisper of the Underground River, a winding path in the dimly lit, hidden away from the world.

name: Cave
description: This cave is big but has no lights. It is made from stone and has a small pool of water in the back. The floor is made from dirt.
background: This cave is only used when the village is being attacked. It is a place to hide from the enemies during war. The cave is good for hiding cause it has no lights and is very hard to find.

travel_descriptions.east: Travelling through the narrow passage to the east, you rely on your touch to navigate as the darkness engulfs everything, heralding the approach of the Dark Cave.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving to the west, the damp air and mossy stones underfoot provide a hint of the Secret Tunnel lying ahead.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, a sudden chill hits you, along with the twinkling reflection of various gems indicating the entrance to the Underground Cavern.

name: Orc Cave
description: It is a dark cave that is cold and damp inside. The floor is rocks covered it bat poop. It is damp from the ceiling dripping of water. The cave just goes on what seems to be endlessly into the dark abyss. The only lite you can see is from the distance entrance of the cave.
background: The cave is an old orc hiding place. It housed thousands of orcs that used it for shelter and to store their gold. The orc population has died and there is now very little that remains of the orcs that used to occupy this cave. Robbers have stolen anything worthwhile in this cave.

travel_descriptions.south: As you head south, you sense the lingering essence of a lingering scent of orc. The chill wind blows against your skin, making you appreciate the cavern's dry, stone-shot walls.
travel_descriptions.east: You move east, trekking through the damp ground. The rays of your torch cast long eerie shadows on the cavern, revealing untold mysteries.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending to the Primary Cave, the trek up is jarringly exhausting. The steady drip of mineral rich water from above echoes in your ears.

name: Underground Cavern
description: The underground cavern is covered in precious metals and gems. In the wall, rubies, emeralds and sapphires sparkle. There is gold and silver, shining brightly. It is cool in the underground cavern.
background: By law, the jewels belong to the king. Yet he lets people go into the cavern to look at the beauty of his gems. People love to go in there and enjoy the coolness, especially in the hot months. They must bring candles, because it is pitch black!

travel_descriptions.north: The walk towards the Orc Cave becomes increasingly colder and darker, urging the need for a source of light. The faint smell of dew and moss intensifies with each step, igniting an air of trepidation.
travel_descriptions.west: Journeying west towards the Cave, the air chills as the light gradually succumbs to the crepuscular gloom. The sound of trickling water and distant echoes sparks an unease of the unknown.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending to the Entrance, you feel a temperate gust of air ascend as you carefully navigate the rocky steps. The scent of damp earth fills your nostrils as the cavernous darkness envelops you.

name: Primary Cave
description: Dark and with a lot of space in it. The primary cave has a scary look that scares people away. Underneath, in the floor, many precious minerals that no one dares to get out.
background: The primary cave is respected and feared among people across the land. Tales of adventurers that have gone inside the cave but never seen again are part of the stories told by the elder.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending deeper into the cave, the air grows colder and damp. The echo of your footsteps is the only sound accompanying – a sign of the orc cave below.
travel_descriptions.east: Venturing eastwards, the cave narrows and darkness intensifies. The faint scent of mold and the chilling silence suggests you are nearing the mysterious Gallery.
travel_descriptions.outside: Heading towards the entrance, the cave becomes increasingly brighter. The fresh aroma of moss and sound of crickets chirping is a signal of the world outside.

name: Countryside
description: The countryside is quite nice, it's not filled with a lot of people but with travelers here and there. Some in small groups some on their own. They are hosting a campfire where everyone has some to sit and is telling stories about their adventures. Someone is showing local children how to wield some weapons. Another is offering lodge, and stable for travelers and their animals.
background: The countryside outside the bazaar has always been well known for being a place for people to relax. As they travel back and forth they can stop by campfires and share stories. It was first started by their king. A lovely man who wanted everyone to try and get to know each other and help each other. When he died his villagers wanted to continue his acts of kindness by offering help to those who passed by.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey to the cabin is a leisurely stroll across the countryside, with wildflowers swaying in the wind all around.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east to the Meadows, you meander through green, rolling hills interspersed with colorful spots of flowers.
travel_descriptions.south: The trip to the Small Dirt Road offers a mix of tranquility and vigilance, with serene forests giving way to signs of past confrontations.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west to the Cottage, the path takes you through cozy landscapes, whispering tales of a time etched in simplicity and togetherness.

name: Meadow
description: This meadow is composed of green, luscious, rolling hills. Flowers dot the expanse. In the evening, one may stand from the hills of this meadow and see the sun set beneath the horizon off in the distance.
background: The meadow is the favorite haunt of children, particularly of the nobility. On a cool summer's eve, the children gather here to play their favorite sports.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking north from the Meadow, the scent of blooming flowers intensifies as you approach the Flower Field, a spectacular spectacle of vibrant colors that sway gently with the wind, welcoming you with their beautiful display.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, the cheerful chirping of birds gets replaced by a deafening silence. The air grows colder as you near the ominous Valley of Doom, its eerie calmness heaving with concealed wickedness that sends a shiver down your spine.
travel_descriptions.south: As you travel south towards the Horse Field, the landscape transitions from grassy terrain to sprawling open fields. The smell of horse musk grows stronger, and you can hear the faint sound of hearty nickers ringing in the air.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward to the Countryside, a warm and inviting feel fills the air. You can hear the crackle of lively campfires intertwined with stories of exciting adventures. The sight of travelers leisurely making their way around the bazaar fills your heart with a homely familiarity.

name: Valley Of Doom
description: The Valley of Doom is overrun by dead trees and grasses.  Eerie looking animals peer at you through the brushes.  It is a dark and wicked place.
background: The Valley of Doom is home to witches and goblins in the region.  People rarely try to pass here because they all know that the evil is afoot.

travel_descriptions.up: You ascend a steep uphill path that leads to a grand manor. The path is adorned with stone statues and vibrant gardens that create an imposing yet majestic atmosphere.
travel_descriptions.down: Making your way down leads you through a lush forest filled with all shades of green and brown. The sounds of chriping birds and rustling leaves surround you as plants grow and flourish.
travel_descriptions.outside: As you journey outside, you encounter a vast, mystic meadow. The emerald green grass dances in the wind and clusters of blue and white flowers are in bloom, adding a touch of enchantment to your journey.

name: A Cabin
description: Plain, pretty basic wooden cabin.  In a field of wildflowers, there is also a pen for the chickens, a clothes line.
background: This cabin, although plain, houses a very powerful enchantress.  The home was given to her by a magical frog who told her that if she lived  here, and lived a basic life, she would live forever.  But now there are people looking for her.

travel_descriptions.south: The journey south is peaceful, with open fields and a serene landscape that eases the mind. The nostalgia of the humble countryside dawns on you as chirping birds fill the silence.
travel_descriptions.east: Traversing eastwards, one realizes the refreshing breath of the wind sweeping over the green expanses. The sight of the quaint Maiden's Cottage in the horizon brings a sense of anticipation and homeliness.

name: Cottage
description: The small cottage was white with two, shuttered windows. It was in the unique shape of a circle and was built of plaster. Smoke billowed from the chimney.
background: The man that lived in the cottage had built it with his own two hands so long ago that nobody could remember a time he didn't live there. He hosted many dinner parties in the home, although it seemed small it could fit many people.

travel_descriptions.inside: As you leave the comfort of the cottage, the lingering warmth slowly fades replaced by the ear-piercing squeals of the pigs. The scent of the pen overpowers you as you approach it.
travel_descriptions.outside: Walking out from the cottage, you are greeted by the fresh air of the countryside. The chirping birds and distant sounds of laughter from travellers around a campfire hint at the friendliness of the place.

name: The Small Dirt Road
description: This small dirt road is flanked by a lush green forest on each side with birds chirping and the occasional deer running about.  Sometimes, you can find broken down wooden wagons left behind from ambushes carried out by bandits.
background: This dirt path is frequently used by peasants and military conveys on their way to local engagements.  If one is not carefully, they can be ambushed by thieves.

travel_descriptions.north: As you move northwards, the cacophony of the bustling bazaar retreats, replaced by the tranquil ambiance of the countryside. Campfire tales of astounding adventures fill the air, forging a sense of escapade.
travel_descriptions.east: Turning east onto the nearby road, you'll find your path flanked by a diversified view of fenced fields and grassy meadows. After dusk, an eerie quietude descends due to the spirit-infested locality.

name: The Forest
description: The forest has many trees. It has other plants too. There are animals and many livings things. The forest is very much full of life. When you look at it you might only see plants that are green and different shades of brown but there are many other living things in there too.
background: The forest started out as a small amount of plants and then the plants kept growing and growing until they were vast. After the plants were very grown the animals and all the small livings things decided to make some houses in the plants.

travel_descriptions.outside: Venturing outwards, you traverse through entangled vines and towering trees leading into a gloomy atmosphere. The cries of unknown creatures echo around you as the Forest reluctantly releases you into the Valley Of Doom.
travel_descriptions.inside: Venturing inwards, the shadowy forest opens up revealing a sunlight-sprinkled meadow. The stench of damp earth and foliage slowly shift to a fragrant, heady mix of wildflowers and fresh grass. Welcome to the blissful Lush Meadow in the Country Side.

connections.inside: Lush Meadow In The Country Side

name: Path To The Manor
description: The outside of the manor is rather imposing with a large stone building and two immense guardian sculptures on the outside depicting mythical beasts. There are also small gardens to the left and right.  The main path itself is a cobbled one that only beckons visitors if they are worthy enough.
background: A wealthy lord lives here and he comes back at the end of a long day directing peasants on their daily duties.  Few are allowed inside except for the lord's family, servants, and invited guests.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending towards the Valley of Doom, the atmosphere grows colder and darker, filling with an eerie sense of foreboding as the stark landscape of dead trees and withered grass spreads out around.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north towards the Main Gate, the path becomes straighter and the surroundings more orderly. The towering gate, flanked by watchtowers, stands as an unwavering sign of strength and security.

name: Pig Pen
description: A filthy pen where tons of squalling pigs rut and throw a ruckus, Their snorts and farts can be heard from any passerby miles before getting to the pen. The pig pen is a few feet from Farmer Bob's cottage. The pigs never sleep and are always eating and playing in the mud.
background: The pig pen is where the village gets its bacon from Farmer Bob. Although no one likes going past the place, everyone knows it is a necessity for good bacon.

travel_descriptions.outside: Travelling from the Pig Pen towards the cottage outside, the smell of pigs decreases and is replaced by the comforting scent of a warm home. The clanking sound of the cooking utensils in the kitchen gets louder as you get closer.

name: Meadow
description: Large clear outdoor meadow. Flowers of blue and white appearing in bunches here and there. The grass glows with a green light. Not much can be said about its appearance, however there is a mystical allure associated with the place as if a meadow for spirits instead of livestock.
background: A great battle once held here. The battle was not between Soldiers and knights. But by wizards and strange ones. It is said to be haunted for the most part, but tales have been told that men have received great visions of wisdom while walking the meadow.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north from the Meadow, your path leads you through a shifting array of colourful wildflowers. The sweet scent of the blossoms fills the air as you approach the Flower Field.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, the lush, verdant grasses of the Meadow transition into a barren landscape, brittle under the scorching sun. The oppressive air grows heavy with foreboding as you near the Valley of Doom.
travel_descriptions.south: Making your way south, you leave the spectral serenity of the Meadow behind. The ground underfoot turns gritty and hard, as the distant rhythm of galloping horses accompanies your journey towards the Horse Field.
travel_descriptions.west: To the west, the open expanse of the Meadow narrows into winding paths bordered by lush vegetation. The murmuring of storytelling travelers grows louder as you approach the Countryside.

name: Peasant'S Cottage
description: The peasant's cottage is a fairly simple wood building with a straw thatched roof.  Inside, you have a fireplace and large pot for cooking, a long wooden dinner table, and some hay filled beds lying on the floor.  There are two chests lying inside with personal belongings such as clothes and family heirlooms.
background: The peasants come here to enjoy a meal and rest at the end of a long day.  There are also some celebrations to be had here.

travel_descriptions.inside: The journey from the cottage to the chicken pen is a short and familiar one, passing by rows of crops and the soft clucking of hens nearby.
travel_descriptions.outside: Traveling to Hillside Manor from the cottage involves a gradual ascent up a scenic pathway, where the sights of the rolling hills and beautiful countryside can be appreciated.

name: Flower Field
description: The flower field contains acres of wild growing flowers that are a bright pink when they are in bloom. There are woods surrounding it, but no trees in the field, only flowers. There are paths that work their way through the field.
background: In the springtime you can often find women out picking flowers and children playing. People often wander the paths to clear their heads.

travel_descriptions.south: Heading southward from the flower field will lead you into the meadow. As you step on the soft grass, the scent of flowers and dew fills the air. The tranquil sound of the wind swaying through the grasslands blends perfectly with the chirping of nearby crickets, making for a peaceful journey.

name: Nearby Road
description: The road cuts through the countryside. It is a dirt road, with a fence lining the eastern side and a grassy meadow to the west.
background: During the ancient battle, the road was used to carry supplies to the wizards army. The strange ones lived in the wilderness, so they didn't use roads. Since the battle ended, the road has been used as a passageway between towns for merchants and travelers. It isn't used after dark, however, due to the spirits that tend to haunt the area.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking westward, you embark on a small dirt road flanked by a lush forest. Occasionally, you catch sight of a deer flickering through the trees and hear birds chirping in the distance.
travel_descriptions.east: To the east, a grand villa on the hilltop becomes visible as you approach the Hillside Mansion. The journey is a spectacle itself, offering a picturesque view of the verdant countryside.

name: Horse Field
description: The horse field includes a huge plains for horses to ride. The fields are yellow and green. The place smells of musk and horse.
background: The horse fields are respected for their beauty and plainness. They make a great location to train knights and peasants in the art of riding.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling to the meadow from the horse field is a peaceful journey. The path gently slopes upwards through verdant valleys and you can watch as horses joyfully frolic alongside.

name: Lush Meadow In The Country Side
description: Green large trees surround the meadow that if filled with beautiful seasonal flowers. A deer is grazing in the far end of the field. A small dirt country road gentle crooks past on the outside of the road.
background: This is gods country. No man could have anything this beautiful. The local government knew it and had this area set away as a protected area years ago.

travel_descriptions.outside: The journey from the lush meadow to the forest is a mesmerizing path. The sudden transition from blooming flowers to towering trees and the chirping of birds harmonizing with the rustling leaves creates an enchanting mood.

name: Maidens Cottage
description: Free standing in the vast countryside, with gentle rolling hills and lush green grass and vegetation sits the cottage. There are a couple of Oak trees close to the cottage as the only tall trees around for miles. Colorful Dandelions, perennials, and daisies grow wildly and freely along the hills.
background: After escaping from being a servant at a large plantation hundreds of miles north, a young maiden found her way to this vast countryside and built herself this cottage. She was able to herd some sheep, and find a few horses that she led to live in the hills around her cottage to keep her company. These animals keep the grasslands around the cottage neat from the feeding.

travel_descriptions.west: The journey to the west leads you across the gently rolling hills, dotted with daisies and dandelions. The lush green pasture gives way to a slightly more dense woodland as you approach a quaint, wooden cabin.

name: Main Gate
description: The main gate is tall and strong enough to protect the mansion from invaders, and has large wooden doors reinforced by planks and steel sheets. There are two towers on either side of the gate for the town's watchmen to use as their post.
background: The mansion's main gate is built to be strong enough to protect the royalty inside the mansion from robbers and invaders alike, who might try to batter down the gate. The gate can only be opened by two of the mansion's servants.

travel_descriptions.south: Journeying south, you're guided along the ornate, cobblestone path leading up to the grand manor. The imposing statues and flourishing gardens give an air of both foreboding and beauty.
travel_descriptions.inside: Entering the Hillside Manor, one is met with a warm, lively atmosphere. The sound of cheerful chatter of Higgins' family can be heard echoing through the hallways.

name: Hillside Mansion
description: I sweeping villa that rests on the grand hills. Everyone can see how grand it is when they approach from the country road. A tall, wrought-iron fence surround its grounds, which extends for miles.
background: The grand villa was built there by the Red Baron two centuries ago. As not many people have been invited inside, no one really know what it looks like or what the Red Baron is up to. It is a mysterious dwelling, but one that brings great beauty to passersby.

travel_descriptions.west: A serene walk down the hill, with the mansion soon shrinking behind, taking the countryside road towards the west. It's a travel filled with lush greenery, the calming chirping of birds, and an overarching sense of serenity.

name: Chicken Pen
description: The chicken pen has wire cages situated on three different levels, with hay at the bottom for the chicken's to sit in. There lie small holes in the cages for the eggs to fall through and be easily harvested by the farmers. The old wooden walls of the chicken pen are beginning to deteriorate and show signs of age.
background: The chicken pen is used to provide eggs for the family living in the cabin to eat, and even sell if they have a surplus. The chicken in there are raised by the mother of the family while the father goes hunting.

travel_descriptions.outside: Walking from the chicken pen to the peasant's cottage involves navigating a small field, where one can hear the chickens clucking behind them. The grass crunches underfoot, and the humble wooden structure of the cottage slowly grows in the frame of vision.

name: Hillside Manor
description: A quaint manor that sits in the rolling hills. It is surrounded by a small stone fence and looks quite inviting to passersby. It looks like any other home that a well off business man would own.
background: The manor is owned by Frederick Higgins, a wealthy bookshop owner. He built the manor 20 years ago, as his bookshop was doing quite well. He lives there with his 10 sons and daughters and loving wife. It is a noisy abode, but a lively one.

travel_descriptions.outside: Leaving the hillside manor, you walk down a gravel path flanked by a small stone fence until you reach the imposing sight of the Main Gate.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east from the manor, you stroll through verdant pastures, the fresh scent of grass and wildflowers accompanying you as you venture towards the humble Peasant'S Cottage.

name: Port Skyline
description: The local port sits an a majestic inlet of the ocean. The countless docks are constantly bustling with new arrivals and departures. People of all kinds come here for business or leisure. On the shore sits a skyline of many buildings packed with residents going about their day. The smell of salt and seafood fills the air.
background: This port has historical roots, as it was the first city founded in the kingdom. It was here that colonizers first landed hundreds of years ago. Now, the city is a hub of the kingdom, where hundreds of thousands live out their lives. The city is a center for the latest technologies of the time and beautiful works of art, literature, and music.

travel_descriptions.south: Travelling south from the port, you pass several bustling market stands, selling a bounty from the sea, before reaching the quiet and scenic Wharf.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you follow a rough cobblestone path until the noise of construction hits your ears; the Royal Shipyard is just up ahead, working vigorously to keep the fleet in top shape.

name: Wharf
description: The waves lash gently against the wooden posts, the water here has always been calm and passive, it seems to represent the people of this small town. The fishermen here are not boisterous, they are quiet, at least when it comes to sound. They'll talk your ear off if you let them, they have lots of stories to tell. The pier here is long, it extends at least forty feet into the ocean, many ships are anchored to it, many people traverse down it buying and selling their local catches.
background: The port is just like any other port. Busy with the bustle and hustle of people buying and selling whatever they can. A connection to the rest of the world, so you'll see people who look like they belong and you'll see people new here as well. You'll also run into a few people who can't afford to buy and will take things from those who may not be paying full attention.

travel_descriptions.north: Journeying north to Port Skyline, the hum of the city grows louder as it comes into view, replacing the tranquil sound of water lapping against the pier with the hustle and bustle of a city alive.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east towards the Loading Dock, the air thickens with the scent of seaweed and salt, intermixed with the heavy smell of cargo and fresh timber.
travel_descriptions.south: Making your way south to the Fish Market, the calls of merchants and the splash of fish hitting ice fill the air, while the salty sea breeze intertwines with the scent of freshly-caught seafood.

name: Loading Dock
description: The loading dock is filled with life and movement. Many trucks back up into the
background: This old loading dock has been used for centuries since the founding of the colony. It has been raided many times in the past by pirates looking to get rich off of its cargo. Without the continued maintenance of this important section of the port, the port itself and the island would not have been able to sustain itself.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking from the Loading Dock to the Wharf, you can smell the tang of the sea and hear the cries of the gulls. The wooden planks creak underfoot and you feel at the heart of the town's bustling trade.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling from the Loading Dock to the Boat House, the smells transition from fresh sea breeze to the musty odors of wood and old beer. The sound of lively chatter grows louder as you get closer, mixing with the occasional scrape of chairs and clink of glass.

name: Fish Market
description: The port is filled with many different small shops that sell fishes caught throughout the day. It is incredibly loud and busy with many customers and fisherman walking around and haggling for a good price on the fishes. There are tons of boxes sitting on the floors everywhere filled with ice, fish, and the fishermen's belongings.
background: The port is right near the ocean and is a place where fisherman come to sell the fishes they caught throughout the early morning. It is a place of business where they sell more than just fish.

travel_descriptions.north: The bustle of the fish market fades into the gentle lapping of waves against the wharf.  Fishermen are quiet, unloading their catches and trading stories.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east from the fish market, the port becomes quiet and somewhat mysterious. A broken, trash-covered dock suggests caution.

name: Royal Shipyard
description: A massive shipyard with different Five dry docks. each dry dock has several wooden cranes and rope works. The dry docks are made of stone and the water gate is all harden wood.
background: The birth of a royal navy ship begins in these shipyards. For 200 years master craftsmen and the royal shipwrights make repairs and create more master pieces for the kingdom.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west leads you through the busy shipyard, where craftsmen continuously work on constructing new ships and repairing old ones. The scent of woodwork and sea salt brings a unique experience.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you leave behind the royal splendor of the shipyard and head towards a less maintained dock. The worn-out path leading to it suggests isolation and some level of secrecy.
travel_descriptions.east: Eastbound takes you through a lively scenario, with bustling crowds and chatter filling the air as people constantly arrive at or depart from the Ferry Terminal.

name: Dock At The Port
description: This dock has seen better days.  It is wobbly and broken in areas.  There are holes through to the ocean below if you are not careful.  It is covered with every means of trash.
background: This dock is used to offload the high sorceress' supplies.  It is only allowed to be used by her and this port is somewhat mysterious as well.  She receives her goods at night and has guards that hover around her at the port.  No one really knows what kind of supplies she is receiving, but most do not want to know.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north, you make your way through a maze of towering, formidable ships in varying stages of construction within the shipyard, their wooden hulls gleaming under the command of master craftsmen.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, the scent of the sea intensifies as the loud cacophony of haggling voices and fishmongers advertising their freshest catches welcomes you to the busy fish market.

name: Fishmonger'S Stall
description: A small booth near the edge of the port, it's protected by a piece of old, sun-bleached sailcloth. Baskets of freshly-caught fish, bivalves, and eels sit in the shade in stained wooden troughs of water. A small, aggressive-looking dog is chained to one table, presumably to keep cats away. The stall is redolent with the aroma of fish.
background: Where there's water, there are fish, and where there are fish, there are stories about "the one that got away", and of course fishermen. As they can be unpleasantly salty characters unfit for the company of the more genteel sorts of ladyfolk, enterprising individuals act as middlemen, buying fresh-caught seafood from these disreputable sorts and selling them on. This is one such enterprise, which has clearly both been here a while, and not been entirely prosperous.

name: Boat House
description: A small house type establishment that serves as a hang out for people about to board the boats.  There is nautical themed decor everywhere.  Life Buoys, mounted fish, replica boats.  It's all wood inside with a bar as well.  A lot of creaky looking wood too, probably weathered a good bit as the house is old itself.
background: The boat house has been around for a long time, and it looks like it.  Fishermen consider it a tradition to get plastered here before they head out to sea.  There's also a lot of grungy and depressed looking men in here.  They basically are either at sea fishing, or hanging out in the boat house.

travel_descriptions.west: Pacing towards the west, you can sense the industrial hustle and bustle getting louder, as you approach the robust activity of the loading dock.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, the smell of bait and fresh sea water grows stronger as you approach the quaint, brimming store of the local fishermen.

name: Dock
description: There are creaky wooden walkways with empty sections where boats can rest.  There are a few buildings surrounding this area that sell supplies to sailors.
background: Sailors come here to dock their boats and get the supplies they need.  They also come to exchange tall tales about the sea.

travel_descriptions.west: As you approach the Pirate Ship, mischievous laughter of pirates fills the air. You acutely sense the danger and excitement that comes with being near such a notorious vessel.
travel_descriptions.east: Stepping aboard the Large Galleon brings on a wave of awe. One can feel the residual energy of the secrets and battles this renowned ship has experienced.

name: Ferry Terminal
description: A huge terminal with a lot of traffic. The Ferry Terminal has a warm and positive vibe that welcomes all travelers across the land. It has an open space with a lot of illumination during the night.
background: The ferry terminal is the heart of the land. Many travelers have come and departed though this point, always telling new stories about other lands adventures that become live once retold.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west towards the Royal shipyard involves a scenic walk along the shoreline, where you can view the magnificent ships being built.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south towards The Docks takes you away from the liveliness of the terminal, and into a more rough and rugged environment, filled with mystery.

name: Fishing Store
description: This store is a small one room stone building with wares laid about on tables.  One can see fishing poles, wooden buckets with dirt and bait inside, along with some mounted trophies.
background: Fisherman and sailors alike come here to replenish their supplies.  They also exchange tall tales of mermaids and other extraordinary creatures spotted as sea.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving from the Fishing Store to the Boat House, one can feel the air grow thicker with the smell of salt and hear the distant sound of waves. The cobblestone pathway gently slopes downward, leading to the old yet charming wooden establishment known for its harboring fishermen and sailors.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking from the Fishing Store to the Marketplace, the smell of fresh fish gives way to a whirl of different scents. The clamor of people haggling, merchant calls and chatters start to get louder as you navigate through the crowded and vibrant streets.
travel_descriptions.east: Journeying from the Fishing Store to the Port Tavern, the narrow alleys wind through the heart of the port city. The air hums with whispered rumors and soft murmurs as the faint strumming of a lute gets louder, and the tangy scent of ale begins to waft through the salty air.

name: Marketplace
description: Merchants call out their wares and try desperately to get the attention of the wealthier passerby. People from all over the world hustle to and fro, some keenly eyeing the many tapestries, spices, tools and foods, others openly staring in wonder. Still others hurry along, heads down and avoiding eye contact. Colors, smells and sounds assault the senses. The cries of the gulls can hardly be deciphered from the chatter of the crowds, the ringing of the blacksmith's hammer, the bells of the nearby shipyard, and the hollers of the merchants.
background: The marketplace began with the founding of the port town. Gradually as more and more ships rolled in, more products were available, until the marketplace became fundamental to the success and well-being of the town. When the marketplace thrives, the town thrives.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking east from the marketplace, colorful stalls and chattering crowds give way to quieter stone buildings. The pungent smell of fish fills the air as you near the Fishing Store, indicating a fresh shipment has just arrived.
travel_descriptions.south: Navigating through the bustling crowd, you head south from the marketplace. The commotion of the marketplace slowly fades into the murmur of sailors and port workers discussing their needs. The wooden sign of the Supply Store comes into view, offering a one-stop solution to their demands.

name: Port Tavern
description: The port tavern is the shadiest of all the shady bars in the city. Every night, on its grimy stools at the wooden bar, you can find some of the slimiest sailors in the world. The walls are of peeling blue paint and are always dripping with condensation. Women of ill-repute line one wall, old men on the verge of passing out line another. The floor is littered with trash, barnacles, and bodily fluids. Tending the bar is a small, round man with a bushy mustache.
background: The port tavern used to be a private domicile. It belonged to a wealthy merchant who lived there with his beautiful wife and daughters. This merchant was intelligent, charming, well-respected, and was addicted to gambling. Luck had been on his side for his entire life, until one night when he was playing cards against local merchants. Out of cash and overconfident, he bet his house to a small, round man with a bushy mustache and a questionable past.

travel_descriptions.west: You walk down the bustling, salt-scented docks, towards a small, stone building that stands apart from the rest, the Fishing Store. You hear tales of far seas being exchanged amongst customers.
travel_descriptions.south: With a brisk sea breeze at your back, you head towards the beckoning mast of the famed "Purple Pear". Pirates around you are engaged in a merriment-filled shuffle, dancing to an unseen rhythm.

name: Supply Store
description: With so many ships docked at the port, sailor from all the ships crowd the bazaar. The supply store is filled with buyers today. The inside is plain and unadorned. Sturdy shelves hold common supplies. Along the walls are the larger items for sale.
background: The supply store is run by small family of people who lived in the area before the port was constructed. As sailors needed goods, the family was happy to accommodate them for a price.

travel_descriptions.north: Navigating through the huddling masses of merchants and traders, you make your way to the animated marketplace, an explosion of color and liveliness.
travel_descriptions.east: Making your way towards the docks, the salty breeze strokes your face as the looming silhouette of the infamous pirate ship comes into view.
travel_descriptions.south: Skirting around roaming seagulls and seamen hauling crates, your path leads you to the bustling port city of Tamerak, a spirited commotion of sea life.

name: Pirate Ship
description: A majestic, shimmering, black pirate ship sits upon the water. Its numerous cannons give it a menacing look. Tons of pirates hop upon its decks in a furious jig. The lone captain plods around in his cabin, plotting on where to seize his treasure next.
background: The pirate ship is called "The Purple Pear". It is a ship known to be filled with the rankest of scalawags. It has traversed the Golden Coast dozen of times, seeking defenseless merchants to plunder. Many mariners try to avoid and many authorities try to bring her to justice.

travel_descriptions.north: You disembark the ship, leaving the sea underfoot for the feeling of muddy ground as you step onto the busy pier leading you to the Port Tavern.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking along the bustling towered pier, you follow the scent of salt mixed with packed goods, leading you to the Supply Store.
travel_descriptions.east: Leaving the comfort of your ship, you wander down the wooden planks, the distant loud barter of sailors at the Dock drawing you in.

name: The Docks
description: The docks are a rough place with a lot of rough group of individuals who hang out there.  It is where the ships port and deport, only few know what really goes on there.
background: A lot of known criminals like to hang around those parts at night, no body dare say why.  During the day it's where a lot of local fisherman deliver their product.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north towards the Ferry Terminal, you navigate through the bustling crowd of fishermen, dock workers, and sailors. You can hear the chiming horns of the incoming ferries as you approach.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east to the Warehouses, you tread carefully along the narrow cobblestone paths, flanked on both sides by towering stacks of crates and boxes filled with goods from lands unknown.

name: Crew Berthing
description: The main quarters for the crew of the vessel. Its dirty, smelly and not a place where anyone but a pirate would want to stay. There are bunks stacked on bunks the place is cramped and no one goes there for any reason besides sleeping.
background: The room was designed when the ship was built and an entrance to the captains quarters. A small area that was re-purposed so there is more storage on the ship in the old quarters for the loot of the pirates.

travel_descriptions.outside: Exiting the cramped, suffocating quarters of the crew berthing, you step onto the lively decks of the ominous 'Purple Pear'. The air instantly fills with salty sea breeze mingling with the smell of gunpowder.

name: Warehouses
description: The warehouses are the largest structures in the port, rising well above the adjoining buildings. Constructed from virgin timber, the beams overhead support lofts that are filled to capacity with boxes, crates, and barrels full of goods from all over the world. Carefully checking each parcel that crosses the doorway, the warehouse manager knows exactly where everything belongs inside.
background: The warehouse manager wasn't always an anxious man, but last year, some foreign sailors raided the warehouse and stole twelve casks of the finest rum. The owner of the warehouse threatened to send him away on the next ship if anything went missing again. He watches with a keen eye, now, fearful of losing his livelihood, or even his life.

travel_descriptions.west: A short walk down the bustling street takes you from the organised chaos of the warehouse to the unruly anarchy of the docks, where sea-salt air fills your nose and the crescendo of waves crashing against the shore fills your ears.
travel_descriptions.north: Making your way northward, you climb aboard the formidable galleon. The ship creaks in the sea breeze as you feel the sturdy planks under your feet, embracing the promise of grand maritime adventures.

name: Large Galleon
description: The deck of this rather large ship is strong and freshly swapped with tar. Its mast reaches far into the sky like gleaming pillar of hope and freedom. Its sturdy ship made for long voyages with thick planks and strong rails.
background: The ships name is Turk, known for its battle prowess, and seemingly impenetrable hull. It is currently docked in he nearby port, resupplying for the next voyage.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending the gangplank from the Large Galleon, the scent of timber and various goods waft from the monstrous Warehouses nearby.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, the creak of wooden planks underfoot grows louder as you approach the Dock, with its hustle and bustle of sailors and traders.

name: The Village Of Tamerak
description: A thriving sea port filled with merchants, foods, women, and gold.  Hundreds of boats fill the shores, fisherman pushing out to sea and pulling into dock.  Seagulls hover silently above the merchants selling fish.  Pirates can be seen causing trouble with the locals.  Brothels and bars are in abundance, as well as the smell of fish.
background: Once a quiet small town near the coast.  This port quickly grew into fame due to a sea monster sighting many years ago.  The monster was said to have eaten a ship whole!  Alas, this was never proven, but it did not stop travelers from embarking to hunt, catch, or see this beast with their own eyes!  The port quickly grew into a city and begot the name after that legendary sea monster, Tamerak.

travel_descriptions.north: Wandering north through bustling crowds, between the stalls of shouting merchants and busy trade, the familiar signs of a well-stocked supply store greet your eye.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, the scent of briny seawater intensifies with each step as you move towards the creaking wooden docks laden with sailors and their tales.
travel_descriptions.east: To the east, the pulse of the port can be felt in the Quay, alive with longshoremen going about their work by day and intriguing, shadowy individuals by night.

name: Captain'S Cabin
description: The captain's cabin is a complete mess. There are multiple maps on the wall, pinned over one another, each with messy writing scrawled over it and multiple X marks in random places. Papers overflow off the desk and across the floor in waves, impeding the captain as he paces, muttering angrily. The bed is messy and unmade, giving the impression that the captain has spent the night tossing and turning. Random objects have been thrown about the room.
background: This room is where the captain lets his guard down. He must appear strong and confident for his men, to keep up his reputation and prevent capture, but he is beginning to feel the pressure. Every year there are more and more authorities looking for them, and it is becoming harder and harder to evade them. With the mariners avoiding them it is getting harder  to steal from other ships, and they haven't had any luck finding any treasure for the last two years. Now the captain is exhausted and furious, leading to the disarray of the room.

name: Quay
description: During the day, the quay is bustling with typical activity of a port: burly longshoremen carry crates and roll barrels away from ships for storage and sailors who still have their sea-legs saunter past on their way to drink and more adventures. By night, the quay is teeming with unsavory characters: men who are hardly men any more after losing their way through drink and gambling hunker amongst coils of rope stiffened by the salt water while rats scramble from box to box gnawing their way into the goods contained inside.
background: The quay started as a small platform, but over the years, the port master has extended it, slowly but surely, using bits of old wood from busted ships. Now, it extends far along the water's edge, loaded with fine goods from all over the world.

travel_descriptions.west: Travel from the Quay to the Village of Tamerak is a captivating journey. You first navigate through the bustling quay, filled with a variety of traders and mariners. Then, you venture onto a winding path that leads through emerald green hills and overlooks the endless panoramic view of the ocean. Savor the salt-marinated air as you travel west towards a destination filled with exciting tales of the legendary sea monster, Tamerak.

name: Haunted Basement
description: The basement is cold, damp, and dark. What little light coming in from the window is blotted out and dimmed by the spider webs sprawled across its surface. The shadows in the corners of the room appear nearly pitch black, and it almost feels as if something is looking back at you from within them.
background: At night, the sound of pacing footsteps are heard, pattering against the concrete floor. On some nights the sound of a crying woman can be heard echoing from within the basement. A young mother who had recently moved in with her family could no longer take the sounds at night, her curiosity driving her mad. One day, she descended into the basement and found some old documents and journals. As it turns out, the man who built the house would drag his wife into the basement and beat her routinely. After a particularly rough day at work he beat her especially savagely and killed her.

travel_descriptions.up: Climbing the old wooden stairs from the haunted basement, you get an uneasy feeling of leaving the horrors below, only to be greeted by the Magic Room, a place from which there's no return.
travel_descriptions.outside: Leaving the dampness of the basement, you emerge into the bright and open landscape of Stonehenge, a journey from closed quarters into the freedom of an open sky.

name: Astral Plane
description: An area between worlds where the physics known to man become irrelevant. It is a space beyond time that is home to being spectral and inconceivable to those without the eyes to see them.
background: The astral plane has always existed. It has no beginning and no end. Those who find themselves here must tremble at the enormity of it. This is a place where men's nightmares have made their abode.

travel_descriptions.down: As you descend from the Astral Plane, the ethereal glow fades giving way to oppressing darkness and an unsettling chill runs down your spine as you near the Haunted Basement.
travel_descriptions.north: Moving northward from this spaceless realm, you feel a calming sensation as the detritus of Astral Plane blends seamlessly into the lush woodland surroundings of Goddess Hollow.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east, the formless astral landscape gives way to ordered chaos, a symphony of granite monoliths reaching for the heavens announce your arrival at Stonehenge.

name: Magic Room
description: A room that once entered, cannot be escaped. The walls are all mirrors, and you can never again find the door.
background: This room was created when a wizard's wife was taken from him by the king for disobeying his orders. The wizard created this room, called the king in and then they both died.

travel_descriptions.down: Venturing down from the Magic Room, tinges of cold start to grip you as reality shifts, a sense of dread grows. You can almost hear the echoes of a tragic history.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving eastwards, the mirrors in the Magic Room flicker ominously, reality bends and time becomes a mere concept. You feel both weightless and heavy as you venture towards the Astral Plane.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, the environment starts to ripple, as if you're looking through a heat haze. The air hums with ancient magic and the smell of wet earth rises. You're on your way to Stonehenge.

name: Stonehenge
description: Technical and advanced, the enormous stones stand looking as if they are placed on top of each other by divine design. The green grass is a stark contrast to the gray stones hovering in the distance.
background: Used to show power, knowledge and skill the Stonehenge is where a variety of nomadic people can trade and exchange ideas, as well as learn of astronomic occurrences.

travel_descriptions.north: Stepping northwards from Stonehenge, a soft glowing light leads you into a mystic path, your senses tingling with an alien but soothing melody guiding you towards The Glade Of Mysteries.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south from Stonehenge, the energy shifts to an eerie serenity. An uncanny chill drapes over you, heralding your passage towards the Ghost Monk Quarters.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east from Stonehenge, the atmosphere is tinged with whispers of ancient lore and the subtle scent of woodland flora, marking the way to the sacred Goddess Hollow.
travel_descriptions.west: As you tread westward from Stonehenge, the air grows heavy with mystical energies, reflecting mysteries untold and paths untraveled, baiting you towards the entrapment of the Magic Room.

name: Ghost Monk Quarters
description: a simple room for an undead monk. There is an uncomfortable bed, no windows, a small table with a candle, some illustrations in a book, and not much else. There is a stool
background: a long dead monk haunts this simple room. He is a ghostly figure and no one hardly goes in here for fear of being haunted

travel_descriptions.up: You feel a mystical force pulling you upwards, leaving you momentarily weightless as you ascend to Stonehenge.
travel_descriptions.north: Venturing northwards, you tread upon a mossy path which wends and twists until you find yourself standing before the Bridge in the Forest.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving towards the west, you descend a creaky staircase that spirals down into the eerie silence and musty cold of the Haunted Basement.

name: Goddess Hollow
description: The Goddess Hollow is a place created to worship woodland spirits. It is a small, closet-like room in a hollowed out tree that has existed for hundreds of years. Within the hollow there are piles of sticks, flowers, and home-made items presented to the woodland spirits.
background: The people of the wood created the hollow several centuries ago. They discovered the hollowed out tree while searching for a missing baby who was believed to have been stolen from his mother by woodland creatures. The baby was never found but his blanket was within the tree. The woodland people began bringing gifts to the tree to protect their children from a similar fate.

travel_descriptions.south: Your form turns to an ethereal mist as you step into the Astral Plane, the rules of reality shifting around you, a feeling of isolation and insignificance washes over you.
travel_descriptions.north: You walk towards the echoing sounds of cheers and clashing metal, the adrenaline and anticipation of the Fighting Arena Inside Tourney Grounds rush through your veins.
travel_descriptions.west: You journey to the echo of ancient mysteries and sciences of Stonehenge, feeling the awe and enigma of the past, the stone guardian of yesteryears silently watches your approach.

name: Bridge In The Forest
description: You are at a bridge. It is old and used very rarely. It is dim and foggy. The brigde is large and there is a small stream below it.
background: Many people traveled over this bridge but it has become run down now there is a more well kept road that cuts through the forest. Some wars were fought in this area and this bridge was command posts for many armies. Many sould stil haunt this area.

travel_descriptions.south: The path to Ghost Monk Quarters descends into a dim, misty hollow, enveloped by an eerie stillness that sends chills down your spine.
travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north towards The Glade Of Mysteries, the forest canopy parts, bathing the path in a surreal, shimmering light that seems to dance to an unheard rhythm.

name: Fighting Arena Inside Tourney Grounds
description: Filled with embroidered banners and filled with a crowd aching for entertainment, the fighting arena offers glory to all who enter. The arena itself is covered in orange dirt and surround by emblems and crests of all the knights who participate. There are weapon racks sprinkled alongside the edge of the arena.
background: The fighting arena was once the location an actual battle between warring nations. The king issued that a tourney be erected in memory of the battle. Great memories.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the bustling arena, the atmosphere changes abruptly as you step into the ancient quiet of the Goddess Hollow.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving west, the clamor of the fighting fades into a sublime melody accompanying a mysterious glow from the Glade Of Mysteries.

name: The Glade Of Mysteries
description: The leaves of the trees surrounding this glade glow unnaturally, as though lit from within.  There seems to be almost a presence to this place, a waiting watchful force.  Bits of music sound occasionally, tunes that seem familiar and yet quite alien, as though played by someone who had only heard the melody described to them, instead of hearing it themselves.  And yet all this pales in comparison to the pool found in the center.  The water gleams silver, seemingly absorbing and reflecting back the light of the trees around it tenfold.  Though there is a soft breeze that blows through the glade, there is not a ripple to be seen on the water's perfectly mirrored surface.
background: This glade is part of the Secret Realm, unknown by mortal men, and yet dwelling beside it in a parallel dimension.  Yet whispers and stories of the Glade are told in the feeble tales of men, who can only grasp at its' wonder and power.  It is said that if one looks in the surface of the pond that dwells within, that one's whole future stretches out before them, along with all the possibilities therein.  Such knowledge will drive a man, for the human mind is not meant to contain such knowledge.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the glade, you leave behind the ethereal light and step into the dense woods that slowly give way to a dilapidated bridge over a quiet stream. The journey feels like walking through layers of time, as memories of long past wars seem to seep into the air around the old bridge.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, the serene beauty of the glade is replaced by a hustle. The scent of dust and iron fill the air, and the distant sound of cheering draws you closer. You tread on well-worn paths, leading you toward the Fighting Arena in the Tourney Grounds, a place where glory and honor is earned through conflict.
travel_descriptions.west: Venturing west, the trees fade into rolling grasslands as you leave the glade behind. Soon, the mysterious aura of the Glade is replaced by a sense of awe, as you approach the magnificent formation known as Stonehenge. It represents a journey not just through space, but to a window of a bygone civilization.

name: Library
description: The library is a humongous cavernous room full of floor to ceiling shelves. Each shelf is stocked full of every type of book imaginable, most in impeccable condition. Near all of the shelves, there are types of reading nooks with benches or chaises for people to relax and read. There are some tables and chairs for study in one half of the room. There is a large fireplace in the center and some comfortable lounge chairs arranged around it for socializing. On the sparse wall space there are tapestries. Some small end tables hold huge vases of pink flowers.
background: The library was built when the castle was built, because the current king was a studious individual. Many scholarly nobles came from far and wide to view the wide array of books, sometimes ancient ones.

travel_descriptions.west: Leaving the serenity of the library, you start your tranquil journey along the Bright Path. The fragrance of blossoming flowers surrounds you and the chirping of birds is music to your ears.
travel_descriptions.south: Taking the south exit, you head towards the grandeur of Chapel of The Eight. You feel a sense of awe and reverence as you get closer, the gold and jewels glint in the sunlight, making the journey feel like a royal procession.

name: Bright Path
description: The bright path is lined with roses, lavender, daisies, and lilies. Apple trees sit on a pristinely-manicured lawn. Hedges in geometric shapes sit just beyond the path. The path leads away from the castle and down to a pond full of fish and swans.
background: The bright path provides the perfect respite for guests who want to take a walk and enjoy the fragrant night air after a party. The queen takes this path often with her maids. They walk and gossip about court life.

name: Library
description: A fairly plain looking room compared to the rest of the castle.  In here are many musty shelves of books along with some scientific and writing instruments.
background: This is a room where scribes and royalty alike come to gain knowledge.  They use this room to study texts containing law and history.

travel_descriptions.west: Exiting the library through the west door, you amble down a sunny corridor filled with the alluring scent of parchment and musty tomes giving way to the fragrant roses, lavender, daisies, and lilies of the Bright Path.
travel_descriptions.south: Descending from the library to the Chapel Of The Eight, the touch of weathered stone murals lend a gravity to your journey. A hush descends as you cross the arched threshold into the chapel, scents of old incense and hallowed silence accompanying you.

name: Chapel Of The Eight
description: Made entirely out of gold and with precious jewels all around. Sculptures and many symbols with a red carpet goes from the entrance up until the end of the chapel.
background: The chapel of the eight represents the core of the religious values and beliefs. The chapel has sculptures of the eight Gods that are feared and loved across the land. It's a place of peace and tribute where only the worthiest people can step in.

name: The Show Room Inside The Castle
description: The Show Room Inside the Castle is meant to impress as well as cause fear to whomever enters the room.  The Duke who lives here is a hunter and keeps his captures here.  Some of the thinks preserved and shown on his wall are shocking.  The preserved eyes stare back and let you know the Duke knows no mercy, be careful what you say in this room.  The floor is white like ivory and the walls are also white, but the ceiling is painted and tells a story of the Duke's conquest.
background: It took many years to build this room.  No other hunter has a room like it, even the king is jealous, those who view this room fear the Duke more than the King. Could there be a conspiracy?  Danger and intrigue live in this room.  You feel it as soon as you enter and view the walls and the ceiling, which compete for your fear and your respect.

travel_descriptions.west: Passing from the showroom, the hallway to the west leads towards the grand washroom. The route is lined with expensive silk tapestries that gently rustle in the draft.
