travel_descriptions.down: A narrow, winding staircase lined with cold stone walls descends into the eerie quiet of the basement. The journey is steep and dimly lit, with the flickering light of a solo torch illuminating the way.

name: Washroom
description: The washroom is incredibly spacious. It has enough space to comfortably fit an entire family. The toilets are made of the finest porcelain across the land and decorated with gold studs. There are several bathtubs large enough to fit several people. The room is more luxurious than even some houses of wealthy people.
background: The washroom was a quiet and private place for the king to relieve himself and left alone in thought. It is built to make the ambiance more calming and it always smelled like flowers.

name: Basement
description: An ancient crypt. It has several , almost countless crypts of royal relatives. Paintings on the wall depict the fallen dead. Family swords, personal weapons decorated the tombs. It is dank, lit by torches on the walls, led to by a stone staircase. The chill of ancient death permeates the air.
background: Here lie the brave and craven alike, descendants of the royal bloodline. It houses all of the dead, from benevolent kings, to mad rulers, to the twisted and hideous offspring only hinted at by rumor, they're all here, all lying in their crypts, decaying in their royal finery, forever at rest.

name: Dining Hall
description: The dining hall is a grandiose room with enormously tall ceilings. Their is one long wooden dining table, with two huge chairs on each end, and normal benches on the sides. The walls of the room are decorated with huge elegant tapestries depicting memories and moments of the kingdom. Their is a stage for performers, and there are many windows that offer spectacular views of the beautiful castle grounds.
background: The dining hall has been the king's family's favorite room for generations. Many holidays, occasions and parties were held there.

travel_descriptions.south: You leave the energetic dining hall, traveling down a long stone hallway to the bustling castle kitchen. The air is rich with the scent of roasting meats and baking bread.
travel_descriptions.east: You cross through a tall, oak door and find yourself in the armory. The room is filled with the scent of metal and leather, and all around you are various weapons and pieces of armor.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending a curved spiral staircase, the quiet hustle and bustle of the dining hall slowly fades away. As you reach the top, you find yourself in a quaint little room at the top of the tower with an awe-inspiring view of the castle grounds and the lands beyond.
travel_descriptions.north: Taking a short trip through a narrow corridor to the north, the privy room comes into view. The scent of candle wax fills the air and soft light surrounds you, creating a calm and peaceful atmosphere.
travel_descriptions.west: Making your way west across the flagstone floor, you pass through a grand archway towards the formidable castle exit. You appreciate the striking mix of practical fortification and stunning architecture as you bid farewell to the dining hall.

connections.up: The Room At The Top Of The Tower

name: Kitchen
description: The medieval kitchen smells of roast and pig. The finest cuisine often includes a variety of beautiful colors and a selection of deceased animals.
background: The chef's kitchen is revered by guests and kings. The head chef is lauded for his skill and culinary brilliance. The kitchen is the center of his art.

name: Armory
description: This is a plain room with many pieces of armor and equipment lying about.  They are seen on tables or stored in heavy trunks.  There's racks of plain clothing worn before putting on armor.
background: This is used to store equipment used by castle guards in case of sieges and invasions.  Careful attention is paid to make sure the gear stays in top condition.

name: The Room At The Top Of The Tower
description: Small and round, the room is accessed by a spiral staircase. The room has stone walls, wooden floors and a decoratively carved wooden rocking chair next to a which looks over the castle's moat and the meadows and woodlands beyond.
background: This small room is the king's favorite place to  be alone. He loves to read here, and sometimes watch through the window the antics of his soldiers training in the meadow below. The king also watches out for signs of enemies approaching the castle from this vantage point.

name: Privy Room
description: It's dark and only lit by a candle stuck in a small candle holder in each wall. For what it is the room is large with plenty of room. It has a small wooden table off to the left. There's a small window behind overlooking the court yard.
background: This is truly the work horse of the castle. It has seen more action then the throne room or even the war room. Everyone from the king to the kings court visits this room daily. It took years to build and all the workers love having a place to gather.

name: Castle Exit
description: A beautiful, large door at the end of the hallway. Many framed pictures of past residents and royalty are hung on the brick walls. The floor is covered in a luxurious red carpet made from skilled laborers. There are many guards at the exit door preventing people from entering and checking for suspicious people
background: The castle exit is used quite often by the king and his henchmen. It is a very decorated and honored place because it is used a lot throughout the day. It is reflective of the legacy of the royal family.

name: Castle Maids' Room
description: Inside the maids room is dark and grey.  It is much different from the rest of the Castle which has grand walls and floors and paintings from famous painters around the wall.  The maid holds many secrets in this room.  One which is a secret door that holds paintings she should not have.
background: Many of the servants share quarters, but the head maid has her own room.  She is a favorite of the Duke who owns the castle.  She is loyal, but her room still reflects that she is a servant.  She has plans of her own as her room inside the Castle has secret door and storage where she has things she should not.

travel_descriptions.south: Leaving the maids' quarters, you descend a winding staircase to the Armory, the clanking of weaponry growing louder as you approach.
travel_descriptions.west: Leaving the comfort of the maids' room, you traverse a lengthy corridor richly adorned with portraits of previous owners, leading you directly into the grandeur of the Banquet Hall.

name: Armory
description: Another room in the castle as you would expect. This room is filled with weapons and armor on manikins made of wood and iron. The weapons here are well used, time and age have made their dents and marks, however they remain reliable for any man to wield.
background: A collection of arms from the province many battles from history. These items will be used as emergency weapons and equipment in the event of a siege.

name: Banquet Hall
description: Cherry wood walls with paintings of historic kings and queens outlined in gold. A very long cherry wood colored table with chairs on all sides. Candle pieces are on the table about a couple feet apart with five candle sticks on each that are lit.
background: This banquet hall is where famous leaders come to enjoy a good meal while discussing future goals.

name: Kings Bed Room
description: The walls are tall and stone. They are coated with colorful tapestries showing the kings of years past. A large stone fireplace across from the bed that is large enough to keep the king warm even on the coldest nights. A double thick wooden door with a large lock on each side of the room.
background: The king has wanted a room this large for years. He had people from all around the world come and help work on it. The fireplace and it's mantle are his pride and joys and the doors that can't be broken down.

travel_descriptions.south: You walk south through a narrow corridor, lined with ornate tapestries, towards the banquet hall.
travel_descriptions.west: You make your way west, down a flight of stone steps towards the aroma of the castle kitchen.

name: Banquet Hall
description: The banquet hall is like something you've never seen before.  It has gold encrusted tables and chairs, complete with embroidered tapestries and covers all over the floors.  The silverware is even made of diamonds as are all of the plates.  The ceilings are high wooden beams that glisten.
background: This is the banquet hall of the King.  And he gives amazing dinners here for certain distinguished people.  But lately this room has been quiet, as the King is under a sleeping spell.  And interestingly enough, this room is now attended by tiny fairy lights that no one has yet to be able to capture.

name: Castle Kitchen
description: The kitchen a large room with stone walls and floors. There are cast iron and copper pots on stone shelves. There is a large fire burning stove located in the middle of the room.
background: This is where the royal chef prepares all of the royal meals. It is located right next to the dining room where the servant serves the King and Queen and their family and guests.  There is wood brought in daily to ensure the stove can always be lit.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending into the castle basement, the air becomes cooler tainted with the musty smell of dampness. The trek is eerie with the occasional scurry of a rat breaking the silent descent.
travel_descriptions.north: A brisk walk past rows of armor, swords, and other assorted weaponry relocate you from the kitchen to the guard barracks. The heavy doors closing behind you mark the journey with a thunderous echo.

name: Great Armory
description: The Great Armory is a long room filled too to bottom with shelves and racks of weapons of every sort. Swords of every length, weight and style, likes longer than a man is tall, Morning Star maces, longbows, horse bows, crossbows, axes...they're all there.
background: The King's late older brother was an avid collector and historian of weapons of every kind, and ensured that the castle bought the very best. He had a room commissioned just for the weapons, and was always on the lookout for new ones.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending from the Great Armory, a wealth of history reflected in the glinting steel, you swiftly move towards a grand spectacle, the colossal Main Foyer.
travel_descriptions.west: Transitioning from the armory's cold steel and the tangible history it embodies, you travel towards the grandeur of power and sovereignty, the Throne Room.

name: Main Foyer
description: The main foyer is massive. A grand staircase sits to the back of the foyer leading to the upstairs. At the front of the foyer stand two servants ready to help anyone who comes to visit. To the left of the room there is a doorway leading into a corridor. To the right there is a door leading to another corridor for the King's servants. At the foot of the stairs there is a bearskin rug that is staring at you almost as if still hungry. The walls are lined with portraits of the king and his family.
background: The foyer is actually the biggest single room in the castle, the King instructed to make it as big as possible so that it could accommodate any family, royal or otherwise that might visit. He wanted every painting of their family they had to be displayed on the walls, so that you could see how long his linage extended.

name: Throne Room
description: The throne room has a throne all the way in the back of the room in the center. There is a silver carpet that lead up to the throne as you walk into the room. There are pictures of royalty hanging in the room and multiple chandeliers are hanging up. There throne chair in the back of the room with jewelry on it
background: This room is the place where the King or Queen makes decisions regarding his servants, populace and territory. It is handed down to the next King or Queen each generation.

name: Castle
description: The inside of the castle is made from grey brick. All the floors are made from gold and silver. The castle is lit by lights as well as some candles.
background: This castle is where the king lives and where other royalty reside. There are fancy dinners here as well as many important meetings.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south to the Lavoratory, one might encounter the not-so-pleasant smell that wafts from it due to the lack of ventilation. The gritty stone walls and dim candle light intensify the eerie atmosphere.
travel_descriptions.east: Venturing east towards the Secret Tunnel, one must make their way through a narrow path that teems with intrigue. The journey is shrouded in secrecy, and careful steps must be taken to navigate it successfully.

name: Arch Hall
description: The main beauty of this room is it's Arches. Four massive arches surround the four walls of this room with red drapes falling from each side. There are book shelves covered in old books that have collected dust, showing the room has been unoccupied for some time. In the center of the room is four blood red carpets that branch out to the four draped arches. The center of the room holds a dark oak-like wooden round table with a loan golden candle dimly lit in the center.
background: This room was often used by cult worshippers whom would perform rituals at the center table. The golden candle was a symbol of release and renewal, but was also construed as a summoning candle. There are legends of ancient demons being summoned here, but to this day has not been confirmed.

name: Treasure Room
description: It is home to all the most valuable and legendary pieces of fortune that have been collected by the kingdom over hundreds of years. It contains many treasure chests filled to the brim with gold. Necklaces strewn about made from every type of valuable material imaginable. Legendary swords made from the greatest sword makers in all of the lands. Pieces of armor worn by the mightiest warriors that have ever lived are lined up meticulously on one of the walls.
background: The treasure room is the most sacred room inside the castle. This room was created hundreds of years ago to house and protect an ancient magical crystal that was found in the heart of a mystical dragon. Ever since then more and more pieces of treasure have been secured inside the room.

name: The Bottlery
description: The room is dark and the air is still. There are large barrels of wine from various decades. The corners are spotted with cobwebs.
background: The Bottlery is where the kings wines are stored. The wines stored here date back to several centuries.

name: Dungeon
description: Dark and gloomy, the dungeon is the ugly underbelly of the castle. A few torches line the black stone walls, throwing a meager light on the iron bars of the cells. The air is damp and still; the only disruptions are the occasional anguished moans and cries from the prisoners.
background: The existence of this dungeon predates the castle's current occupants. Only years after the duke inherited this castle from his father did he stumble upon a hidden trapdoor that concealed the staircase that led deep down into the dungeon. Inside were the skeletons of several men, still chained in their cells. One of those skeletons still had an ornate ruby necklace around its bony neck; it was the Duke's mother, who had mysteriously vanished years earlier. Now the Duke uses the dungeon to hold any dissenters.

name: Knights Quarters
description: The knights quarters are where the King's royal guard is allowed to lodge. The quarters are dimly lit and are generally only populated at night time. Several beds are aligned along the walls with locked trunks at the base of the beds, where the knights keep their personal belongings.
background: The Knights Quarters were installed as an attempt at generosity by the King. The Knights live rent-free, but are not allowed to leave as long as they are employed. They must live here 24-7 and cannot take wives. Many of the knights have not seen sunlight since the last major battle. A hidden tunnel is located inside the trunk of an abandoned cot. It is believed to lead to a pub or perhaps a brothel.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking eastwards from the Knights Quarters takes you towards the Dining Hall. The aroma of delicious food fills the air as the large, grandiose dining hall comes into view.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north from the Quarters, the opulent Master Bedroom can be found. Lavish decorations adorn every corner along the way as you tread on the plush, carpeted floors.
travel_descriptions.west: To the west from the Quarters lies the peaceful Garden Courtyard. On making your way there, you are greeted with the sweet fragrance of a myriad of fresh blossoms that fills the air.
travel_descriptions.down: Going downwards leads to the archaic Basement. Descending the staircase feels as chilling as the history it holds, each step echoing the tales of the royals from centuries ago.

name: Dining Hall
description: The dining hall is large and airy. Huge candelabras with many candles stand throughout the room. There is one huge wooden table spanning the room that can accommodate a hundred guests. Tapestries with angels line the walls. The chairs are gilded and intricate.
background: The dining room is used for eating for small occasions and large festivities alike. The king and his family always eat here. They have used it for special occasions such as weddings and Christmas dinner but also for family meals. Many important discussions take place over food here.

travel_descriptions.south: Descending south from the dining hall, you pass through a warm fragrance of fresh bread and brewing stews, signaling your approach to the kitchen.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east, the distant clang of metal and the crisp smell of well-oiled equipment heralds your arrival to the armory.
travel_descriptions.up: Climbing up a spiral staircase, the quiet isolation from the castle's liveliness indicates your journey to the solitary room at the top of the tower.
travel_descriptions.north: Venturing north from the dining hall, a draft of cool, clean air welcomes you to the well-maintained privy room.
travel_descriptions.west: Traveling westward, the aura of grandeur and historical richness grows stronger as you approach the castle's prestigious exit.

connections.up: The Room At The Top Of The Tower

name: Master Bedroom
description: Large and spacious, the master bedroom houses a giant four poster bed with cerulean silk curtains. The bed is covered with dozens of fluffy pillows and the duvet is inlaid with sapphires and intricate silver embroidery. There lays a thick fur carpet in front of the bed. The floor-to-ceiling windows let in sunlight which catches on various gems and jewels. An ancient mahogany writing desk sits before one of the windows and has important looking papers and scrolls spread atop it.
background: The master bedroom is home to the castle's master, the King. He often finds himself there, either relaxing on the silk sheets or writing away at his desk. The large windows look out on his realm and he finds much comfort in looking out over his people.

name: The Garden Courtyard
description: The garden courtyard is found at the very center of the Grand Castle. Its the castle's 6 walls encompass the garden courtyard, creating a hexagon shaped court. Exotic flowers and plants of all varieties from all across the kingdom fill the courtyard. Reds, yellows, bright greens, and even seldom seen colors dominate the flowers that make up the garden. There are large trees and insect sized buds, massive bloomed flowers and normal lilies. The garden is an enchanment.
background: The garden courtyard is the only exotic garden in the entire kingdom. The most respected exotic flower and plant collectors send their finest collections as gifts and homage to be displayed in the garden. It is the highest honor to have one's plants and flowers be relocated there. The biosphere is unique and self sufficient to keep all of the flowers and plants alive, a strange phenomenon harmonized by the existence of many foreign plants living together.

name: Basement
description: The basement is very dark, the only lighting coming from the few torches on the surround walls. There are four pillars in the middle of the basement with only 1 torch on the inside of each pillar as they face each other. In the middle of the room there's a small rug laying under a table with some loose scroll paper on it. The walls are also lined with cleaning supplies for the maids to use.
background: The basement was originally going to be a dungeon that served for the prisoners who were found trying to infiltrate the castle but as the room was smaller than originally planned it was decided to be used as a storage for the cleaning supplies for the Duke's housemaids.

name: Castle Royal Tower
description: A stone parapet at the top of the castle, the royal tower is what makes this castle a fortress. The walls are stone and dinged with souvenirs of past battles. It is cold and gray, but the perfect vantage point for soldiers. The wind whistles through the cracks in the wall. Straw litters the floor.
background: The castle's royal tower is a lookout point for the king's men. From stone windows, soldiers can survey the land around them. You can see the green field, straw-thatched peasant huts, and fields fat with crops. From here the castle is protected with bows and arrows at the ready.

travel_descriptions.north: Descending the age-old stairs, you find yourself headed towards the King's Bedroom, the stairs creaking with each step as they echo tales of time gone by.
travel_descriptions.east: Navigating through a narrow passageway, you head east towards the Royal Bathroom, the torch-lit stone walls and the sound of your footfall your only company.
travel_descriptions.south: Making your way south, you approach the Grand Ballroom, moving through hallways adorned with portraits of past rulers and grand tapestries representing royal victories.
travel_descriptions.west: Venturing west, you find yourself trudging down a dimly lit, slightly odorous passageway headed towards the Disposal Area, a grim prospect indeed.

name: Kings Bedroom
description: There is a large bed against the wall with wooden headboard and posts holding up a fancy roof over the bed.  There is a large tapestry  across from the bed depicting a map of the kingdom.  On the floor is a large bear rug.  The walls are decorated with gold and jewels.  There are 2 large wooden doors.  One leads to a hallway, the other leads to a bathroom.  There is a large wardrobe that is painted red and gold.
background: The royal bedroom is grand and is often used to woo the nearby kingdoms.  The King stores all his royal robes and crowns here.  Most of the gold in the castle is kept here.  The bedroom is guarded on the outside by 2 guards, who are some of the kings most trusted men.

name: Royal Bathroom
description: The royal bathroom is a stone room with a long wooden bench and several holes and seats for royalty to take care of business.  There are some tapestries depicting rural landscapes hanging on the walls to give people something to look at.
background: The king often makes a stop here in the morning but he sets out on official business.  Only the royal family can use these bathrooms as everyone else is forbidden.

name: Grand Ballroom
description: There is a large marbled floor with ornate inlay-ed floor decorations.  The ceiling is tall and also ornately decorated with beautiful plaster decorations that touches by gold lining.  The space is high and well lit with many windows but has a dark musky smell.
background: The Grand Ballroom was once a place of great meaning where all royal celebrations were held.  There were often hundreds of important people to the realm in attendance just to get a glance at the royal family.

name: Disposal Area
description: It is piled high with the bodies of those that did not survive the torture process. The smell is absolutely nauseating and the rats are multiplying faster than the castle can be rid of the corpses.
background: This room is used to hold the dead after they succumb from the various torture methods. Bodies, whole and part, are dumped in piles until they can be cremated weekly.

name: Castle Kitchen
description: This is a warm, luxuriant-smelling kitchen, made of red brick that is cool to the touch on the perimeter. In the center of the room stands a grand fire-burning stove, which is stoked with crackling logs and white-hot flames. The perimeter of the room is lined with stone shelves, filled to bursting with pots and pans and other kitchen implements, the light of the fire shining in their reflection.
background: This kitchen is staffed by professional chefs and the most smug wait staff possible. Throughout the day you can see the snooty servants walking back and forth, carrying everything from fresh crusty loaves of bread to elaborate dessert puddings. The kitchen is never empty, for either the King or the Queen is always hungry at some point throughout the day.

travel_descriptions.down: A narrow, winding staircase leads from the bustling kitchen to the quiet obscurity of the damp castle basement.
travel_descriptions.north: Walking through a long, high-arched corridor, you hear the bustle of the Guard Barracks getting progressively louder.

name: Castle Basement
description: Inside of the murky basement, along the walls lay many hidden treasures of the castle. Long hidden wooden chests containing gold and other valuables, away from the eyes of the greedy, each chest is secured with a chain and a lock. There is many rats running around as well. In the air there is an unpleasant smell of dampness and the floors are dusty. There is a table  in the center on the room on which are piled many rat traps and rat poison. There are also some broken chairs set up near the wall, some missing a leg or two.
background: The treasures gathered in the castle had to be secured in a place where it would be least expected, the most hidden spot. The best spot was in the castle basement by the dungeon. The broken furniture were put there once, thrown in from the lack of a better spot for them.

name: Guard Barracks
description: This is a long, wide hall, filled with bunk beds, foot lockers, side tables and various possessions, stuffed in corners, or under furniture. The high ceiling it pointed and a dizzying array of beams criss-cross their way down the length of the room. Neat, uncluttered and relatively free of dirt. Swords, axes, maces and bows lean against walls or hang from pegs. A large center pathway, twenty feet wide, separates the long rows of beds. Two large tables near the back of the room are each surrounded by twelve old, but serviceable chairs.
background: This room may be bustling with activity, or almost totally empty, at any given time. Guards rarely spend their free time here, though on occasion, especially when off duty but in a state of readiness, they may be found playing games, wrestling, or simply conversing. The Captain of the Guard runs a very tight ship and does not tolerate any slovenly behavior. Older, senior guardsmen can sometimes be found at the tables in the back, drinking and discussing current events.

name: Castle
description: This castle is made from red brick. The walls are all painted purple and have gold trim. There is a big chandelier that lights up the main room of the castle.
background: The inside of the castle is where all important visitors come when in town. The kings throne is located in the castle and never moved. The inside of the castle gets a new coat of paint every month.

travel_descriptions.south: As you travel south from the castle, the grandeur dims giving way to the harsh cold stonework of the lavatories. The smell increases sharply reminding you of the room's function. The flickering candlelight casts long shadows, creating a rather grim ambience.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east takes a swift turn from the castle's grandeur into the secretive realm of the castle's secret tunnels. The transition is striking as you squeeze through the narrow, low ceiling tunnel. The muffled sounds of the castle are replaced by a deep quiet, pierced occasionally by the distant drip of water.

name: Lavoratory
description: The lavatory contains a long trough for which the knights can use for urination. Crude toilets are also included for defecation. The design is all stone walls with candles, and no privacy walls.
background: The room is not very pleasant since there is no ventilation to the outside. The smell can become rancid, but this is somewhat curbed by the cleaning performed by the servants. Servants will come and scoop out the troughs and toilets into wheelbarrows three times per day and wheel the waste to a nearby creek. Once a night, they will scrub the insides, as well, to help get rid of leftover waste.

name: Secret Tunnel
description: this secret tunnel is like a vein to the castle.  It leads to many other rooms within the castle.  This includes passage to the dungeon, the throne room, the kings chambers, and a secret exit to the outside.  You must be careful because the tunnel is small to maintain its secrecy.  There are 5 different rooms to the castle that can be accessed through this room. This also proves as a good escape route as enemies with large armor will not be able to fit through.
background: These tunnels were created in secret because there was a large group within the kings council wanted to overthrow him.  The king caught wind of this and had tunnels built without any one knowing but immediate and trusted family members.  Over time the kings regained order amount his people and the tunnels are more well known.  Now they are used as a method of escape in case of invasion.

name: The Kitchens
description: The kitchens are a busy, hot place. They are filled with kitchen staff rushing around to prepare the main meals for the king's family and residing nobles. Tonight they are preparing two deer the king and his nobles caught while hunting, as well as some rabbit from a few days ago and seasoned vegetables. There are multiple fires around the kitchen to cook the animals and boil the vegetables, and combined with the heat of all the people the room is stifling. While the main kitchen workers are middle aged women who stay at one station, there are also younger children running around taking ingredients from one place to another. People are shouting instructions and gossip to one another constantly, so it is very hard to hear anything, but the atmosphere is very cheerful.
background: This room has always been the kitchen for the king's family. The kitchen workers take pride in serving delicious food to the king, his family, and whatever guests they may have. In fact, when there are guests, the workers make sure the food is especially delicious. They also have an ulterior motive to make sure the food is amazing - they are allowed the eat the leftovers after the evening's feast is finished.

travel_descriptions.north: Exiting the kitchens, you pass through the bustling serving area where footmen are loading up silver trays of food. You then enter the pet chamber, a sudden calm after the chaotic hustle of the kitchens.
travel_descriptions.down: You leave the hearty smells of the kitchens behind as you descend a narrow, winding staircase, the walls damp with underground chill, until the dungeon, with its lurking dread, unveils itself.

name: Pet Chamber
description: You see dozens of tiny luxurious cages where the menagerie is kept.  Instead of metal bars, the cages have bars of clearest crystal, and within are every sort of animal that walks, crawls, flaps or slithers.
background: All of the rarest and most beautiful animals are sent here as tribute, buy they are sad and need to be petted and played with. Unfortunately you can't reach in to touch any of them.

name: Dungeon
description: Lit only by scattered torches, The dungeon lies far underneath the castle.  Bandits and Thieves who find themselves there are met with cold stone walls and floors, with chains and bars restricting movement.  Guards patrol the corridors, keeping an eye out for any escape attempt or misdeed.  The only comforts afforded in the Dungeon are the piles of hay for sleeping.
background: Any criminal who commits an act of thievery or injustice against the kingdom finds themselves locked away in the dungeon.  Far from prying eyes, the guards are able to enact a special form of justice and rehabilitation to ensure the kingdom stays safe and protected.  Some say the most dastardly of  criminal will spend the rest of their lives there, while certain rumors can be told of a secret tunnel leading to freedom for any foolish enough to find themselves there.

name: Castle Armory
description: Swords and armor line the wall of the grand armory. No rust is to be found on any of the weapons. The armorer's forge bellows smoke and fire, day and night, as the king's army is getting fitted out for it's next campaign.
background: The armory was founded some 2 centuries ago. It is the biggest armory in the land and has the best armorer to boot. Thousands of swords and armor pieces are made there each day in preparation of the bloodiest campaign predicted.

travel_descriptions.west: You leave the bustling armory, making your way through large stone archways towards the dining hall. As you walk, the clanging of blacksmith hammers diminish, replaced by the distant sound of bards' songs and the smell of delicious food wafting from the dining hall.

name: Dining Hall
description: The dining room holds a gleaming, gilded wooden table that can seat 100! There are gilded mirrors on the walls, and hundreds of candles, which are lit every night. There is a large handmade rug on the floor and tapestries lining the walls depicting past royalty.
background: The dining room is used for grand occasions big and small. The king eats there every night. There are festivities while they eat. They serve ten courses every night!

travel_descriptions.south: Heading south towards the kitchen, the scent of cooked meals and roasted meat fills the air. The echoed clatter of pans, knives and dishes signal the flurry of activity in preparation for the night's feast.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east to the armory, one must tread along dimly-lit corridors filled with the musty scent of old wood and iron. The distant whirring of sharpening stones resonates, hinting at the soldiers' diligent upkeep of their weaponry.
travel_descriptions.up: As one ascends to the room at the top of the tower, the air grows noticeably quieter, with only the faint, rhythmic footfalls on the spiral staircase piercing the serene silence. The higher you ascend, the more panoramic the view of the realm through the windows becomes.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north towards the privy room, one passes a myriad of lesser-used rooms and hallways. The path is not a favorite amongst guests, but necessary nonetheless. The flickering torchlight casts an almost eerie glow over the less-traveled route.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking west towards the castle exit, one must navigate through the more busy areas of the castle. The constant hum of servant chatter and rustling of garments fill the air as they bustle to and fro, carrying out their duties. As the large doors come into sight, one can feel the mixed scents of the castle's interior and the impending freshness of the outdoors.

connections.up: The Room At The Top Of The Tower

name: Gold Mine
description: The entrance is very unstable, with parts falling to the ground. As you enter, the walls have been crudely chipped away to make the path to the old mine. There is trash from the previous miners scattered on the dirt ground. Rocks are all around the area, where one would stumble as they go inside. It used to be a very productive gold mine, now falling to bits. There are broken lanterns, with shattered glass.
background: The gold mine use to be full of glittering gold, shining all around. The miners  were in their by large numbers, picks in their hand, pounding at the walls. It was known for producing gold nuggets the size of a man's palm.

travel_descriptions.north: The journey north from the Gold Mine to the Abandoned Mine is eerily quiet. The creaking timbers and echoing dripping water only emphasizes the desolation of the area. The dirt path underfoot is illuminated periodically by the flickering of abandoned lanterns, making the shadows dance.

name: Abandoned Mine
description: It's dark, cold, and musty. There is old machinery lying around, rusting, and discarded tools lie on the ground. Cobwebs are everywhere. The rock walls are damp, and a trickle of water can be heard coming from somewhere off in the dark.
background: This mine used to be very productive and lots of men worked in it. But eventually the stores of metal under the earth depleted, and it was abandoned because it was no longer profitable. The nearby village suffered as a result, with lots of people moving away. Some locals say this mine is haunted by spirits.

travel_descriptions.south: The path to the south, towards the Gold Mine, is fragmented and rough. The air grows colder and faint traces of gold dust can be seen glistening in the weak light.
travel_descriptions.west: The journey westwards towards the Weathered Shack takes you through a narrow, twisting path amidst thick forest undergrowth. Fallen leaves rustle underfoot and there is an eerie silence that fills the air. The forest slowly gives way to a clearing with the Weathered Shack standing solemnly in the center.

name: Weathered Shack
description: A weathered shack with a roof made of old broken tiles sits in the middle of the forest. The wood is starting to split and the shack appears as if it will crumble at any moment.
background: Around 1902, a man and his wife lived in the shack. They lived on the land and were able to survive by creating a self-sustaining homestead. When they died, the shack remained unused and started to wither away.

travel_descriptions.east: You tread carefully, meandering through the thick forest until you reach the dark, ominous entrance of the abandoned mine.
travel_descriptions.south: Following the faint trail through the undergrowth, the path leads you to the collapsed and forsaken entrance of the old mine.

name: Abandoned Mine Entrance
description: The abandoned mine is located in a field with a few trees. It is unable to be seen from far away. The closer you get the more you  notice the ground caving in around the hole. When you peer down into the mine, you see crumbling walls and concrete and a hole so deep you can't see where it ends.
background: The mind used to be the hub of coal many years ago. The king's men worked diligently to remove the coal to use for heating the village. It wasn't untill about 40 years ago, that the mine started to crumble and the King deemed it to dangerous to access anymore.

travel_descriptions.north: As you head north, you leave the ominous mine behind, stepping onto the mottled path lined with jutting rocks and twisted tree roots. The whispering wind foretells tales of the weathered shack that awaits you.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving west, you abandon the quiet mutterings of the mine, and traverse a thin, patchy trail through a dense, dark thicket. Occasional howls underscore your journey toward the forsaken castle.

name: The Forsaken Castle
description: Old and creepy, the castle has been abandoned for centuries now. It is broken and destroyed.
background: The castle use to belong to a kingdom. It was a beautiful and rich kingdom, but the people were murdered by bandits.

travel_descriptions.east: As you venture east, the sense of dread increases with each step. The ruined castle slowly recedes, until you're walking amidst unkempt fields, eventually finding the hidden entrance to the abandoned mine.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you journey through an eerily quiet landscape, each step crunching against the ground as you venture into the tormented battleground, now known as the 'Land Beyond The Wasteland'.

name: Land Beyond The Wasteland
description: Not a man in sight nor an animal to hear. This land is completely barren and hot, unfit for any agricultural activity. It has been left abandoned so much so that the King has not even had time give it a name, so people simply refer to is as "Abandoned"
background: It is the field of a vicious battle between the King's Guard and the Barbarians. It was torched with fire and flooded with the blood and gore of both armies. Now, it lays abandoned and is said that venturing too deep into the Abandoned causes one too lose sanity.

travel_descriptions.north: The daunting trek north leads towards the Forsaken Castle, a trip filled with eerie silence broken only by the ominous howling of the wind echoing through the barren landscape.
travel_descriptions.east: To the east, a path overgrown with weeds and brush leads you towards the Ruined House. As you journey, the remnants of past grandeur can be glimpsed amongst the ruin and decay.
travel_descriptions.west: The journey west takes you along the hazardous remnants of the Collapsed West Wing. Amidst the desolation, a sense of foreboding fills the damp, sea air.

name: Ruined House
description: A dilapidated wooden structure with a caved in roof and debris everywhere.  Even the trees outside the house are falling apart.  There's waist high grass leading to the house along with a dirt path.
background: This used to be the room of a wealthy noble.  However, due to his poor business decisions, he was forced to flee and leave his home in disrepair.  Vagrants have come to stay over the years and loot whatever was inside.

travel_descriptions.west: Travelling west from the Ruined House, the landscape quickly becomes stark and lifeless as you approach the Land Beyond The Wasteland.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north from the Ruined House, the ground becomes unstable and rocky, leading to the remains of the Collapsed West Wing.

name: Collapsed West Wing
description: The rocks have all but fallen into the ocean.  There is moss and other plant life climbing the remaining rocks, making it a very moist and gloomy environment.  There are some small left-behind pieces of what appear to have been some furniture, and possibly a cradle.
background: The noble had recently brought a child into the world with his wife when this wing of the home went crashing into the ocean.  It is not know if the child perished or  not, but a crushed cradle can be seen through the rubble in the collapsed wing.

travel_descriptions.south: Moving south from the collapsed west wing, the atmosphere changes rapidly, as the ruins of a once grand house come into view, the journey marked by creaking floorboards and the scent of damp, rotting woodpeak.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north towards the lonely island, the journey is treacherous and windswept. The salty taste of the sea lingers in the air and the constant crashing of waves against the rocky shores fills the silence.

name: A Lonely Island
description: the island only has one coconut tree and waves crashing and appearing missing wooden boat parts. The pirates are nowhere to be seen.
background: The pirates leave people there that they have robbed from their ship such as gold from royalty, they leave people stranded there as a sport. There is nothing but a coconut tree there and skeletons of other people.

travel_descriptions.south: You'll traverse treacherous ocean waves to reach the collapsed west wing, the air getting increasingly damp and heavy with the unmistakable scent of moss.
travel_descriptions.west: The journey to the abandoned castle requires careful manoeuvring on the slippery cliffs. Each step closer makes you feel a striking sense of isolation and the echoing silence is only broken by the ocean's relentless onslaught against the cliff.

connections.west: An Abandoned Castle On An Ocean Cliff Side

name: An Abandoned Castle On An Ocean Cliff Side
description: The castle is located at the top of an erosive cliff face of a vast ocean. An entire wing of the castle appear to have collapsed into the ocean due to the erosion of the cliff face, perhaps the reason why the castle now lay abandoned.
background: The castle once belonged to a noble of a rather poor fishing village. He could not afford magical protection, so he was unable to protect his mighty castle from the erosion of the cliffs. An elderly man in the nearby fishing villages claims that the castle belonged to his family, but lacks the paperwork necessary to prove his claims.

travel_descriptions.east: A perilous journey awaits those who dare to head east from the cliff side castle. They must navigate the tumultuous sea and brave the relentless waves until they reach a lonely island, which is said to be a place of lore and mystery, where the only companionship comes from the whispering winds and the occasional crash of a coconut falling from the lone tree.

name: Inside Of A Troll Cave
description: A damp and vile smelling cave that only is lit by the sun that goes through the entrance. Skeletons from small animals can be seen sprawled across the floor. A little pile of leaves sit in a corner next to a campfire.
background: The local troll that roams the land lives in this cave. He only comes out in the day to find food then comes back to his cave at night to eat and sleep. Sometimes adventurers stumble upon this cave and run away from the rancid smell.

travel_descriptions.south: As you navigate your way south, the damp cave air shifts to the tranquil hum of nature, interjected only by the suckling sound of feet treading through swampy marshlands.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east from the cave, the rough stone path smoothes out and the journey is filled with the smell of wildflowers until a chilling wind heightens your senses as you draw closer to the foreboding cabin.

name: A Creature Cave
description: This cave is very dark and damp. The smell is a stale and strong scent. There is little to no light. The walls are wet and the floor is slippery. Mice are all over and some bats are hanging from the ceiling.
background: This cave houses a large creature. No one knows where it came from but they do know it is harmful to humans. The creature likes to bring it's kills back into this cave.

travel_descriptions.north: You carefully navigate the slippery and wet cave floors to the north, towards a faint smell of something rotten and unwelcoming.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving towards the west takes you through an increasingly damp area of the cave, as a strange iridescent glow starts to fill the surroundings.

name: The Fountain Of Youth
description: The water here bubbles softly, cascading down the golden framework of the fountain.  The water is clear as crystal, and shimmers softly with a faint glow that doesn't seem to quite reflect the light around it.  The fountain itself is made of elaborately filigrees of gold and silver that twist and curve to show the sparkle of the water best, and it breathtaking to behold. While the fountain's beauty is what first draws the eye, a careful glace down at the earth around it reveals a frightening sight.  Skeletons, some clad in ancient armor from kingdoms long turned to dust, others worn down so that even what clothing they had has long since disintegrated, litter the earth.  Beautiful flowers grow up from them, partially obscuring whatever carnage caused these people to perish.
background: The Fountain of Youth has long been a story of legend among mortal folk.  Yet, as with any magic in these realms, there is oft a price to be paid to cheat Nature of her rights.  While many whisper and dream of finding this mysterious fountain, and over the centuries many a brave knight has searched, no one has ever returned from visiting this perilous place.

travel_descriptions.south: Moving southward from the glistening Fountain of Youth, the scenery transitions from ominous skeletal remains to the cozy confines of the Elf's Room nestled within a picturesque red mushroom.
travel_descriptions.east: As you traverse the path east from the fountain, the atmosphere becomes noticeably lighter. The ominous aura subsides and an overwhelming sense of magic and light fills the air as you approach the shimmering silver walls of the Faeries Den.
travel_descriptions.outside: Exiting the magical aura of the Fountain of Youth, the path to The Royal Tent is enchanting. A soft glow lights the way, leading you to a tent shimmering in the moonlight, exuding a warmth that promises rest and respite.

name: Echo Hall
description: A gigantic dome-like building with a round table in the center of it. There is magelight above it and encircles the dome. Traces of wizards' histories appear on the walls and disappear from time to time.
background: The most renown of wizards would congregate here historically in order to discuss advancements of magic. Their deeds would be recorded on the walls and recalled when wizards would speak about them again.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west through the enchanted forest, you feel a suspenseful calm. The verdant trees twinkle with mysterious energy leading to the golden glimmer of the Fountain of Youth.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east, you pass through treacherous, sharp rocks. The dank smell of the troll cave eventually hits, warning of the foul creature lurking within.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending magically, the world swirls around you. The creeping cold of the wizard’s lair starts to settle in, amidst distant whispers of powerful spells.

name: Elf'S Room
description: A tiny room in a red mushroom. Tiny frames with photos of an elf family decorate the walls of a well-lit room. A miniscule lantern lit with a single morsel shines on a table made of oak bark.
background: A magical elf far from home built this room in an attempt to seek refuge from the creatures of the forest. He hides during the night, but ventures out to explore during the day.

travel_descriptions.north: As you wander north towards the Fountain of Youth, the path is accompanied by crisp, verdant moss. But mind the eerie silence as skeletons appear occasionally amidst the floral beauty.
travel_descriptions.east: Venturing east to the Secret Magician's Workshop, an eerie chill replaces the forest's warmth. The influence of the wizard's magic increasingly clings to the air, infusing it with a pulsating energy.

name: Swamp
description: The swamp is glowing with wonder and color.  There are parts that range from dark red to bright yellow.  People often visit here to speak with the gods and claim it can be both harmful to those it dislikes and healing to those who it deems worthy.
background: The swamp contains many different properties.  It allows people to live forever or possibly cause death based on whom approaches it.  It has been called both the swamp of evil and the swamp of youth.

travel_descriptions.north: The path to the north leads through murky waters filled with ghostly lights to a hulking darkened formation - the Creature Cave.
travel_descriptions.east: To East, the scent of dank earth and overgrown foliage indicates the Troll Cave, a journey full of treacherous dips and mud trodden pathways.
travel_descriptions.south: The route southward is suffused with an ethereal glamour, fragrant with blooming flowers and gentle fluttering sounds hinting towards the realms of the Faeries Den.

name: Faeries Den
description: Stunning with silver walls and gold decorations, Magical items can be found on the shelves, including crystals, faery wands, and a crown.
background: The Faerie Den is home to the faeries when they are not out helping others. Faeries come here to rest and regain their magical powers after helping humans in the human realm. No human has ever entered here.

travel_descriptions.west: The journey from the Faeries Den to the Swamp is filled with bewitching beauty, as you pass through luminescent mushrooms that twinkle like the starts and navigate through tangled growths of emerald foliage, their tangled beauty often luring travellers.
travel_descriptions.north: Now the journey turns darker. Entering the Troll Cave means moving through the mist-filled forest filled with gnarled trees. The chatter of the forest creatures reduces as one nears the cave, hinting at the cave's resident who's feared by all.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling towards the Royal Tent is uplifting. The intensity of the magic in the air increases, with the flora seeming to glow with an ambient light. The hum of magical energy intensifies, almost like a melody, as you near the Tent, making the journey ethereal.

name: The Royal Tent
description: The walls of this tent shimmer with a soft glow at every passing breeze.  Though they seem thin and almost weblike, no trace of a draft comes from them.  A bed made of cloth that is both soft and warm hangs in the corner of the tent.  It seems to perfectly fit there, as though it was grown from the tent walls instead of skillfully placed.  The floor is carpeted with impossibly vibrant rugs, the likes of which no mortal eye has seen, and the walls of the tent rise up so high that the ceiling cannot be seen.  A brazier glows softly, and above it hangs a golden teapot.  Vapors rising from its spout waft into the space, smelling of cinnamon and spices. There is a soft glowing stone by one side of the tent wall that looks like a flagstone crafted from an impossibly large pearl. The tent is warm and inviting, and a little unnervingly beautiful.  Truly, this is a place worthy of the Royal Family of the Alabaster Elves.
background: The Alabaster Elves disdain those who separate themselves from the magical realm they live in with walls and stone.  Instead they chose to live in fantastical tents, and roam throughout the Realm of Magic, always seeking to unlock the secrets and mysteries throughout the land.  The Royal Tent is but slightly larger than the rest, as the royal family does not hold themselves overly above their subjects.  It was said to have been a gift of the Elves of the North, and the magics of it allow for it to be as practical and durable as it is beautiful to behold.

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north to the Faeries Den, you pass through a misty forest shimmering with ethereal beauty. The air is filled with the sweet aroma of otherworldly blossoms, and you can occasionally glimpse tiny, darting lights between the trees.
travel_descriptions.inside: Journeying inside to the Fountain Of Youth, there is a strange sensation - like passing through a portal into a different world. The forest gives way to an endless stretch of twilight where the time seems to stand still. The path is paved with glowing pebbles, forming a path that seems to hum with ancient magic.

name: Secret Magician'S Workshop
description: This is the hidden workshop of the most powerful wizard in the land.  There are ornate tapestries on the walls depicting wizards using their powers and potions in battle.
background: Mordak, the wizard, constructed this powerful workshop after the death of the most famous king, Henry of Silverton.  Any who enter here immediately become enchanted with the wizard's power, giving them advanced healing powers.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking west, you find yourself entering the room of a woodland elf. The scent of wild mushrooms fills the air as you marvel at the tiny frames hanging on the walls.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, the path leads you to Echo Hall. You shiver at the frigidly eerie ambiance amidst the echoing sounds of whispered magical chants that seem to bounce off the dome-like walls.
travel_descriptions.down: Taking the path downwards, you arrive at the Wizard's Lair. An overwhelming sense of mystery and intrigue fills you as you navigate amongst painted walls, overgrown pots of plants and empty cages.

name: Wizard'S Lair
description: The wizard's lair is a mystical room. The walls are painted to resemble the night sky and pots of overgrown plants line the walls. Cages that once held creatures sit on top of an oak table in the center of the lair.
background: The wizard of the town was tired of casting spells in public and being ridiculed. He built this room for months in order to have a private place to think and get revenge.

travel_descriptions.up: The journey to the Secret Magician'S Workshop is a dizzying ascent through a magical vortex that rapidly shifts colors and emits enchanting music.
travel_descriptions.west: You walk across a crystal bridge that glows under your feet, the flickering shadows painting a path to Echo Hall.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south to the Cabin Of An Ogre, you traverse a murky forest dense with cryptic symbols carved into the trees, casting an eeriness over the path.

name: The Cabin Of An Ogre
description: The wooden walls of the cabin are crudely adorned with a green, suspicious ooze. A dusty rug lays on the cold wooden floor of the cabin, dimly lit with a lantern situated in a corner in front of a large cobweb.
background: The ogre built this cabin and has inhabited it for years after being run out of town. He tends to his gardens and imagines what it is like to be among his own one day. He invites no one to this place.

travel_descriptions.north: Venturing north, the ambiance shifts from the mundane to the mystical. The scent of freshly turned soil gives way to the aroma of spell ingredients as you approach the wizard's secluded lair.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, the air slowly grows damp and stagnant as you move towards the troll's cave. The telltale signs of its frequently used fire are evident even before you arrive at the cave mouth.

name: Farmer'S House
description: a single room cottage with a dirt floor, minimally decorated with only a table, a pallet and a wood burning stove there is but a single window and a single door at this place
background: This is feudal land, owned by a lordly lord and worked by a peasant farmer who grows crops mainly to be harvested for the lord's feasts and store but he is allowed to eat what he may, and has little else.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking east from the farmer’s house, you pass through lush fields under the open sky until the grandeur of the Royal Farm is in sight.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west leads away from the wide-open fields, toward a tranquil river where the Stilt Home perches, safe from the rise and fall of the water’s edge.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south, the sounds of domesticated animals grows louder as you approach the busy Chicken Coop.

name: Royal Farm
description: The farm is immense in land size and lies to the east of the castle and its walls. A variety of food products are created for the suitability of the kingdom. A variety of animals are grown and killed for their meats.
background: The peasants of the kingdom must work for a living. They have gathered together to tend to the foodstuffs of the kingdom. The peasants work day and night for their crops.

travel_descriptions.west: The journey towards the Farmer's House is a peaceful walk through emerald green fields brimming with golden crops, punctuated by the sounds of chirping birds and the hum of insects.
travel_descriptions.north: Moving towards the area Adjacent To The Guest Castle, you cross a stony path that cuts through generously watered and well-tended gardens, igniting the scent of blooming roses and lavender in the air.
travel_descriptions.east: The path to The Old Red Barn is a gradual uphill climb, with the view of rustic farmlands stretching out in the backdrop. You can hear the distant lowing of the animals housed in the barn.

name: Stilt Home
description: This stilt home has large wooden vertical beams propping it up to avoid the annual flooding that comes about during the year.  The dark wooden home itself is rather plain on the inside and outside with a thatch roof.  There's a small garden to the rear of the stilt home.
background: This home belongs to a clever herbalist who thought it'd be smart to have his house propped out to avoid getting flooded.  As a result, he encounters few if any damages to his home.

travel_descriptions.east: A winding path leads through tall rows of corn, the stalks waving gently in the breeze as you move eastward towards the Farmer's House.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, you follow a well-trod path picked out by the hooves of noble steeds, leading you towards the royal Horse Tent.

name: Chicken Coop
description: The yard outside the barn is on a small, but well-maintained farm plot. There are enclosures for animals, and a short path leading up to a handsome, cozy farmhouse surrounded by large trees. The sun is warm, and the smell of grass and animal odors hangs in the air.
background: This yard has been set up to be a chicken coop, but it doesn't appear to have been planned for that originally.

travel_descriptions.north: Following the well-trodden path, the comforting smell of the countryside becomes stronger as you approach the Farmer's House.
travel_descriptions.south: A short walk down a deteriorating track leads to the mysterious Haunted Orchard, where the cawing of crows grows louder with each step.

name: Adjacent To The Guest Castle
description: Green, fertile, and blessed with crops of all kind. This well-kept farm grows corn, rice, and wheat for the King's Family and closest aides. Animals such as horses, goats, and the bleating of sheep keeps this Farm bustling with activity.
background: The Farm is the oldest location in the King's Land and was the first location of the Kings Castle, which has now been converted into a Guest Castle. The castle has been rejuvenated after a deadly famine 100 years ago that wiped out all life. Today, it is looked after by a team of well-compensated farmers.

travel_descriptions.south: The journey south toward Royal Farm is pleasant, as you travel past verdant fields rich with fruits and vegetables. You can hear the distant sounds of animals and the faint scent of hay fills the air.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you pass through vast fields that gently sway with the wind. It's a peaceful journey leading to an Open Field, somewhat sad upon semblance as traces of past activity teasingly tugs at nostalgia.

name: The Old Red Barn
description: This is an old run down red barn. It's two stories and most farmers wouldn't still be using it. It has chickens and cows inside and harvests eggs and milk for the entire family. The second story has a large pile of hay visible through an old opening in the front.
background: This barn has been on the farm since the very beginning. It was built by the first generation farmer to live on the land over sixty years ago. It has been repainted numerous times and wasn't originally red. It was actually yellow before switching to red.

travel_descriptions.west: The journey west to the Royal Farm is through rolling fields of grain bordered by winding country roads, while in the distance, the vast farmland and bustling activity of the farm workers can be sighted.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east towards the Castle Farm, the scenery morphs gradually from the rustic hues of the countryside, to imposing grey stone fortifications, marking the demarcation of Castle Farm from the rest of the kingdom.

name: Horse Tent
description: Held erect by large bronze poles planted firmly in the ground, the purple and gold Horse tent offers a canvas over a number of stalls, each with it's own accommodations including fresh hay and a trough that is refilled daily. The tent's entrance is kept open during the day to allow sunlight to shine into the tent illuminating those inside, while the other end of the tent has a door leading directly into the guest castle.
background: The Horse Tent is used to store the royalty's guests' horses as they visit the kingdom. They are tended to by the stable boys, and are a means to show the King's generosity in dealing with visitors.

travel_descriptions.south: Heading south from the Horse Tent, the path leads across open landscape, the fresh scent of hay fading as the noise of nature grows, until you eventually reach the peculiar vertical structures of the Stilt Home.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving eastward from the Horse Tent, the land shifts unsettlingly, from the comforting rustic ambience of the tent to the eeriness of the twisted and gnarled fruit trees of the Haunted Orchard.

name: Haunted Orchard
description: Stunted and gnarled fruit trees are lined in rows. The trees have thick bases and are clearly very old but have not produced any fruit for a long time, yet they stubbornly cling to life. Unpruned, their branches stick out at all angles making it hard for a person to traverse the orchard and frequently these branches grab the loose clothing of any visitor. Wind moan through the trunks while dead leaves slowly tumble along the ground.
background: This orchard was clearly a well tended, food producing area taken care of by people living in the Abandoned Shack. But it too has become abandoned.

travel_descriptions.north: Passing through the orchard filled with old fruit trees, the path leads to a small but well-maintained farm plot, where the yard has been repurposed into a chicken coop.
travel_descriptions.west: A winding path leads west, away from the orchard. Gradually, the sight of a grand horse tent, held by bronze poles and decorated in royal colors, comes into view.
travel_descriptions.south: The path slowly descends to the south, opening up to vast expanses of farmland. A gigantic farm stretches over the horizon, lively with the sound of horses and commanding your gaze towards an iconic red barn at its heart.

name: An Open Field
description: An old run down farm, long abandoned by the inhabitants due to a ghost in the well directly in front of the farmhouse. It has seen better days, the wood is old and warped, scorched from fire set by brigands. Old tools litter the yard and bits of armor. It is obvious many have used this as a temporary camp since it's days as a working farm.
background: The farm once was a very productive venture, providing meat and produce for the people in the tower. The decorations are old but nice, not the type a king would own but a well-to-do merchant. What isn't nailed down has been carted off or used for campfire fuel.

travel_descriptions.east: Moving towards the east, one finds themselves on a path that winds between the abandoned farm and a copse of trees. It directs you to the Sheriff's Office, located on the southern edge of the field. It's a quiet stroll with the rustling of leaves and the occasional sounds of birds echoing in the air.

name: Castle Farm
description: The farm is a large patch of land located directly outside of the castle walls. A wide variety of grains, vegetables and fruits are grown here to feed the castle's people. A few lone barns are scattered across the farmland, housing a wide array of farm animals that are slaughtered for their delicious meats.
background: The farms were a necessity for the castle to be able to sustain itself during winters and sieges. As a result, the unskilled laborers of the castle were designated to move outside the castle walls and generate food for their people. The farmers always made sure there was a plentiful amount of harvest to last during these harsh times.

travel_descriptions.west: Weaving through stalks of corn and sturdy wheat, the path leading west to the Old Red Barn is rough but reliable, shaded by the sweeping branches of ancient, gnarled oak trees.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north from the farm, a narrow, dusty road snakes its way to the Sheriff Office. The air gradually fills with the murmur of the town and the scent of parchment and ink.

name: Large Farm
description: The farm is huge, over 1000 acres. There are a ton of horses that live on the farm and a wooden fence is around all roads of the farm. There is a red barn in the center of the farm.
background: The farm is the life of the town. It is where all the crops are grown to feed the people. The barn was the first building built when the town was established.

travel_descriptions.north: Wandering through the eerie farm fields, the gnarled fruit trees of the orchard soon creep into view. The wind carries eerie echoes and the crunch of dry leaves underfoot is the only accompaniment.
travel_descriptions.west: Trudging west, the busy sounds of the farm grow quiet. The rustic aroma of the stable fills the air, accompanied by the distant sounds of animals shifting in their stalls.

name: Sheriff Office
description: The sheriff's office is a small building on the southern edge of the farm. There is a desk with decrees from the king and other papers strewn about. Hanging on the wall are swords and other weapons. The room is small and cluttered, with various books and other things strewn about.
background: The sheriff spends a lot of his time reading when he is not tasked with taking care of a problem. The main jail is underneath the castle, so no prisoners are housed at the office. It is a small, quiet building and the sheriff is often napping when someone comes to see him.

travel_descriptions.south: The journey south to the Castle Farm involves walking down a well-trodden path, lined with low stone walls. The soothing smell of ripening crops and distant lowing of cattle set a calming mood.
travel_descriptions.west: Westwards towards the Open Field, the terrain becomes wilder and less cultivated. Wild grass and untamed flora adds a sense of unpredictability during the journey, an old wisp of the time when the land was yet to be tamed.

name: Stable
description: It's a plain wooden building that has survived many harsh seasons.  The floor of the stable is covered in hay and there's food and pieces of farm equipment stored inside.
background: This is an area where the horses are kept and maintained.  The peasants who run the farm store pieces of equipment in here as well along with food for the animals.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking from the dusty stable eastwards, you enter a vast farm with vibrant green fields stretching beyond the horizon.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north from the stable, the corn field looms in front of you, tall stalks swaying as a warm breeze rustles through them.

name: Barn
description: The old rustic barn was settled on the outermost edge of the farm.  Standing tall over the fields, this two-story red barn cast a long shadow over the field surrounding it.  Large wooden doors that could be propped open with great effort would lead you directly inside.
background: This barn was a landmark of the farm.  Withstanding the elements for almost a century, it has kept it's original construct.  Whenever guests come for fresh eggs or milk, the farmer often boasts about it.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking south from the barn, you'll traverse over the slightly uneven terrain of the farm. The smell of the barn slowly fades and is replaced by the homey scents of the main house.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west to the living quarters, the path is lined with greenery. Rustling sounds from the leaves add to the emotional connection between the farm workers and the land they cultivate.

name: Corn Field
description: the corn field extends as far as the eye can see. In the off season months it is barren grass, but during the corn growing season it is filled with shoulder high thick yellow stocks with corn growing at the ends. There are pathways cut into the field to provide walking terrain for the farmers.
background: Corn provides the livelihood for these farmers, and as such most of their days are spent tending to the crop. For about a century the farmers and their forefathers have tended to their now famous crop, which is boasted as the best in the land.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking south from the corn field, the path is bordered by more lush crops swaying gently in the breeze. As you near the stable, the distinct scent of hay and horses fills the air.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward, the path is well-trodden, showing the frequent journies made by the farmers from field to house. As the main house comes into view, you can see warm light flickering from its windows.

name: Main House
description: A fairly plain wooden building, the fireplace in the center of the back wall provides warmth during the winter seasons. There are paintings on the wall showing the farmer's forefathers and the previous owners. The floor is adorned with animal pelt rugs, and wood crafted furniture for the farmers to sit in.
background: The main house provides refuge for the farmers after a hard days work, and is where they sleep, eat, and socialize before heading out for another day in the fields.

travel_descriptions.east: With the wind guiding your life, you stroll through the vibrant green foliage towards the endless corn fields. The soothing rustling of leaves in the wind provides a calming soundtrack to your journey.
travel_descriptions.north: Walking north, the barn slowly begins to dominate your field of view. The rhythmic sounds of animals and the scent of hay intensify as you near it.

name: Barn
description: The barn is old and rustic on the inside, with fresh red paint on the outside. Inside there is a ladder leading up to a loft. There is hay everywhere.
background: The barn is the biggest and brightest building on the property. It is where the animals sleep at night and take shelter in the cold. Children sometimes play in the barn, jumping from the loft and landing on a pile of hay.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking south from the rustic barn, one would find themselves approaching the warm comfort of the main house, its welcoming glow a stark difference against the quiet, humble barn.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west from the barn leads to the living quarters, a journey filled with sounds and sights of the farm, from the rustle of the hay to the distant clucking of the chickens.

name: The Living Quarters
description: Small barn like building, with old wooden doors and not many windows. It has different rooms as well as a decent sized kitchen.
background: The farm workers live here, where they share meals and their free time. Despite all being different, they have become like a family. They like the fact they can live where they work.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking from The Living Quarters, a path leads through a small backyard garden. As you traverse the beaten path, the looming figure of the old rustic Barn comes into view.

name: Barn
description: A large shed like building aside any farmers house. Usually made out of wood with a large gate for moving animals. Used to store animals or farm equipment.
background: A barn is must need for any farmer. It is the place of productivity. Where the cows can be milked and equipment is stored. A farmer without one is running the farm with out a leg. Simple yet helpful to such a degree where one might find a farmer spend most of his time in.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking to the Main House from the Barn involves crossing a large open area of the farm, buzzing with the activities of farm animals and workers.
travel_descriptions.west: Travelling to The Living Quarters from the Barn is an interesting journey along a worn footpath, flanked by shrubs and agricultural paraphernalia.

name: The Fountain
description: the fountain is the only thing you can hear in the graveyard. It's eerily quiet, not even a bird chirping. The fountain is teen feet high, and it is dry as a desert. It makes the graveyard more eerie than any other one.
background: the fountain used to have water and it was well taken care of but the village was abandoned and therefore grass and weeds grew everywhere.

travel_descriptions.north: The path to the Cemetery is full of wilting flowers and decaying autumn leaves, presenting an atmosphere of lingering melancholy.
travel_descriptions.east: The way to the Reception Area has an eerie silence, interrupted only by the melancholic rustling of the wind against high grass.
travel_descriptions.south: The road to the Main Street goes through the desolate parts of the abandoned village, carrying the gloomy aura of the cemetery along.

name: Graveyard
description: The dark and gloomy graveyard has fog all the time and has a large amount of graves everywhere you step. There are whispers and shadows that appear from the darkness and there is always a light drizzle that seems to moisten the place.
background: The graveyard was started after the King's son died and they wanted to make a place just for royalty. For decades, this graveyard has held all the royal members that have come and go. The graveyard was expanded after they needed more room.

travel_descriptions.north: The cobbled path towards the Old Crypt is eerie and hushed, with the light of the moon barely penetrating the dense fog. The path is littered with worn gravestone, crunching under each step.
travel_descriptions.west: The path to the Fountain meanders through ancient tombs, their carvings barely visible through layers of moss. The silence here is tangible, broken only by the distant rustle of leaves.

name: Cemetery
description: Dim and low lit. The aura from this cemetery emits sadness and pain perpetually. You can feel and sense the eerie nature of the graveyard crawl up your spine. There seems to be a slight fog slowly making its way across the open parts of the cemetery.
background:
This graveyard is located outside the notorious town of Brimswood.
The many atrocities and constant stress filled throughout the town has earned it a reputation for being haunted by many spirits.

travel_descriptions.south: Wandering south, the silence deepens. The rustling leaves under your feet echo through the night as you approach a desolate fountain.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, crunching fallen twigs beneath your boots, you feel a chill in the air as you approach a lonely, abandoned shed.

name: Reception Area
description: The building itself is ordinary in appearance and is somewhat foreboding.  It is surrounding by a dense fog and high grass.  Sometimes, one can hear whispers in the wind.
background: This is a plain building where business matters of the graveyard are conducted.  Peasants and royalty alike come here to make deals to bury their loved ones in the graveyard.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, the constant dull hum of the Reception Area fades, replaced by an eerie quiet with the only sound being that of the dry, rustling leaves. Suddenly, a desolate, silent and towering fountain comes to view.
travel_descriptions.north: Venturing north, you feel a cold touch of dread as things start to get foggy and dark. Soon, row after row of grim, stone-carved silhouettes loom before you, dotting an endless expanse - you've arrived at the Main Graveyard.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you trot on a rough beaten path, squinting your eyes against the dust that thickens the air. After a while, among the tall grass, you notice a colossal, fallen tree- lifeless, yet teeming with life within.

name: Main Street
description: main street is bleak and outdated. it wears the atmosphere of the cemetery based on association. it is dark even in sunlight and has a unique odor
