background: many members of the town protested the cemetery being so close to the main street, but they were denied, and the atmosphere reflects this

travel_descriptions.north: Walking north towards The Fountain, the sound of silence wraps around you like a blanket, the stillness only interrupted by the soft crunch of your footsteps on the gravel path.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west towards An Unfinished Mausoleum, the air grows increasingly stale and heavy. The path seems to be leading you to a place time itself has forgotten.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east towards A Cursed Grave, you feel a chill wind whip up suddenly, bringing with it a sense of foreboding that clouds your emotions.

name: Dead Tree
description: The dead tree is many, many decades old. It lies on its side, and is rotted through and through. It is blackened on its top. It is humongous. It would have been very, very tall once upon a time. It smells dank. It cannot be moved.
background: Many animals and plants use it as their home. Plants grow on its side and squirrels use it as their home. Animals hide in it. it is covered by insects. Village children come to it and tell scary stories about it. Some say it is haunted.

travel_descriptions.west: As you move west towards the Reception Area, the crunch of dead leaves underfoot reverberates eerily in the silence of the graveyard. The fog thickens and an undercurrent of whispers sends a chill down your spine.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south towards A Cursed Grave ramps up the foreboding atmosphere. The sunless path is punctuated by gnarled, outstretched tree limbs, as if longing for something lost long ago. The faint trace of turned soil hangs heavily in the air, tinged with the omen of mystery.

name: Main Graveyard
description: This is an ominous place that a thick fog envelops.  There are rows of primitive gravestones and crosses along with some angelic statues for the more wealthy.  You can hear sobs in the distance as a funeral ceremony is underway.
background: Families of lost loved ones come here to grieve and pay their respects before the dead are buried.  Sometimes, in the dead of night, thieves come to rob the dead of their jewels.

travel_descriptions.south: Heading South from the Main Graveyard takes the traveler through a well-trodden path marked by a few worn statues until the dense fog lifts, revealing the more formal, orderly Reception Area.
travel_descriptions.west: There’s an unsettling silence as one moves west from the Main Graveyard. The common tombstones begin to fade out and the grandiose Tombstones Of The Kings come into view, guarded by a small metal fence.

name: Tombstones Of The Kings
description: The tombstones of the kings are the most notable part of the graveyard. These tombstones are erected from fine marble and have piles of gold and riches lying next to them. A small metal fence surrounds this section of the graveyard, and cuts it off from the common folk.
background: The kings of the castle are revered as gods by their subjects. As a result, they demanded a special burial to suit their grand status, and this involved creating their gravestones from the finest material and decorating them with piles of fine riches. These graves were also separated from the rest of the tombstones of the common folk, and well protected by guards and a fence.

travel_descriptions.east: You walk through vast fields of gravestones towards the east, leaving behind the section belonging to the kings. The atmosphere gets denser with a mix of grief and an air of respect for the departed.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, you find yourself walking by deteriorated graves and tombstones before you reach the old, crumbling crypt. Vines draped over the entrance make the already isolating journey, even more eerie.

name: Old Crypt
description: Broken stones and a iron gate closing the entrance with a name placard that the name is worn off.
background: The Old crypt is located in the middle of the abandoned graveyard.  It's is unkempt and  crumbling around the base with the etched name worn down.  There are old dried vies that are surrounding the crypt showing that it hasn't been entered in quite some time.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling towards the south from the Old Crypt through the broken gravestones and fog, the scenery begins to open up into the vast array of the Graveyard.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving toward west, you make your way amongst the graves, until the marble statues of the Tombstones Of The Kings begin to loom in the distance, enclosed within a small, fenced area.

name: Abandoned Workers Shed
description: Moss now grows across what was once a red painted wooden shed, standing in the area just outside the graveyard. The wood shed is splintering, and there is evidence that termites have eaten away at the walls as holes poke through the shed. Inside the shed there lies leaves and plants that have been dragged in their by the wild animals that at one point called the abandoned shed their home.
background: The Abandoned workers shed used to offer a refuge to the groundskeepers who tended to the graveyard, making sure it was well maintained. Once the area around the graveyard was abandoned, the groundskeepers left the old graveyard and it began to deteriorate.

travel_descriptions.east: Moving eastwards from the derelict shed, you find yourself on a thin worn path edged by wind-blown grass, leading towards the ominous silhouette of the cemetery. As you stride among the shadows, a cold dread seeps into your bones, a chilling prelude to the eerie, silent world that awaits.

name: A Cursed Grave
description: The sun never seems to shine on this grave.  The letters on the tombstone have long since faded, and many stories are told about whose bones lay buried in the dirt.  Until recently, it was overgrown with grass and weeds.  Someone had come and cleared the weeds, and the dirt looked as if it had been turned over.
background: No one seems to know for sure who is buried in this grave, and until recently, no one really wanted to find out.  The grave may have been disturbed, but by whom?

travel_descriptions.west: The journey to Main Street from this haunted grave is preternatural as it's impossible to escape the melancholy of the cemetery, a gentle reminder of its nearness to the town.
travel_descriptions.north: Navigating your way to the Dead Tree from the grave, the atmosphere becomes tangibly heavy, as if you carry the weight of many stories untold. The once towering tree, now a lifeless monument, quickly dominates the view.

name: An Unfinished Mausoleum
description: Two-and-a-half walls of the finest, whitest stone stand here, weathered by the passing of countless seasons. There is no roof, nor sign that there ever was one. All indications are that the work was abruptly abandoned. There is no door, nor markings on the walls. Nor is there any indication that any coffin has ever lain here... yet.
background: Bright white stone was all the fad for funerary architecture, once upon a time. It's difficult to understand why someone would abandon such a large and expensive undertaking. If they didn't have the money to finish it, they could have sold the stone, surely - or the mausoleum itself. Maybe they just haven't needed it yet? A bit odd, though, given how old it is. Maybe the gravedigger remembers... if he's sober.

travel_descriptions.east: Leaving the bare, half-finished mausoleum, you find yourself walking along a barely maintained path littered with old stone chips. The cryptic ambiance of the cemetery reluctantly gives way to the dreary aura of the Main Street.

name: Beside The Town Church
description: The church is made of old stones, and it's tower sit's above the town. The stained glass clock at the top depicts scenes from the bible in many different colors. The archway leading into the church is adored in stone carvings of angels and other biblical figures.
background: The Town Church has become not only a central meeting place for the religious devout, but also a place for the town to meet and discuss news and other political issues. The priest resides within the town Church as well, and it's pews are long and vast enough to hold the citizens of the town.

travel_descriptions.east: A short walk along the paved path takes you towards the church entrance. The creaking sound of the massive wooden doors standing guard at the entrance can be heard, adding a touch of mystique to your journey. The air gradually becomes rich with the smell of incense as you approach closer.

name: Beside Church Entrance
description: Ornate stonework covers the building. A towering arch of marble and silver line the entrance, giving the church a most grand appearance. Holy idols gaze upon the entrance, as  they flank the walkway to entrance side by side.
background: The church entrance looks grand, but not too excessive - as the king's architect wanted it to be. Many flock down the walkway to the entrance every Sunday for the weekly ritual. This is the only entrance to the church.

travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward, you approach the strains of chorus and faint smell of incense. It is calming as you near The Town Church.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, you notice the atmosphere becoming stiller. The path overgrown and untrodden, leads to the sacred, deserted Church Entrance.

name: Entrance To Church
description: The entrance to the church can only be described as a bit scary.  It is overgrown with mosses and weeds.  It has not been taken care of and is a mixture of wood and stone.  It is dirty, and things live here.
background: This was the church that the King attended with his family when they were alive.  They all died under mysterious circumstances and are all now buried in the cemetery.  But now no one comes into this church, it is considered sacred ground.  And there are things that live here, things that are different.

travel_descriptions.south: Exiting the entrance, you cautiously tread upon the trampled path towards the south. The haunting atmosphere following your trail.
travel_descriptions.inside: Steeled for the impending dread, you approach the wooden doors, your heart pounding in your chest as you push them open and venture inside the church.
travel_descriptions.east: Taking the path to the right, you near the iron gate. The cold, eerie silence is only shattered by its anguished squeals as you push through it to the street.

name: Church
description: Rows of headstones line the field beside the large ornate church with stained glass windows. The Church is mid-century and made of stone. A large steeple resides in the center adorned with a cross. Large front doors made of wood with iron handles. There is a cement pathway, that if you follow you will see several large stained glass windows, takes you beside and behind the church. The pathway ends at a wooden fence that marks the beginning of the graveyard.
background: The church has been around for over 100 years. It is old and has rich history. There are many headstones present in the cemetery. The church holds services on Wednesdays and Sundays, has celebrations (such as weddings and baptisms), and offers funeral services.

travel_descriptions.outside: Walking towards the entrance of the church is a dimly lit path, surrounded by wild foliage that lends an eerie atmosphere.
travel_descriptions.west: Traveling westwards, one encounters the beautifully ornated Iconostasis, a journey immersed in peaceful silence and spiritual contemplation.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north encompasses ascending the worn-out steps leading to the enormous and daunting church entrance door, echoing centuries of history and reverence in each step.

name: Gate To Street
description: The street outside the church is empty, with not a soul in sight. The sky is gray and seems to threaten snow. The pavement is rutted and worn, littered with loose cobblestones and other signs of disuses and disrepair. The only sound is the cold wind blowing, and the awful metallic squeak as it blows the iron gate open and shut.
background: The street running outside the abandoned church. Empty and devoid of activity.

travel_descriptions.west: As you approach the Entrance to the Church, the wind howls solemnly, pulling at your clothes. The eerie creaking of the neglected iron gate is unsettling. The once vibrant path is now overgrown with mosses, and strewn with fallen leaves. You have a sense of treading on sacred, abandoned ground.

name: Enormous Church Entrance Door
description: The door stands twenty feet tall. It is made of metal with a large knocker at eye level. There is a small sliding window covered with metal so that people inside can slide it and see who is knocking. The door has three large rectangles made of rivets, one high, one in the middle, and one low.
background: This church has stood for over five hundred years. Many people have knocked on its doors looking for protection or service. It is commanding, yet welcoming.

travel_descriptions.south: Stepping through the immense door, you walk along an old stone path lined with statues, arriving at the scenic mid-century Church with beautiful stained glass windows.
travel_descriptions.outside: Back outside, you follow the winding path through the lush grass, leading you to the peaceful solitude of the Graveyard with its simple wooden crosses and poignant tokens of remembrance.

name: Graveyard
description: A large grassy section of field with headstones and primitive wooden crosses.  Flowers adorn some of the graves from loved ones.  Wooden fences enclose the area.
background: This is an area where loved ones bury their dearly departed.  There are also ceremonies held here as well to commemorate different events.

travel_descriptions.inside: As you approach the enormous church door, you feel a sense of awe for its grandeur and the history it holds. The rustic metal knocker seems to beckon, ready to announce your arrival.
travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, you encounter the serene tranquility of the church garden. Sweet-smelling flowers, ripe fruits and vegetables come into view as you wander along the path, inviting you to explore further.

name: Church Garden
description: The church garden is filled with a variety of useful plants. There are many flowering plants. There is a lot of food grown in the garden. There are carrots, tomatoes, strawberries and a variety of other fruits and vegetables. Fruit-bearing trees provide shade for the garden. The plants are arranged in neat rows. It smells sweet with the flowers. Different colored sticks show the different plants.
background: Many villagers benefit from the produce of the church garden. The fruits and vegetables are used to feed the poor and the hungry. Many people would starve if they did not get the produce from the church garden. They are used for celebrations such as weddings as well. The flowers are used in ceremonies.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking towards the east, you leave the freshness of the garden behind, sensing a somber shift in the air as you approach the solemn silence of the graveyard.
travel_descriptions.inside: As you step from the brightness of the garden into the grandeur of the Church, the stained-glass windows paint a rainbow of colors on the stone floor.
travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the calmness of the garden, the tranquility is replaced by an austere atmosphere, marking your arrival at the perimeter of the Church of Monks.

name: Iconostasis
description: Iconostasis is a small stand with icons right outside the church. It has 5 different handmade icons. The stand is decorated with golden roses and white linen
background: This stand was made by an old priest Nicolas. He spent 5 years creating the iconostasis and he ordered the icons from another kingdom.

travel_descriptions.east: As you walk towards the church from the Iconostasis, you pass through a serene setting, filled with rows of headstones, highlighting the long history of the area. As you get closer, you observe the mid-century architecture of the church, its large windows adorned with stained glass, all leading up to the large wooden door with iron handles.

name: Church Garden
description: The church gardens have many paths that meander through trees and plants. There are beautiful flowers blooming and the grass and shrubs are immaculately maintained. There are benches to rest and think, and religious statues throughout.
background: The priests often walk and contemplate for hours in the gardens. The queen can often be spotted walking and thinking. The king almost never visits the gardens, as he is allergic to bee stings.

travel_descriptions.east: A serene walk past colorful flowers, under the shade of tall trees, brings you to the solemn tranquility of the Church's Graveyard.
travel_descriptions.inside: Ascending the gothic stone steps and passing through the ornate wooden doors, you enter the hallowed halls of the Church.
travel_descriptions.south: Leaving the comforting presence of the Church Garden, you move towards the spartan exterior of the Church Of Monks.

name: Outside The Church Of Monks
description: the outside of the church of monks looks like it was made from live standing trees.  there are a few windows scattered throughout.  there is a long narrow door in the middle.
background: the monks are not allowed to talk to anyone, so they have built the outside of their church to be as uninviting as possible.

travel_descriptions.north: Travelling north, the harsh austerity of the church gives way to the tranquillity of the Church Garden. Paths brimming with lush greenery lead you towards floral scents that whisper tales of serenity.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, the scenery transitions abruptly. The peaceful quiet is replaced by a severe solemnity as you approach The Whipping Station, a reminder of harsh realities.

name: The Whipping Station
description: the whipping station is just a large wooden platform that serves to embarrass the peasant villagers that sin, they also hang adulterers and homosexuals.
background: the whipping station is used by corrupt priests that allow anyone to be hung who does not follow the old king's law

travel_descriptions.east: The travel to the Church of Monks takes you through a dense, eerie forest. The silence is deafening, barring the rustling leaves that hint at unseen wildlife.
travel_descriptions.north: The path to the Outside Church is a desolate one, filled with overgrown weeds and thorny bushes. A chilling wind accompanies you as you navigate this forgotten path.

name: Outside Church
description: A cold wind blows through the small decrepit graveyard in front of the church. Shutters and other loose neglected ad to the mood of death and decay.
background: The former church of royalty. Long abandoned after the fall of the empire. Forgotten and forlorn.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south, you approach a harsh scene of a raised, old wooden platform, where the air hangs heavy with a mournful energy.
travel_descriptions.west: Venturing west, you find yourself amidst a serene environment of sprawling grass and beautiful flowers orchestrated around the quaint setup of wooden benches.

name: Church Field
description: Sprawling grass is adorned with simple yet pretty flowers here. Wooden benches are organized into small rows. There's a roof covering the benches and pastors table. A white wooden fence encloses the area.
background: This is used for special occasions like a wedding. It is also used for baptism and summer services.

travel_descriptions.east: A cold wind blows through the small decrepit graveyard in front of the church. Shutters and other loose neglected ad to the mood of death and decay. The former church of royalty. Long abandoned after the fall of the empire. Forgotten and forlorn.

name: Palace Ballroom
description: A grand room with a marble floor. The ballroom can fit over 5,000 people. Its ceilings are high, vaulted, and adorned with many exquisite murals. Stained glass windows surround the entire room.
background: The ballroom was built recently after the King's triumph over his wealthy northern neighbors. He used the funds to build the boisterous ballroom. The King holds many grand parties in the ballroom. All that enter the room never forget what it looks like.

travel_descriptions.north: As you leave the ballroom, you feel the air turn regal as you navigate the corridors flanked by vibrant tapestries that lead to the Throne Room.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving towards the east, you pass through a series of arched doorways. The sounds of festivities behind you transform into a deep silence as you approach the Main Hallway.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west from the ballroom, your senses are welcomed by the tempting aroma of the delicious meals being prepared within the Palace Kitchen.
travel_descriptions.outside: Exiting the opulence of the ballroom, you venture through a series of grand doorways, each one presenting a picturesque view of the Castle Front.

name: Servant'S Quarters
description: It's spare and humble.  A small cookpot sits over a fire, and a few books sit on a shelf.  A candle sits in the middle of a table where there are a few plates and silverware set out in preparation for people to eat.
background: The servants' quarters were an afterthought, for the most part.  After all of the opulence that went into building the Castle itself, someone finally asked, "but where will the servants live?"  As it was, their quarters were tacked onto the side of the castle, out of view.

travel_descriptions.south: The transition to the Castle Kitchens feels warm and inviting, with the smell of food wafting through the air.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending into the dungeon, the temperature drops sharply, with an eerie stillness overtaking the air.
travel_descriptions.outside: Moving towards the Castle Front, the grandeur and opulence of the palace comes into full view.

name: The  Main Hall
description: Long hallway with high ceilings, long windows, and a very intricate designed ceiling.
background: The main hall is the first thing you see walking into the castle. It is both breathtaking and beautiful.

name: Queen'S Quarters
description: This room is luxurious. It is lined with the finest golds and silks. The colors are purple and pink and a variety of drapes cover the walls.
background: The queen built the room herself, with a team of architects. The luxury and style has made it incredibly popular even among the servants and king, himself.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking east, you delicately tread on the fine rugs, passing through an ornate, golden archway to enter the Queen's Bedchamber.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving west, you pass through a large door inlaid with polished gems, stepping into the Princess' Library, a haven of knowledge.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you descend an impressive staircase with marble steps, leading into the grandeur of the Main Hallway.

name: Personal Rooms
description: There is a comfortable, but not ornate bed against the wall in the center of the room. There is a dresser and a mirror against the opposite wall. There are various paintings hung throughout the room of landscapes and past kings and queens. There is a fireplace on the east wall with a bearskin rug on the floor in front of it, and two chairs to sit in.
background: The personal room is used for guests to stay in while they visit the palace. The king and queen and the royal family stay in a different wing of the palace.

travel_descriptions.west: Moving away from the comfort of personal rooms, you find yourself heading west, towards the enigmatic Personal Quarters, where the echoes of regal inhabitant's footsteps are heard along the decorated walls.
travel_descriptions.down: You descend, leaving the invite-only zone of the Personal Rooms, and head towards the king's exclusive Bed Chambers. The path is lined with extravagant artwork and regal drapery, hinting at the luxurious opulence awaiting below.
travel_descriptions.outside: Leaving the secluded royal domesticities and heading outside, you are greeted by a breath of fresh air. You tread towards the spectacular palace Balcony, feeling the cool marble beneath your feet as you anticipate the panoramic city views ahead.

name: Kings Chambers
description: The large four poster bed is adorned with the finest linens that Europe has to offer.  Gold is liberally woven through the fabric of the duvet and the tassels that drape to the floor on each corner of the duvet.  A gauzy purple fabric hanging from the bed posts sets an opaque tone to the room.  One window is shuttered by large wooden planks that can be thrown open to allow the mid day light to illuminate the room.  A large chest of drawers holds a small portion of the King's clothing.
background: This room was designed by a team of the finest decorators in the kingdom, but it has been nicknamed the bloodbath, because the king put to death 3 designers for "not meeting the standard set forth".  The fourth designer, a young upstart, is now the most famous in the land because of his work on this one room.  The king feels most powerful when he is in this room.

travel_descriptions.east: You pass through a set of grand double doors, heading into the lavish master bedroom.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, you traverse a marbled hallway that leads to the bustling royal kitchen.
travel_descriptions.south: Stepping southwards, you journey down a grand staircase into the warm glow of the dining hall.
travel_descriptions.up: As you ascend a grand staircase, you find yourself reaching the dust-laden, treasure-filled top floor of the palace.

name: Castle Front
description: Just inside the palace there is a lengthy hallway leading from the castle front.  The space is adorned with giant tapestries on the wall depicting scenes of knights performing heroic deeds.  One the floor is long plush runner carpet in a deep red color and adorned with gold trim.
background: Entering the front of the palace is the way honored guests are received.

travel_descriptions.inside: Walking through the huge archway into the King's Palace, one is greeted by the shine of countless gold ornaments and decorations. The journey is marked by the soft rustle of clothes against the plush carpets and a sense of awe at the sheer grandeur of the palace.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending towards the Grand Balcony is a sensory delight. The stairs spiral upwards, wrapping around a magnificent central pillar. As one climbs, the views of the surrounding kingdom come into sight and the air grows cooler, bearing the sweet scent of the botanical garden below.

name: Top Floor Of Palace
description: Opening the large stonework doors at the top of the grand staircase reveals the prized artifacts stored within the top floor of the palace. Inside are trinkets and baubles from far off lands, souvenirs from expeditions traversing across the entire realm. Large animal hides, beautiful tapestries, intricate statues of mythical animals, and other treasures hang upon thick oaken scaffolds. A thick coat of dust covers much of the treasure, suggesting a long absence of human contact or disruption.
background: The owner of the palace cherished his wife more than anything in the world, and these artifacts stored in the top floor of the palace were a testament to his love. He sent his emissaries far and wide to collect them, hoping to find something as beautiful as she was, something to prove his love to her.  He would take her to the top floor and show her his collection, having her help pick out which ones to display in the main ballroom for grand festivals. When her infidelity came to light, the owner of the manor stored them all up, and now cannot stand the sight of the treasures, for they remind him of his lost love.

travel_descriptions.down: The journey from the top floor to the King's Chambers involves descending an ornate marble staircase lined with finely crafted statues.
travel_descriptions.inside: Entering the Attic, a rich scent of old books and timber fill your senses as you voyage through an intimate, dimly lit hallway.
travel_descriptions.outside: Moving outside to the Balcony, it's a breath of fresh air as you pass through grand doors onto a space overlooking the expansive palace grounds and the city beyond.

name: Palace Throne
description: A golden throne be-speckled with many precious stones. It glints in every eye that falls upon it. It is 20 ft tall and 5 ft wide. Swords from enemies of the king line the back of the chair.
background: The throne of the king was a gift from the king's brother, that was a renowned goldsmith. Many visitors marvel at its beauty. It is somewhat wide, but that is to accommodate the king's enormous girth, for he is quite fat. The king rarely sits there because he is afraid he wouldn't be able to get up.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west, you walk through a high, arched doorway, brilliantly adorned with intricate gold patterns, into the dazzling opulence of the Throne room.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you move through a wide corridor lined with grand tapestries and statues, ending in the elaborately decorated entrance of the Palace Ballroom.

name: Inside The Unicorn Palace
description: The unicorn palace is so beautiful! It is covered in pastel colors, and wherever you look they form a rainbow.  The floor is made of special glittering grass that the unicorns feed on.
background: The unicorn palace was built by the king to give them a place to come and restore their magic powers.  When they eat the grass, it replenishes their magical powers.

travel_descriptions.south: Transition from the enchanting, colourful surroundings of the Unicorn Palace to the grandeur of the Palace Entrance is an awe-inducing journey. As you move, the pastel colours turn to gold, and the soft rustling of magical grass gives way to the echoes of majestic halls.

name: The Queen'S Chamber
description: This is a beautiful room inside of the palace that is decorated with the finest silk and velvet. The color scheme used represents royalty, royal blue, red, green and purple. The walls are covered in gold and in each corner of the room are golden statues of Greek art. The floors are covered in marble, and despite the patterns, shine so brightly you can even see your own reflection in them! There's also a bed big enough to fit five people on!
background: This room inside the palace is the Queen's bed chambers. In this very room lived the previous queens of other eras and where the future heir to the throne was born. It's said in these chambers the Queen performs rituals unknown to anyone outside of the palace to keep her young and immortal. Only royalty and royal servants know the secrets of this place.

travel_descriptions.west: Stepping out from the Queen's lavish chambers, you traverse a broad marble corridor filled with fine art and opulent décor, leading towards the Queen's quarters.

name: The Throne
description: Very luxurious, with details of 12 carat gold and diamonds with a very comfortable cushion where the king usually take a break
background: A very large painting of the king with his family where his wife and children appear. with the frame in gold details.

travel_descriptions.east: It's a brief journey towards the east, across the lavish red carpet and through a grand archway, where the dazzling sight of the Palace Throne takes your breath away.
travel_descriptions.south: Walking south, you move away from the grandeur of the throne, transitioning from the royal opulence to the functional and strict decor of the Throne Room.

name: Palace Kitchen
description: A lavish kitchen where the aroma of food can be smelled from miles away. Hundreds of servants and cooks weave and jostle about as they prepare for the next meal of the day. The meal they are cooking smells divine.
background: The kitchen was established when the palace was built, but steadily added on to after each victory the kingdom claimed. Many speak of the divine meals that come out of the kitchen, but few have tried them.

travel_descriptions.east: Walking towards the east, the scent of food fades and the echo of music and laughter grows louder. The corridor is lavishly decorated, and the marble floor echoes your footsteps - a clear indication of the grandeur that awaits in the Palace Ballroom.
travel_descriptions.north: Heading north, you feel a rush of hot air as you push open the large, heavy door. The loud clang of pots and pans along with the sizzle of frying food drowns out the noise from the Palace. The metallic smell of copper fills the air - you've entered the Royal Kitchen, where meals fit for a king are created.

name: The Grand Dining Room
description: The grand dining room has a gold plated dome in the ceiling with mosaic pieces creating an intricate art form. There are five chandeliers made of china hung from the ceiling and a hand carved 30 person kings dining table in the center of the room with a hand woven rug underneath it.
background: This is the room where all meals are eaten by the king and the queen and their family and staff. There are 3 servants who cater to the room, bringing all meals. Also this is where meetings are held when guests are invited to the palace.

travel_descriptions.south: A short stroll through the royal kitchens leads from the Grand Dining Room to the grandeur of the Dining Hall.
travel_descriptions.east: A grand arched doorway connects the plush decadence of the Dining Room to the lively festivities of the Grand Dancing Hall.

name: Hidden Revolutionaries' Headquarters
description: Inside the revolutionaries' headquarters, you will find a map of the castle and the surrounding town.  Also, you will find a long list of grievances against the King, both by his subjects and the Queen herself.  In addition, there are crates full of weapons and armor, as well as a small vial of poison.
background: This room is used by the Queen and her lover, the Duke of Nottingham, to plot the downfall of the King  They plan to poison the King, who is an evil tyrant, and use the arms and armor to round up and dispatch, if necessary, the members of his inner circle.  Then they plan to announce the Queen as the ruler and the Duke as the long lost King's brother who had been targeted for assassination by the King.  However, the Duke survived, but the King married his grieving fiance.

travel_descriptions.outside: As you cautiously traverse the decaying, untouched chambers of the palace, you find yourself descending into a forbidding gloom. You're heading towards the dungeon, where tales of lost souls sent shivers down every palace dweller's spine.
travel_descriptions.up: Climbing the worn-out, creaky steps, you ascend from the ceaseless plotting towards a semblance of tranquility. You're heading up to the attic, which, unlike the rest of the palace, held not the machinations of insurgents but countless stories couched within aging books.
travel_descriptions.inside: Walking from the dark, secretive headquarters into the main body of the palace feels like embracing a world entirely different. You're entering the ethereal domain of the unicorns, the heart of the palace that resonates with a harmonious, enchanting aura.

name: The Throne Room
description: The throne room features a large Bronze throne surrounded by Iron statue of guardsmen. These guardsmen are crafted to each bare a unique appearance. Below the king's throne there is a silk red carpet pathway that leads to the front gate. The front gate is protected by two armed men who cross swords at the foot of the gate.
background: This provides the main area for the King to meet with diplomats and serve orders to his army. It is not to be accessed by the towns folk and only those close to the king are allowed entry into this heavily guarded area.

travel_descriptions.north: You walk along a pathway of polished marble, your footsteps echoing in the grand hall, towards the impressive reign of the monarch.
travel_descriptions.west: Navigating through a series of ornamental archways, you feel a calm serenity as you approach the feminine aura of the Queen's Quarters.
travel_descriptions.east: A regal flare guides you through gold-lined corridors as you head towards the symbol of ultimate authority - the Palace Throne.

name: Queen'S Bedchamber
description: The chamber is fit for royalty. A four-poster beds with a plush mattress adorns the room. A chifforobe of immense value is placed in the room, as is a bell for summoning a horde of servants.
background: This is the Queen's bedroom, where she spends many lonely nights while her husband, the King Consort, has his affairs in another part of the castle.

travel_descriptions.west: Traveling west leads you through a series of luxurious antechambers, each more extravagant than the last, until you reach the Queen's Quarters.
travel_descriptions.down: To reach the Main Hallway, you descend a grand, sweeping staircase adorned with priceless paintings and ornate chandeliers, as suits of armor stand sentinel along your path.
travel_descriptions.outside: Venturing outside, you follow a narrow path edged with blooming rosebushes, leading to the Balcony. From here, you get a breathtaking view of the sprawling kingdom beyond.

name: Princess' Library
description: Warm and well lit, this room is equal parts windows and bookshelves. Overflowing with books, maps, parchment, and other odds and ends the shelves sag slightly from the weight. The lush maroon carpet complements the dark oak wood paneled walls, which are lined with rich tapestries.
background: The Princess was gifted this library for her 16th birthday. She longed to travel and see the world, but will be limited as she is the only heir to the throne. Sensing her longing for more, her kindly father, the King, bestowed upon her the gift of knowledge and escapism.

travel_descriptions.east: You walk through a small archway, along a narrow, lavishly decorated hallway lined with portraits of past queens, leading to the Queen'S Quarters.
travel_descriptions.outside: You traverse a long winding corridor with tall stained glass windows revealing grand vistas, finally opening up to the refreshing openness of the Grand Balcony.

name: The Ball Room
description: Large and extravagant, the room is adorned with crystals, polished gold and sapphires. There's long tables with beautiful silk table clothes covering them. Plush chairs line the tables. In front of each table is plates made from fine China, next to the plates is sterling silver silverware laid upon a pure white napkin. There's a stage where there's 2 thrones overlooking the table. The whole ceiling is large and adorned with chandeliers and garnished with gold accents.
background: This room is where many formals take place. It was built for the king many years ago by the finest of craftsmen. It is used to host many formal dinners, dances, and concerts.

travel_descriptions.north: As you move north from the ballroom, you see a grand staircase leading to the palace entrance, where guards are continuously on their vigil. The grandeur of the palace is awe-inspiring, and the feeling of being a part of this regal life is inevitable.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, the grand carpet of the main hallway sprawls out before you, leading towards a colonnade lined with statues and adorned with beautiful paintings, once again underlining the sheer opulence of this kingdom and its rulers.
travel_descriptions.east: Moving east, you can hear the faint sound of melodious music. As you get closer, the Grand Dancing Hall unveils itself, the music crescendoing, dancers twirling around in beautiful costumes, and the decor only getting more resplendent.

name: Main Hallway
description: This area is decorated with suits of armor, elaborate carpet pieces, and tapestries.  There's large, detailed paintings adorning the walls of past rulers.
background: This is an area where a visitor can get a glimpse of the history of those who rule here.  It's meant to stun and impress those who enter.

travel_descriptions.north: Moving north from the Main Hallway, you venture towards the Queen's Quarters, passing through a corridor richly adorned with royal portraiture.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east to The Ball Room, you traverse a splendid arcade, soaking in the soft music and muted conversation drifting from behind heavy, gold-stitched drapes.
travel_descriptions.west: A step to the west leads you towards the immense Palace Ballroom, through large gilded doors flanked by elegantly dressed valets.

name: Palace Entrance
description: The palace entrance is majestic and well built. There are beautiful decorations from all over the world from the greatest artists. It is mostly gold and pretty colors.
background: The king decorated the palace entrance himself. He loves gold and the power it shows.

travel_descriptions.inside: As you step beyond the grand columns of the palace entrance, the ethereal beauty of The Unicorn Palace unfurls itself before you, with a dining of colors akin to a waking dream.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending towards the Grand Balcony, you experience a palpable change in the atmosphere as if the air is imbibed with majesty and grandeur, each step echoing with silent whispers of regal intrigues.

name: Bedrooms
description: this bedroom is for the young prince. it is blue in color and the floors are a royal purple. the walls are covered in display swords and shields, all painted with unique colors.
background: this room has been the stomping grounds of many kings and royal family, it is spotless because of the butlers and maids, and is rarely ever used except for sleep.

travel_descriptions.south: Walking southward from the prince's bedroom, one descends into the playful ambiance of the palace nursery, awash with the heartening laughter of young royals.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the prince's bedroom, you are guided by the radiating opulence of the palace towards the monarch's grand bed chambers.
travel_descriptions.east: A short eastern walk from the prince's bedroom brings a grandeur unparalleled, the entrance to the master bedroom looming gracefully.

name: Grand Balcony
description: The grand balcony is off from the ballroom and overlooks the kingdom. It is very large, with magnificent iron railing that runs around the balcony. The railing has been created by a master craftsman, with details of majestic creatures running along the railing, as the King felt this would make it stand out from other castles. There are dragons, eagles and lion heads that stand out to those that look upon it from below. The floor is made from a granite that was found in the surrounding forest's river. There are two ornate gold chairs for the King and Queen when they are sitting on the balcony. Small tables of gold are scattered about, for use and decoration.
background: The grand balcony is where the King goes when he needs to think. He goes there to think over war strategies (if the need arises), how to deal with issues of his people, if the Queen is angry with him, or any other problems. The King is particularly proud of the design of the balcony, as it is like no other. He hand-picked the creatures that graced the railing, and it feels a part of him was put into as it was designed. He can look over his lands, as well as any approaching enemies could be seen for miles. Only a few select are allowed on the Grand Balcony, his Queen, some close alliances, and close family.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the grand balcony, you traverse through a grand stairway adorned with golden statues of previous rulers, reaching the splendidly decorated palace entrance.
travel_descriptions.inside: Walking through the ornately decorated archway, you enter into the Princess' Library, a haven filled with richly-bound books and a warm inviting ambience.
travel_descriptions.outside: Exiting through the large carved doors of the palace, you make your way to the top floor of the palace, where an extensive collection of the realm's treasures awaits.

name: The Bedding Room
description: silks everywhere alongside a huge bed that fit twenty people, the bed was red and yellow silks full of women. There was gold cups everywhere filled with red wine.
background: the bedding room was used as tradition for the royal family to hold meetings there.

travel_descriptions.up: As you ascend from the bedding room, you are met with royal blue and purple hues of the prince's bedroom, lined with display swords and shields that tell tales of past generations.
travel_descriptions.east: Traveling eastward, you leave behind the vibrancy of the bedding room, approaching the master bedroom. The change in atmosphere is palpable, with an aura of sophistication and extravagance.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving westward, the decadence of the bedding room gives way to the sovereign elegance of the bed chambers. You can sense the precision and effort that went into creating this sacred place for rest.

name: King'S Bedroom
description: The more-than-king-sized bed is the dominating feature of this room.  It has four tall posters, draped in the most royal blue canopy that you could imagine.  The inner curtains of the canopy are made of the finest silk his artisans could get their hands on.  Next to the bed is a lavish desk piled high with books.  On the other side of the room is a fireplace and a chair, and yet another pile of books.  [The King is an avid, AVID reader.]
background: After having to deal with the public for the better part of the day, the King comes to relax in his room where he has the chance to go over personal correspondence, eat his meals either with or without the Queen, and engage in some reading for learning or for fun.

travel_descriptions.east: Moving east from the King's Bedroom takes you through a short but elegantly decorated corridor, the floor softly muffled with lush carpeting, leading to the vivid colors and vibrant energy of The Bedding Room.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, you traverse a long, grand walkway adorned with portraits of past kings and queens, filled with a stern, regal air that gives way to the mystical allure of the King's Chambers.

name: The Dungeon
description: The dungeon is in the very most bottom room of the Palace. Many have gone down to the dungeon through the trap doors inside the palace and have never returned. Walls are covered with spider webs and bones from previous challengers to the throne. The brick dungeon is dark and mysterious.
background: The dungeon was created to keep prisoners and challengers to the thrones for periods of time. The royalty felt it was less expensive to leave them there without eating and meet their fate down there. As time went on, more and more people were lost to the dungeon and it began to be darker and darker.

travel_descriptions.up: Ascending from the dungeon, you briefly pass through the dimly-lit castle hallways. The light slowly increases as you reach the service quarters, with gentle chatter filling the air.
travel_descriptions.inside: Moving deeper into the dungeon, past the dilapidated cells and rusted chains, an almost invisible door leads you to the revolutionaries' headquarters. The air is thick with tension and whispers of rebellion.

name: Landing In The Foyer
description: The landing is almost obnoxiously opulent. It has an expansive marble floor and walls, and the giant staircases on either side have marble steps and railings made of the rarest wood. Purple silk, dyed in the king's personal color is draped across the railings and hangs from the walls. The silk drapings frame oil paintings of the king and his family, and of the king's accomplishments at war as a youth. The artist has signed each one, and is extremely famous. A magnificent gold and crystal chandelier hangs from the ceiling with hundreds of small candles burning in it. All other fixtures in the room are also bright gold.
background: The landing is the first room any entrant to castle sees. It is meant to show off the extreme wealth and success of the king. It is constantly being updated and renovated to keep up with the latest trends and maintain an appearance of superiority. It is one of the most expensive rooms in the castle.

travel_descriptions.down: Descending the grand staircase, you pass numerous opulent paintings before stepping onto the plush carpet of the Foyer, the favorite place of the queen.
travel_descriptions.outside: Exiting through the grand doors, you find yourself crossing the magnificent Palace Entrance, decorated with gold and filled with the aura of power and authority.

name: Attic
description: The room at the top of the stairs is a lot larger then you might imagine. It's a fully engaged library that only the king uses, for the most part. The queen does have access but is less inclined to read. Dark wood shelves cover all the walls not engaged by a door or window, of which there is only one each. Even the wall above the door as you enter is a shelf full of books of all sorts. The smell of paper and some mold (they are rather old books) permeates the air. A large overstuffed settee is faced by a short table and across from that are two matching chair. All are brown in color and look to be extremely comfortable. The walls were once stone grey in color but the shelves totally cover them. The floor is covered in a lush, brownish rug that looks and feels more like fur. There are books piled on the floor by the chair and the short table is covered with them as well. Under the window at the far end of the room is a huge desk that is covered with papers and a few books. A candle holder sets on one corner with a partially melted candle still in it.
background: The library is where the king mainly likes to do his book keeping as it were. Here he can relax fully since no one comes here other then himself or the queen. He has also planned attack strategies here and often defense of the castle itself.

travel_descriptions.down: You step out of the King's personal library, descending a grand spiral staircase. The sound and feeling of your shoes clicking against the stone echoes through the vast palatial chamber, teeming with art and beauty.
travel_descriptions.inside: Behind a concealed door marked with the royal emblem lies a hidden path. Narrow, dimly lit and imposing, the path is a stark contrast to the castle's regality. Crawling through, the air gets progressively cooler as you approach the base of operations of the revolutionary's headquarters.

name: Grand Dancing Hall
description: The grand dancing hall is the most ornate location in the entire castle! Velvet seats run along the side of the room. There are huge chandeliers with hundreds of candles all along the ceiling. There are colorful paintings on every wall that show the different kings and their families.
background: The dancing room is used for happy and joyous occasions. The king had his wedding in he room, and the festivities lasted for twelve days! Every week, there are different parties celebrating every holiday, wedding and just because. The people wear gorgeous gowns and finery and dance to a huge band.

travel_descriptions.west: As you leave the Grand Dancing Hall, the festive music slowly fades, replaced by the soft, distant tinkling of fine china and cutlery as you approach The Grand Dining Room.
travel_descriptions.east: Exiting the Grand Dancing Hall, the echo of laughter and music lingers in your ears as the grandiose aura of the Ball Room begins to unfold, beckoning you with an ambiance of fine elegance.

name: Bed Chambers
description: With excessive luxury all around. In the center a big bed with a wooden frame and chairs made out of different materials collected around the realm. The Bed chambers have many ornaments and the bed has lamps to the sides.
background: The king is proud about the bed chambers. It took the work of many men to complete it as it has many details worthy of a real king. The bed chambers are the most beautiful place of the palace.

travel_descriptions.west: Walking towards the west, the opulence starts to fade giving way to the predominant red and yellow silks enveloping a bed big enough for twenty people - you're in the Bedding Room.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending up, you move away from the royal hedonism below into the simpler comforts and quietness of the Personal Rooms.
travel_descriptions.inside: Stepping inside, you're overwhelmed by an ambience of unmatched luxury - the Master Bedroom is indeed a realm in its own.

name: Castle Kitchens
description: A large room, with pots, pans, serving platters and utensils. Shelves and hooks hanging from the wall hold the implements of the cook's craft. Several wooden counters, as well as a center island are situated around the room. A small table with two chairs is located in one corner. A large fireplace is the central point of focus, with great iron pots resting nearby. The mantel holds several more cooking utensils and the ledge of the fireplace hosts food, currently being warmed.
background: The central location for the life of the serving staff, the Kitchen is bustling with action throughout the day and well into the night. The head cook and his helpers interact with everyone working in the castle and hear all of the gossip, currently making the rounds. Farmers, hunters and others, peddling wares and food find themselves in the always warm confines of the kitchen, often staying for a while to visit and trade the the most recent stories and news.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking north from the castle kitchens, you pass through a narrow corridor, the blare and heat of the kitchen slowly fading into a quiet, cooler area of the castle.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east, you leave the busy Castle Kitchen behind and step into the even busier Palace Kitchen. The aroma of a hundred different dishes fills the air, and the sizzle and crackle of cooking echo through the hallway.

name: Royal Kitchen
description: Made of the finest of silvers this kitchen is known as the best in the land of Fulmer. The king Fulmer demanded the entire interior palace be decorated in this silver from nearby Landon and with their many mines. Wouldn't you know though, the oven, pots, pans and other kitchen specialties are all made of copper! Worn, chiseled, and beaten from use in the prison from neighboring Zinzel in the kingdom of Palemon. Budgetary demands forced them to cut costs and they have been using these utensils and dishes ever since the palace opened.
background: King Fulmer made this place through war. War with Zinzel, war with Ulma, war with Hunber. He sacked all their lands to the north, and south to create a bastion of his glory right in the center of the Yumerian continent. Despised by many, he has grown a reputation amongst other nations as a warmonger. His own people be-love, and adore him though.

travel_descriptions.south: You leave the gleaming, bustling epicenter of the castle's culinary magic, the aroma of roasting meats and baking breads slowly fading as you head towards the Palace Kitchen.
travel_descriptions.west: As you move from the lively realm of the Royal Kitchen, the clangs of cookware and chatters of the chefs gradually diminish, giving way to the quiet anticipation of the intimate solitude of the King's Chambers.

name: Dining Hall
description: Long, wooden tables line both walls of the massive dining hall. There is also an ornately carved head table at the front of the room. Benches sit in front of the tables to seat everyone. Massive, golden chandeliers hang from the ceiling. Colorful stained glass windows shed vast arrays of light onto the floor and walls.
background: The dining hall is one of the most used spaces in the entire palace. Everyone loves to spend copious amounts of time eating, drinking, and being merry. The stained glass windows are always one of the largest topics of discussion. The dining hall makes everyone feel like a family in the palace.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking north from the dining hall, you pass beneath an electric chandelier and intricate tapestries that beautify the high-ceilinged corridor leading to the Grand Dining Room.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west from the dining hall takes you through a smaller, dimly lit corridor adorned with portraits of the past kings. The air is heavy with history as you approach the king's private chambers.

name: Personal Quarters
description: An ornate room, paintings of previous rulers and members of the family hang on the walls.  There's high end pieces of furniture in the room along with books, statues, and expensive pieces of jewelry.
background: This is where the inhabitants of the palace come to rest, write, and do other personal activities.  Treasure is also stored here in hidden places only known to members of the royal family.

travel_descriptions.east: Passing through an ornate archway, the journey to the personal rooms is tranquil, filled with the scent of fresh lilies.
travel_descriptions.outside: Travelling from the quarters to the balcony outside is like a miniature adventure, with the stone corridors offering a glimpse of the palace's grandeur before the great outdoors greet you.

name: Foyer
description: It is a grand room, with two ornate staircases leading up either side to a second floor balcony where there is a doorway at the very center.  Other doorways occupy the sides of the second floor landing.
background: The Queen's favorite place in the castle, besides her Throne Room.  She hung all of her favorite paintings here for guests to mill about and admire while awaiting their audience with her.

travel_descriptions.south: Traveling south from the Foyer, you pass through an elaborate portcullis, moving from the cool grandeur of the castle into the ostentatious display of wealth in the Landing in the Foyer.
travel_descriptions.inside: Walking further inside from the Foyer, you transition from an open, majestic area to the Palace Entrance, every detail of which breathes of the king's fondness for gold and power.

name: Nursery
description: The nursery is a room dedicated to the care of the young children living in the palace. The ceilings are decorated with a painting of cherubic angel babies playing in clouds. There are luxurious baby bassinets, rocking chairs with cushions, fireplaces to keep the place warm and many toys all over the place. Windows framed in simple drapes offer views of the gardens outside.
background: The nursery was designed by the queen. All of the children of the castle have spent time being nurtured and raised in the room. Nurses take care of the children here.

travel_descriptions.north: Exiting the nursery, you travel up a circular staircase with beautiful porcelain statues on each step, leading you towards the prince's bedroom.
travel_descriptions.west: Leaving the innocent aura of the nursery behind, you cross a hallway adorned with beautiful silk carpets. Family portraits hang on the walls on either side, capturing your attention as you make your way to the opulent master bedroom.

name: Castle Kitchen
description: The castle kitchen is gigantic! There are racks and racks filled with ingredients for enough food to feed the castle every day. Ten long wooden tables take up much of the room. Along the wall are cooking instruments of every type as well as huge ovens to cook the food.
background: The kitchen castle is bustling every day. The cooks feed hundreds of people every single day! There is happy chatter from the men and women working. It is very hot in there with all the ovens!

travel_descriptions.north: Traveling from the castle kitchen to the palace kitchen is an arduous journey. The heat from the ovens and the bustling of the castle kitchen fades away as you step into a long, grand hallway. The walk is filled with anticipation and curiosity as you take in the ornate tapestries hanging from the walls, depicting tales of royal feasts and grandeur before reaching the palace kitchen. The aroma of mouthwatering food underway fills the air, the closer you get.

name: The Grand Dining Room
description: Silver and gold chandeliers hang all over the grand dining room. A big table goes across the room with chairs and a table made of the most precious wood in the kingdom. The dining room has art all over the place, sculptures and artwork is present.
background: Many feasts have taken place  in the grand dining room, deals have been reached and broken. The great dinning room holds many stories in its walls and has been the witness of many decisions across generations.

travel_descriptions.south: You leave the grandeur of the dining room, walking down a long corridor lined with portraits of past royalty. As you approach the south, the tempting aroma of food wafts your way.
travel_descriptions.east: Exit the dining room to the east and you immediately step into a hallway adorned with golden trimmings, guiding you towards the faint sound of music from the Grand Dancing Hall.

name: Inside The King'S Palace
description: The inside of the palace is completely covered in gold.  There are ornate chandeliers hanging everywhere and there is food on golden tables all hours of the day.  The king also ordered everyone to always wear gold clothing and paint there faces gold.
background: The palace was built by the Egyptians.  The king paid them with scarab beetles to build it.

travel_descriptions.outside: Walking from the gilded interior of the palace to the outside, one passes through grand hallways adorned with golden chandeliers and sumptuous artworks.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending to the foyer involves navigating a grand staircase, where every step is a reminder of the wealth and power of the kingdom.
travel_descriptions.up: Ascending to the King's Chambers requires passing through a series of luxurious antechambers and hallways, each more opulent than the last.

name: Balcony
description: The balcony of this majestic palace has a beautiful view of the city. From the balcony you are able to see far out, you can even see the outskirts of the neighboring city. The king loves to spend time lounging on the large, cushioned chairs with a book in hand as he takes in the scene and breathes in the crisp air. The railing of the balcony was handcrafted by the cities best welder and it has the most gorgeous ornate roses growing around it. The lake is not too far away and can be seen from the balcony; the king loves to watch the swans as they float around the lake. The view of the sunset is absolutely breathtaking and the king enjoys watching it every evening.
background: The queen wanted a balcony but the king was not very fond of the idea until he realized it would be the perfect place to enjoy an ice cold lemonade and a good book. He searched high and low for the perfect architect to design such an add on; he even traveled all over the land to find a qualified person for the job.

travel_descriptions.inside: Entering the large stonework doors, you ascend the grand staircase leading to the top floor of the palace where treasures gleaned from farthest corners of the kingdom await.
travel_descriptions.down: Moving down from the balcony, you enter the personal quarters, a private sanctuary adorned with portraits of past rulers and decorated with luxurious furniture and hidden treasures.
travel_descriptions.outside: Stepping off the balcony and onto the grounds outside, your destination is the grand Palace Ballroom, the pinnacle of royal extravagance, and a testament to the king's recent victory.

name: King'S Chambers
description: The room is lavish and extraordinary. Gold and silver line the room. The decor is fantastic and rubies and sapphires can be spotted.
background: The king's chambers it he most extravagant section of the castle. The room is revered by servants and peasants alike. The king and queen spend much of their time in the chambers.

travel_descriptions.east: You move from the grandeur of the King's Chambers to the cozy solitude of the King's Bedroom, passing through a short corridor lined with priceless artwork.
travel_descriptions.west: You stroll from the royal opulence of the King's Chambers to the Master Bedroom. The transition is marked by a short traverse over the elegantly carpeted walkway.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending from the King's Chambers, you find yourself heading towards the heart of the King's Palace - a dazzling display of lavishness and prosperity.

name: Master Bedroom
description: The master bedroom is the most lavish and beautiful room in the entire palace. On the ceiling is a painting made by the most famous artist in the palace, the floors are made of the most expensive marble, and gold-stitched tapestries line the walls. The mattress was made by the sleeping monks of the hidden mountains, the bed frame is made of solid god.
background: When the owner's wife ran off with the palace cook, the man's ego was wounded beyond repair. Word of his wife's infidelity spread quickly and his reputation was ruined. In order to regain his pride, the owner built this new master bedroom. Rumors say he takes a new woman to this bedroom every night and none of them can resist its charm.

travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, you traverse through a long paint-splattered corridor, portraits of past kings and queens staring unsympathetically down upon your journey into the King's Chambers.
travel_descriptions.east: Walking east, you make your way down a grand marble staircase, each step flanked by ancient stone gargoyles, leading you to the indulgent pleasures of The Bedding Room.
travel_descriptions.north: Traveling north, you pass through a bright parlor, filled with musical laughter of children and adults alike, luring you into the heartwarming confines of the Nursery.

name: Mushroom Hut
description: An odd looking hut that sits outside that Witch's cottage. It is squat, mushy, and looks like a mushroom. It is be speckled with spots - black and white. The steam of the mushroom is beige. There is a small door that looks like it would fit a puppy through it.
background: No one knows what the purpose of this mushroom is. The villagers claim that the witch houses trespassers in here when she turns them into smurfs. Others believe that the witch keeps her mangy mutt inside.

travel_descriptions.outside: Traveling from the Mushroom Hut to the Outside Gates, you pass through a winding path lined with curious flora, each more strange and whimsical than the last. The iron crest of the gates comes into view, hinting at the grandeur that sits beyond.
travel_descriptions.south: Venturing south from the Mushroom Hut towards the Garden requires navigating a gently sloping trail. You are enveloped by the sight and scent of the towering oaks. Upon arrival, the well-tended vegetable patches and medicinal flowers signal the devotion of the garden's caretakers.

name: Outside Gates
description: These outside gates are made of iron and are somewhat decorative in design.  The tops are spiked and there's a family crest that hangs on both the left and right gate telling people who resides here.
background: These gates prevent unauthorized people from entering.  They also serve to tell others which family lives here.

travel_descriptions.inside: You proceed along a winding path, dense with the fragrance of earth and foliage. The enigmatic Mushroom Hut appears, squatting curiously in a clearing.
travel_descriptions.east: You feel the earthen crunch of the cobblestone underfoot as you make your way east. The sights and scents of the rustic Front Of The Cottage come into view, a charming scene of frontier living.

name: Front Of The Cottage
description: Furs hang out on racks to try and get ready for tanning. A dog lays in front of the door into the cottage. A little herb garden is on the opposite side of the cottage to the racks.
background: A simple little cottage in the woods where a hunter has made his living. The cottage is but a simple place for a everyday man of the time. His blood hound companion guards the front door from intruders.

travel_descriptions.west: As you move towards the west, the iron gates loom larger in front of you. Their decorative design reflects a rustic charm. The family crest glimmers under sunlight, welcoming you to what lies beyond.
travel_descriptions.back: Walking towards the backyard, the vibrant green grass whispers under your feet. The smell of wet soil and fresh, ripe carrots fills the air. A glimpse of the grazing cows is a calming sight.

name: Backyard
description: Fresh Dark green grass covering the hill over the wet soil is the daily routine for a farmer. Beneath the grass are the freshly grow carrots. Addition to these beautiful living-hood are the two healthy black cows to gaze over the grass avoiding the carrot farm.
background: These freshly grown carrots by the farmer gives food and living through out the year. The winters are relayed on the cows which can give calf and provide his living for that season.

travel_descriptions.front: Walking towards the front of the cottage, you pass by furs hung out on racks and an herb garden by the side. A dog looks up from its lounging position as you approach the front door.
travel_descriptions.south: Moving south, you leave the comfort of the cottage's backyard and approach the smell of horses. Leaving the greenery behind, the landscape opens up into yellow and green plains where stables are maintained.

name: Garden
description: A wooden fenced in area with different sections depending on the type of vegetable or plant grown.  Surrounding this garden are some oak trees with low grass covering the floor.
background: This is an area where peasants plant vegetables and flowers used for medicinal concoctions.  The area is carefully maintained by the residents.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking towards the north, you move away from the lush garden and notice an unusual and enchanting sight, a mushroom-shaped hut.
travel_descriptions.east: As you head east, the fresh scent of blooming plants gives way to the distinct smell of horses, pointing you towards the stables.

name: Horse'S Stables
description: The stables smell terrible, and are riddled with brown feces on the ground. The horses are tame and magnificent brown. The open plains are yellow and green with grass.
background: The horse stables are well kept and used in preparation of war. The most well trained knights are given horses for battle and travel. The horses stables are very well respected within the community.

travel_descriptions.north: As you leave the stench of the stables and move north, the smell of fresh grass fills the air. The sound of stepping on the moist soil is comforting and the sight of a farmer tending his crops brings a sense of tranquility.
travel_descriptions.west: Moving west takes you towards a neatly fenced wooden area. You can hear the rustling of the leaves of the oak trees surrounding the garden. The mixture scent of earth and different kinds of vegetables hits your nostrils, reminding you of simpler times.
travel_descriptions.south: Heading south, you're welcomed by the sight of the extensive, green Hay Field. The chirping of birds and the distant sight of scattered tools reveal the hard work that goes into maintaining this fertile land. You can see far-off lands in the distance where the high-quality hay from this field would be sold.

name: The Hay Field
description: The Hay field is a beautiful and large place of crops stretching very far towards the horizon. Birds frequently come to sit and feed on them. The tools are scatter about here and there, as the field workers have put them down after a day of hard work. There is also a scare crow placed in the middle of the field, scaring away the birds that dare to come and feed, however it's not very effective. There are special hay carriages set on the hay field as well, ready to carry loads of crops.
background: The hay is being sold to faraway lands, it's the best quality hay in the whole kingdom and therefore this field has many workers and lots of carriages set up to carry them to marketplaces all around the kingdom.

travel_descriptions.north: To the north, across the bountiful field of hay, lies the Horse's Stables. The clear path meanders through the towering hay crops, kissed by the sunlight and peppered by gleeful chirps of roaming birds.
travel_descriptions.east: Heading east from the field, the lush green vista transitions into a queer, enchanted forest, nestled in which is the solitary Witch's Cottage. The rough dirt path is sprinkled with a careful medley of curious herbs and magical blossoms unique to the witch's gathering.

name: The Witches Cottage
description: The witches cottage has a huge cauldron in the middle of the cottage. There are shelves of glass jars that have things like spider legs, dragon toe nails, and fairy wings.  The floor is a dirt floor and the roof is made of wooden brooms.
background: The witch was banished from the kingdom, so she needed a new home.  She built the cottage from the sticks she gathered from the forest floor.

travel_descriptions.west: You make your way across a well-worn path, the bustle of the cottage fading behind you as you approach the grand expanse of the hay field. The air is thick with the smell of fresh hay and ripe crops.
travel_descriptions.inside: You step inside from the cozy warmth of the cottage into the bracing chill of the cold storage room. Your breath fogs up in the air as you maneuver between crates of stored harvest.

name: Cold Storage Room
description: The cold storage lies just beyond the cottage door. In it are various harvested vegetables, fruits, and nuts. Cured meat hangs from the ceiling by thin rope. The room is made of wood, and the wind whistles through the cracks.
background: The man of the house built this room for his wife as their family grew. Originally they only had a larder and root cellar for their harvests, but with new mouths to feed came added need for more space for food. The family works together to fill the cold storage room during harvest time.

travel_descriptions.outside: You step out of the chilled storage room into the cozy warmth of the witch's cottage, filled with the aroma of dried herbs and magical ingredients.
travel_descriptions.south: Walking south from the cold storage room, you transition from a space of life's sustenance into an area of eternal rest - a small, solemn graveyard.

name: Small Graveyard
description: This is a small grassy area located under a large oak tree.  There are two home made wooden crosses set up along with mounds where the bodies are buried.
background: This is where the residents of the cottage have buried their loved ones.  They wanted them to be close by so they can pay their respects.

travel_descriptions.north: Walking north towards the Cold Storage Room, you crunch over frosted leaves, feel the stiff breeze and take in the aroma of preserved harvest.
travel_descriptions.west: Heading west, the way to the Tool Shed reminds you of a rustic path, running parallel to well-tended vegetable patches, the air filled with an earthy scent.

name: Tool Shed
description: The tool shed is made out of mismatched pieces of wood, haphazardly nailed together. Their are shelves inside and hooks on the walls that all hold various tools for gardening and landscaping.
background: The tool shed was built by the owner of the cottage. While he is a hard worker, he tends to take short cuts to get the job done quickly so the shed is not exactly perfect looking, but it has stayed standing for several years now.

travel_descriptions.east: Leaving the tool shed, you traverse a short, worn path through well-tended greenery to the somber quiet of the small graveyard.
travel_descriptions.up: Exiting the tool shed, you ascend a low hill covered in lush, dark green grass, with the sounds of distant mooing accompanying you to the Farmer's Hill.

name: The Farmer Hill
description: the hill is a large patch of farming cattle and carrots growing in the grass. The grass is dark green and the hill's soil is moist. There are two black as night cows grazing, carefully avoiding the carrots.
background: the farmer uses his farm to be self sufficient and the only thing he can grow outside his cottage is carrots. He hopes his cows give him more cows and he will be able to survive the winter.

travel_descriptions.down: A narrow stone path snakes its way downhill from the Farmer Hill to the Tool Shed, flanked by tall, rustling grass and dotted with bright wildflowers. The sounds of the farm gradually fade as you draw closer to the wooden structure.

name: Prisoners Cells
description: The dungeon is filled with the same light of the enchanted torches. Cells line both walls and extend for what feels like miles. There are crates between each cell that store food and a change of clothes for the prisoners. You can hear trickles of water dropping in from the ceiling. It can be deafening at times.
background: The prison was created to hold the mightiest of enemies. The wizards who built it warded it as heavily as they could. Some even lost their lives by using too much magic then they could handle. They say at times you can still hear them chanting, keeping a watch over the prisoners.

travel_descriptions.east: Traveling east, you must cross through a dark and narrow tunnel that is carved directly into the natural stone. The fear of the unknown fills your mind as you pass into its chilling blackness.
travel_descriptions.down: Descending downwards into the Wet Dungeon, you feel the air become damp and thick. The sounds of dripping water echo eerily around you as you traverse down the slippery, stone steps.

name: The Lower Dungeon Guard Room
description:
This chamber, a full 30 feet below the Upper Dungeon, isn't made of stone blocks, it's hewn from the living rock of the earth.  10 by 15 feet, its domed ceiling and walls show the tool marks its excavation.  There are numerous lines of filth on the walls marking the various levels that water has risen up the walls during previous rainy seasons.

A wobbly table sits in the center of the room, but there are no chairs to go with it.  Rusty cuffs hang from rusty pegs driven into the wall.  The smell is horrific.
background: This room and its attached four cells aren't for the normal murderer or thief, they wait their sentences in the relatively salubrious Upper Dungeon.  This Lower Dungeon is for those who act against the King.  The King ensures that all the nobility know about this horrible place.

travel_descriptions.west: You make your way through the dimly lit passage, feet sinking slightly into the damp earth. The smell of mold and unknown filth fills the air as you move slowly towards the guttural hushed whispers that echo faintly from the Prisoners' Cells.
travel_descriptions.south: Cautiously descending down a narrow set of rocky stairs, you feel a cold dread wrapping around your heart. The walls close in on you as you journey towards the Torture Chamber where echoes of anguish and suffering still haunt its path.
travel_descriptions.north: Walking northward, your senses are immediately attacked by an almost metallic scent. The light flickers off arcane instruments as you journey towards the Torture Equipment Storage Room, freezing your soul with its chilling promise of dreadful horror.

name: Torture Chamber
